1.content:
It was an average day in an ordinary law office. Well, it would have been. However a package was delivered to the office inside said package was a remote with a spectacular power. The power to swap bodies around. The remote came with an instruction booklet. Not that there was any need for it. The buttons were clearly labeled "Aware swap" and "Unaware swap" respectively.
The person who received the remote was going to send the package back, but then they thought 'If someone sent this they must have wanted it to be used' The one who received the remote took it and then head off to their work. Now for the most important question The person who received this amazing remote was?
1.title: The begining

choices: Between Apollo justice and original trilogy
11.content: When does phoenix receive the package?
11.title: Phoenix

111.content:
Phoenix looked at the strange package, sighed, and put it in the same place he put all of his evidence. He didn't have any time for this. He had a case today and was horribly unprepared, there was next to no evidence in the defenses favor, the prosecutor was Edgeworth, and worst of all, his defendant was Larry. Despite being in the detention center Larry decided to take advantage of Phoenix, he's refusing to cooperate unless phoenix got him a date with "That cute Maya girl" as he put it. Phoenix got to outside the courthouse and found Maya waiting for him. "NIIIICK! you're almost late! Our client might think you aren't the greatest lawyer ever! We can't let him know that you aren't"

Phoenix ignored her after awhile and sighed. If only there was someway he could delay this trial and investigate the crime scene for evidence. Phoenix then remembered the package he received this morning. He didn't think it would work at first, but then again, he has had stranger experiences then this. He thought over his options, He could swap himself with Maya and make Larry cooperate with him. He could swap himself with the judge and immediately postpone court for a while so he could investigate more. He could even swap Edgeworth with Maya and have the prosecution make a fool of itself for a delay, which would have the added pleasure of seeing Maya in Edgeworth's body goof off in public. Phoenix reread the insturction booklet thought over his options over and over in his head. Until he decided on...
111.title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney and the strange remot

1111.content: Phoenix thought over it and finally decided that switching Edgeworth and Maya was his best option. He didn't mind doing it since Edgeworth had prevented him from investigating yesterday. He got the remote out and pointed it at Maya, who at the moment was still ranting about things. He pressed the button and nothing happened yet, due to him not selecting another person yet. As soon as court started Phoenix and Maya went to stand at the defense stand. As soon as Edgeworth came in and stood at the prosecution's stand phoenix aimed the remote and pressed the swap button. Does his plan work?
1111.title: Edgeworth with Maya

11112.content: What happened next left Phoenix dumbfounded. He must have hit the wrong button while switching Maya and Edgeworth. On the other side of the courtroom was Maya's body, with channeling robes, giving the prosecution's opening statements. However that was not nearly as strange as the sight right next to him, Edgeworth's body was giving him a pep talk and hopping up and down slightly "Don't worry Nick, we have this in the bag!" Phoenix nearly winced hearing Edgeworth's voice say that. Phoenix could hear the people in the stands in the courtroom talking. "Mr. Wright's assistant is as weird as ever, what is that thing on her outfit, a napkin?" One of the random people in the stands said. Another spoke up "Mr. Edgeworth's channeling robes are as amazing as ever! More lawyers need to dress like him!" Phoenix was making his usual sweating exhausted face. He got the remote back out to swap them back when suddenly "Mr. Wright! There is no T.V. in this court! Also, if anyone is going to try and mute people it's me! Put that thing away!" The Judge yelled at him 'Of course, the one time he is paying full attention to what I bring out' Phoenix monologued internally. Phoenix wanted to scream, not only would he have to deal with a trial he was in no way prepared for, but he would also have to deal with the confusion of the bodies around him, this was going to be a long day.
11112.title: Edgeworth: the female prosecutor in channel robes

choices: Freaking out about the swap. Plan successful, Aware swap!
Acting how she normally would. He messes up and did an Unaware swap!
1112.content:
Phoenix thought over his decisions and realized his most viable one was swapping himself with Maya and flirting with Larry so he would cooperate with them. He sighed, he knew he was going to regret this decision in a short while. He aims the remote at Maya, who is going on and off about how he isn't the greatest lawyer ever and he owes her a burger for being late, he presses the button to swap and nothing happens yet. He then aims the remote at himself, pausing for a brief moment to say goodbye to his body, and presses the button.

In an instant he notices the changes, the first thing he notices is he is much is shorter than before. He feels heavy hair hanging from his head, part of it falling in his face before he brushes it away. As he brushes it away he notices his hand, it is much smaller than normal. The next thing he notices is the loose fitting channeling robes around his body, how did Maya deal with wearing this? It felt so weird to him. After examining his body some more Phoenix remembered why he swapped in the first place, to get Larry to cooperate with him! Phoenix was about to head to the defendant lobby when he looked over to Maya who was...
1112.title: Himself with Maya

choices: Follow Phoenix as Maya talking to Larry
Follow Maya as Phoenix in the courtroom
11121.content:
Maya pointed to Phoenix and screamed "Ahhhhh! You must be Ayam Yef, My evil impostor!" As she spoke she heard her own voice, she looked down at herself. She began to feel all around herself. She screamed again. Phoenix immediately grabbed her and pulled her into the courthouse. "Maya, there is a lot of places you can scream. On the steps outside a courthouse is not one of them!" Phoenix said, which sounded odd in Maya's voice.

"NIIIIIIICK! What's going on?!" She said still panicking. "Okay, just calm down and I'll explain" Maya sat down on a chair and listened to Phoenix. This must have been odd to any bystanders since it looked like Maya was talking down to Phoenix like a child. After having to explain almost every detail of what happened twice to Maya she had calmed down a little. "Sooooo, you want to use my body to make Larry tell you everything that happened the night of the crime?" She asked. "Yes, This was the only way I could think of!" Phoenix said, not wanting to think about what he will have to do to get Larry to talk. "Why didn't you say so before we swapped?! This will be so much fun, pretending to be you while you talk to Larry!" Phoenix got a dumbfound expression "Eh?" He exclaimed. "Welllll, it's going to take a little while to convince Larry, and the trial is going to start soon. Sooooo, I'll pretend to be you in court while you talk to him. The mere thought of Maya acting up in his body made Phoenix wince, but before he could speak up he heard the voice of a Bailiff "Phoenix Wright! You are needed in the courtroom!" The Bailiff yelled. "Wish me luck!" Maya said as she ran, no, not ran, SKIPPED away in Phoenix's body

"This was a horrible idea!" Phoenix yelled to himself. He ran to the defendant's lobby to talk to Larry, Larry was not allowed in the courtroom itself due to stress he caused to everyone involved with every case he's been related to.
11121.title: Phoenix is Maya, Maya is Phoenix!

choices: Mia takes over Phoenix in Maya's body outside with Larry
Mia takes over Maya in Phoenix's body in the courtroom
111212.content:
"OBJECTION! HOLD IT! TAKE THAT!" The voice of Phoenix Wright echoed through the courtroom only to be met with a somehow even louder silence. Maya put ran her hand through her now spiky hair. "Um, that's what I'm supposed to do, right?"

A more confused than usual Gumshoe stood on the witness stand was the first to reply, "Well, yeah pal, you do yell those things, but you usually ask questions and point out things I said wrong when you do it. You don't just shout those things and then get a Not Guilty verdict."

"Ack! I don't?" Maya yelped. As sweat dripped down her face Maya said to herself, "Oh man, Nick makes all this look so easy, I didn't know there was a whole lot more to it than yelling at people til they confess something."

"Hey! Why are you trying to get me to confess pal! It's that Butz guy who's did it!"

Edgeworth looked at who he thought was Phoenix and wagged his finger in disappointment, "Detective, no need to become offended, Wright has simply lost his nerve, he's taken on a case even he knows is hopeless and is trying to bluff his way through the proceedings as usual. Only this time the evidence and our most esteemed judge will not let that happen. Right your honor?" Edgeworth gave a theatrics bow to the Judge at the end of his statement.

A little flustered and flattered the judge began to blush a little, "Why yes Mr. Edgeworth you are quite right. Mr. Wright, for your needless outburst I'm going to have to give you a penalty.

As if a little explosion of life was being taken away, Maya gasped in surprise and said to herself again, "Ack! That wasn't supposed to happen! Oh Nick, Larry. I'm sorry, I guess I'm just not good enough to be a lawyer. I'm barely good enough to channel spirits. Phoenix and Mia are supposed to be the lawyers not me, I shouldn't be pretending like this. Nick just needed me to not screw up until he got information out of Larry and I couldn't even do that right. Oh Mia, I wish you were here to help me."

Just at that moment, the spirit medium in the lawyer's body had done what she does best besides eat hamburgers, she summoned down the spirit of her sister in order to help save the day, but where did Mia take form?
111212.title: Follow Maya as Phoenix in the courtroom

choices: He was back in his body, but it still had Mia's shape
Phoenix had swapped with Mia and was now a spirit
1112122.content:
As much as Mia loved her family and the village she grew up in, she always felt more at home in the courtroom. Which was why she always comfortable whenever Maya or Pearl summoned her in court no matter the occasion no matter how grim it looked. Mia could always get a quick handle on the situation and help out in whatever way she could. Although this occasion was obviously a bit...different.

The first thing Mia noted is that Phoenix wasn't beside her in the defense side as usual when she was channeled. Instead she was all by herself. The next thing she noticed was her outfit, instead of being in Maya or Pearl's usual channeling robes, she was wearing a very familiar blue suit. Mia sighed, "Oh Phoenix what have you gotten yourself into now."

"Um...Mr. Wright...is something the matter? Do we need to take a recess?" The often confused judge looked at Mia with a confused look, Gumshoe also looked bit confused while Edgeworth just have a very noticeable twitch above his left eye as they all looked at Mia. Mia took a deep breath and looked at the court record and knew what she had to do. "No your honor, but detective I noticed a contradiction in your testimony...."

____________________________

After about an hour of going back and forth with Gumshoe and Edgeworth, Mia managed to find enough questionable evidence to prove that it couldn't have been Larry who committed the crime, although the real suspect was still out there. Mia was still getting odd looks from Gumshoe and the Judge and Edgeworth was still glaring at her with daggers in his eyes, but that didn't matter now. Mia had to get to the truth. She left the court room and right outside of it were Larry and who she thought was Maya.

Larry was the first to say something, "Wow Nick! You're sure looking a lot better than you usually do. You start using a new shampoo or something? Come on, give your secrets to your good pal Larry."

"Go home Larry, you're not guilty but knowing you that won't stick for long."

"Wow, thanks Nick! You're the greatest man! I'm going to go celebrate by getting me a new girlfriend, want to help me out with that Maya?!"

Phoenix, who's jaw hadn't been picked up off the ground since Mia entered, managed to say, "Go home Larry."

"Oh man, well, see you guys!" Larry said as he left to probably get himself into even more trouble.

"So Maya, what's going on, how did you teach Phoenix the Kurain Channeling Technique?"

Phoenix knew that he should probably tell his old boss the truth about the situation. "Well Mia you see..."

_________________________

"...and before I could get the information Maya was dragged off the court and I couldn't switch us back."

Phoenix was expecting a stern talking to from Mia, but was surprised to see that she just sighed but smiled, "Phoenix, as usual you impress me with how far you're willing to go for your clients. It probably wasn't the best time to do what you did, but your heart was in the right place."

"I guess, but my plan didn't even work, you had to come in and save the day."

"Just because it didn't work doesn't mean it wasn't worth a shot, and besides you gave me a chance to be a lawyer in court again and I appreciate that Phoenix, although you should probably switch back,"

"Yeah, you're right, this is kind of weird." Phoenix said looking at how Mia was making the buttons on his suit strain. "I'll just switch back now."

"Wait until I leave this body first!" Mia said, but it was too late, Phoenix had already activated the swap. And instantly Phoenix knew something was very very wrong.
1112122.title: Mia takes over Phoenix's body in court

choices: Contiue working like he is now, maybe it'll fix itself
Go to the Kurain temple to train
11121221.content:
As Phoenix stood over her, Maya came to consciousness on the courthouse couch she let out a big old yawn, "Oh Nick, I had the strangest dream, you were there and Gumshoe was there, and Edgeworth was there, and the judge was there and I remember wishing sis was there..." Mia finished wiping the sleep out of her eyes and finally took a good look at the person standing over her. "Oh hi sis, what are you doing here...and why are you in Nick's clothes."

Phoenix took a deep breath and filled Maya in on what happened. Maya was quite surprised, "So it wasn't a dream, I was in your body but I still managed to channel Mia...but you swapped back and now you are you again but you have Mia's body and...my head hurts."

"Mine too Maya, this is all weird and confusing." Phoenix got out his crummy cell phone and looked at his reflection in the dirty screen, he looked exactly like Mia except for the fact he still had his signature spiky hair. As he gazed into his former mentors eyes he was taken out of the moment when Maya blurted out, "Oh I know!"

"You have an idea how to get me back to normal?" Phoenix said excitedly.

"No but I think we should get some burgers! I can't think on an empty stomach."

Despite the situation, Phoenix smiled, it was one of the things Maya did best for him even if she sometimes made his wallet cry. "All right, let's go eat and talk things over."

The two went to Maya's favorite burger join and got the usual. Phoenix couldn't help but notice he was getting some weird looks but he just shrugged it off. After watching Maya eat her fill of burgers Phoenix had an idea. "I know, how about you try to channel Mia again. Maybe it will...fix me or something."

"Good idea Nick." Maya said wiping some burger remains from her outfit. She closed her eyes and strewed up her face in concentration. After about a minute she asked, "Is it working Nick?"

Phoenix looked down and saw that nothing was changing, "Sorry, nothing."

"Drat!" Maya said pouting, then another idea came to her, "Oh I know! Maybe we should go train at a Kurain temple! We could meditate under a frozen waterfall for 24 hours and lay down on a bed of nails and do all sorts of things to connect to the spirits. I'm sure that will help and it'll be fun!"

This idea did not sound at all like fun to Phoenix. "I don't know Maya, we don't know if that would work and I've got a ton of stuff to do at the office including trying to find who framed Larry, I've still got to talk to him to try and get his testimony. And then I've got other cases to work on."

"Do you want to be stuck like that forever Nick?"

"No I don't, but I don't want to get far behind on work, I've got bills to pay. Plus this might be something that just...goes away on it's own. I don't know."

Maya looked at Phoenix skeptically as Phoenix made a final decision.
11121221.title: Phoenix is back in his body...kind of...not really

111212211.content:
Phoenix gave serious thought about Maya's kurain training offer but then the thought of the stack of bills back in the office came crashing down on him. "Sorry Maya, but who knows how long that training would last and I've got to pay and that won't happen if I'm training with you. Maybe I'll go with you after we get paid for this case. Or maybe I'll get lucky and this whole having Mia's channeled body thing is just temporary."

"Maybe, but how are we going to solve the case? We don't know anything about it except that Larry didn't do it, we don't even have a real client!"

"Well then we'll have to find one, with Larry set free I'm sure the police have already put someone else in custody and I'll investigate to see if it's the right person."

Maya didn't look convinced, "But how are you going to find a lead, you didn't get any testimony out of Larry and Gumshoe and Edgeworth didn't tell you anything new after the trial."

Phoenix got out his beat up cell phone, "Then I guess I'll just have to call either Larry or Edgeworth and get some information."

"And I'll do some investigating of my own! Whoever you don't call I'll go and bug them until they tell me everything they know!" Maya said with her determined stance.

Phoenix smiled, "Thanks Maya, I appreciate it, after all we've got to get information quickly, the trail will continue and maybe even conclude tomorrow and I've got to be prepared to find the truth."

"So who are you going to call?" Maya asked.

Phoenix thought about it, he knew Larry had to have some key information on the case that could crack it wide open, on the other hand even though Edgeworth was your rival, you both really just wanted to look for the truth and used opposite sides of the court to do so.

"I know who I should meet up with," Phoenix said as he nervously dialed, "I hope this isn't too awkward." He said to himself as the phone ringed, someone picked up and Phoenix spoke quickly. "Hi there it's Phoenix...I mean. I'm Phoenix Wright's...sister...Phoebe. Phoebe Wright. He's not feeling like himself and has asked me to take up his caseload and I was hoping to meet up with you to discuss the case. Okay. Sure I'll meet you there. Bye."

Phoenix let out a sigh of relief, "That went over fairly smoothly, I've got a meeting."

Maya was excited, "Great! Now that you've set up a meeting tell me who I need to follow."
111212211.title: Stay like this for now, there's work to do

choices: Stick with Phoenix's adventure with Larry
Follow Maya with the device bugging Edgeworth
1112122111.content:
Phoenix had thought about the situation logically and knew what the best option was, "I'm going to go try to talk to Larry and find out what he knows. I wasn't able to get anything out of him when I was in your body but I know he knows something about what happened. And he didn't seem willing to tell you so I figure I'll try as someone else."

Maya nodded, "Okay, I get what you're saying. If Phoenix and Maya can't get Larry to talk, maybe Phoebe Wright can!"

"Exactly. So that means that you will be..."

Maya gave a salute, "Don't worry Nick, I won't stop bugging Edgeworth until he tells me everything he knows about everything! I'll take his car keys to stop him from getting away." Maya was about to dart out but stopped when Phoenix told her quickly, "Don't do that! I've got enough to worry about without having to defend you in court for theft!"

"Oh well, maybe I'll just tie his shoelaces together. That'll stop him! Or maybe I'll take something else." Maya said as she subtly grabbed the swapping device and left she said to Phoenix, "Take care of my sister's body!"

"It's my body Maya it's just I have Mia's...shape." Phoenix said awkwardly.

"Well then take care of my sister's shape, see you." And with that Mia left leaving Phoenix to get ready for his meeting with Larry.

______________________________________

Phoenix wasn't sure why but during their phone call Larry had insisted they meet over supper at one of Phoenix's least favorite places in the world, Tres Bien. Phoenix entered the almost completely empty pink restaurant to be greeted by the proprietor Jean Armstrong. "Ah, you must be misure Butz dining partner. Let me show you to your seat." Jean took Phoenix by the arm and took him to a special table with a strong vanilla candle and Larry waiting for him at the other side of the table. Larry quickly stood up upon seeing Phoenix and ran to the other side of the table to pull out the chair. "I'll leave you two to chat while I prepare your meal, the Tres Bien special for two!"

"Thanks." Phoenix said as he sat down with a fake smile. He couldn't tell who was protesting more, his stomach or his wallet.

Larry sat down across from you and said with a chuckle, "This is one of my favorite places to eat, it's super special and I hope you like it."

"I'm sure I'll...like it." Phoenix lied.

"I can't believe Nick!"

Phoenix looked at Larry, stunned for a moment, what couldn't he believe about him? That he'd gotten him out of jail again? "What about...him?"

"I can't believe he's been hiding a cutie sister like you from me, the jerk!"

"Gah, um well...I've never told my friends about him so we're even." Phoenix said on the fly. Of course he'd never told Larry about 'Phoebe'. She didn't exist until
the whole body swap mixed with channeling gone wrong episode that Phoenix found himself in. Wanting to get the info he came here for Phoenix started, "So Larry about what you saw..."

But he was cut off by Larry ducking under the table. Phoenix thought about bending under too to see what he could be looking at, but after a beat Larry struggled to pull up on the table a giant arrangement of flowers. "I got this for you. I hope you like them."

"What?! But how could you afford something like this when you can't even pay your legal fees!"

Larry smiled as his cheeks turned pink, "Well...I work a lot of jobs. And as for Nick, I know that he just wants me to be happy and getting things for nice people like you makes me happy. Nick's my best friend, I know he'd understand."

I most certainly do not! Phoenix thought looking at the flowers that had to have cost over $100. "Well if you don't want to pay Phoenix for your legal fees, why don't you pay me?"

Larry looked like he was about to cry, "Do-do-do you not like the flowers?"

Seeing his friend upset Phoenix overcorrected, "No no of course I do! I just love them I just,"

"You LOVE them!!?!!?" Larry seemed to have certainly perked up.

Oh man, I hope Maya's doing better with Edgeworth. Phoenix thought miserably to himself.
1112122111.title: Phoenix is meeting with Larry

11121221112.content:
Maya wasn't doing so good on her side of things either. Not as bad as Phoenix was doing with Larry, but not good. She had been at Edgeworth's office pestering him for at least an hour now and he would not even consider helping them with the investigation.

"Mr. Edgeworth. Won't you at least think about helping us?" Maya said while standing inf front of Edgeworth's desk.

Edgeworth was going through some files, barely paying attention to Maya "For the 17th time, no. Now if you please leave, I am very busy working on this and other important cases." Edgeworth said, turning a page in the file he was reading.

"But Why?!!?" Maya practically whined, hoping that getting him annoyed would eventually change his mind. She wished Edgeworth wasn't always so stubborn

Edgeworth winced at her whine, but decided to answer, hoping to keep her quiet. He looked up at her and began to speak "Because I am a prosecutor and Wright is a defense attorney. We are rivals, while I personally think of him as a friend, we can not work together. We may both work to find the truth but if we both pursued it from the same angle, it could escape our grasp. I conduct my investigations with the help of the police, however, sometimes we miss an important detail. This is where Wright and his own personal investigations come in. He finds what we missed and gets to the truth in his own way. I do hope you understand." Edgeworth answered. Hopefully satisfying Maya.

Although Maya was listening to every word Edgeworth said, she decided to focus in on one part. "So, if you weren't a prosecutor, you would have no problem working with Nick?" Maya asked, slowly reaching for the swapping remote she had up her sleeve.

Edgeworth sighed and looked back to his file. "Yes, I suppose in that scenario we would work together. However, if your trying to convince me to quit my profession as a prosecutor, then you're simply babbling nonsense." Edgeworth bluntly told her.

Maya got a devious grin on her face "Oh, I bet I can get you to stop being a prosecutor in 5 minutes!" She Said with a slight laugh in her voice.

Edgeworth looked up at her, a slightly annoyed look on his face "Fey." He said with the same serious tone he usual spoke to Phoenix with. "Stop this nonsense before I have to forcibly remove you from this office." Edgeworth closed with files, reached for a phone, and began to dial security.

"Wait! How about we make a bet! Just give me 5 minutes! If I can't get you to stop being a prosecutor and investigate with Nick in five minutes, I won't come here to bother you for three months!" Maya begged. Nick would often send her down to deal with Edgeworth. Both her and Edgeworth were sick of needing security to come up and remove her from the building.

Edgeworth stopped dialing, although he didn't put the phone away. The idea of Maya not bothering him for three months was promising. "You said bet, meaning you would benefit if you won. What do you want in exchange?" He asked her, admittedly curious about what she wanted.

"A three month supply of burgers!" Maya said with a smile and a bit of a jump.

Edgeworth was nearly face planted, although he should have seen the coming from a mile away. He thought over the offer. "Five minutes." He said.

Maya nearly jumped with joy. She got the remote from out of her sleeve, pointed at Edgeworth, and pressed the button. In an instant they were swapped.
11121221112.title: Follow Maya with the device bugging Edgeworth

choices: It's Maya and Edgeworth acting different
It's Gumshoe who's come to arrest Larry's suspicious girlfriend
111212211122.content:
As Maya was in the middle of creating a fiasco at the prosecutors office, Phoenix found he was in a bit of a pickle himself. At the table for two at Tres Bien not only did Phoenix find himself surrounded by flowers, but by chocolates, stuffed animals, and a number of other gifts that Larry seemed to have an infinite number of. And each time Larry would give Phoenix a gift, Phoenix would tentatively turn it down. And when that happened Larry always started to tear up and break down making Phoenix feel back and Phoenix would overreact and tell him how much he loved his new present.

Larry was on a euphoric high after Phoenix reluctantly accepted his gift of a scented shampoo, "I gotta say Phoebe, seeing your smile makes it worth all the jobs I work and then some. You're so cute I'd get arrested a hundred times over for you! Oh and then you'd defend me in court like a fierce warrior princess and I would ride with you into the sunset where we'd live happily ever after!"

Phoenix perked up the mention of Larry being arrested, maybe this was the opening he was looking for. "Larry if you get arrest, I don't know if I could save you every time."

"What are you talking about, of course you could, Nick does it all the time and you're like a thousand times better and smarter and cuter than he is."

Thanks Larry, Phoenix thought a little annoyed, "But I can't defend you unless you're completely honest with me and you..."

Larry broke down in tears again and shouted as loud as he could, "ALL RIGHT I ADMIT IT!" Phoenix accidentally knocked over one of his many new stuffed animals as Larry continued, "I admit it! There were other women before you, but their done! Over. Kaput! I've only got eyes for you Phoebe, now and forever more until the Earth exploses and the aliens take over."

Phoenix banged his hands on the Tres Bien table knocking down even more of Larry's presents, "HOLD IT! I'm not talking about that, you haven't been honest with me about where you were and what you were doing the other night, I need to know because if you don't tell me you might get arrested again and sent to jail for the rest of your life and I won't be able to help you."

Larry looked very meek, "It doesn't matter if I got to jail, I'll have your love to keep me warm!"

"Larry! If you don't tell the truth I'm walking out of here and you'll never see me again!" Pheonix was so annoyed with Larry at this point he almost meant what he was saying.

Larry for a brief moment got a serious look on his face, "All right, if it means that much to you and our relationship, I'll tell you."

Larry then spent the next few minutes giving his testimony. It turns out he was at the scene of the crime to go on a date with a woman (surprise surprise) and was stood up and was so embarrassed that he was stood up he didn't want to tell anyone he was even there. But when he was there he saw a mysterious woman in the distance, he thought it was his date but she ran when she saw him so Larry didn't think it could be her.

Phoenix finished writing down his Larry's testimony and put it in the court record. He didn't know how much this would help crack the case, but it would help figure out what happened and help the police find the real killer. Still looking down Phoenix said, "Thanks Larry. You've been a big help, but you should really go tell the police about what you saw."

"You're right I guess. No problem Phoebe, you're the best girlfriend a guy could ask for," Phoenix was stunned at hearing the word 'girlfriend' but before he could correct Larry on this matter, Phoenix looked up just in time to be be kissed by one of his best friends. "I already paid, I'll see you later Phoebe."

Phoenix just sat in his chair frozen for a while before leaving to vomit, it was the first time that had happened at Tres Bien and the cause wasn't the food. Walking like a zombie, Phoenix finally made it back to Wright and Co. law offices where he was surprised to see that somebody was waiting for him.
111212211122.title: Back to Phoenix and Larry at Tres Bien

choices: Stay with Phoenix and Edgeworth as Maya
1112122111221.content:
Phoenix walked into his office, a blank expression on his face. When he entered he saw Maya and Edgeworth talking about something. Phoenix was in too much shock to listen to their conversation, though he did keep his eye on them as he flopped down onto the couch. Maya pointed at him and appeared to ask Edgeworth something to which Edgeworth nodded. Maya began to walk over to Phoenix, looking angry.

"Wright, I want a full explanation, now. "What appeared to be Maya demanded while tapping her foot and angry scowl on her face.

It took Phoenix a few second to process that Maya was acting differently, he then realized that she was talking and exactly like exactly. "Edgeworth?" Phoenix asked.

"Yes, Wright. As you can see, Ms. Fey has shown me what that swapping device's capabilities." Edgeworth replied, very annoyed at the situation. "She also informed me after our own swap that you currently have the body of your mentor Mia Fey." Edgeworth continued, doing one of his signature finger wag/points. "Be honest with me Wright. Where did you get this device?"

Phoenix was still trying to process this whole day himself. Maybe it was better to let Edgeworth in on the details. He explained how he had no idea where the package came from and that the only thing included with the remote was the instruction manual.

Edgeworth paced back and forth thinking Phoenix's story over. It didn't make any logical sense, however, Edgeworth was in no position to deny the fact that the remote did work. His thinking was interrupted when his own body literally hopped between his and Phoenix's conversation.

"Guess what Nick! Edgeworth said that he would help us investigate what happened with Larry!" Maya said, hopping with joy. Which was a sight that would make anyone stare in shock. She had the swapping remote in her hands

Before Phoenix can ask why, Edgeworth began to explain. "Ms. Fey made a wager with me, she used the remote to win. There's nothing else you need to know Wright." Edgeworth explained, not wanting to go into the full details of the bet.

"Speaking of..." Maya began, as if on cue. "Time for you to pay your half of the bet!" Maya demanded of Edgeworth.

"Fine. Switch us back and I will give you your reward." Edgeworth responded, getting impatient about being in Maya's body.

"No way! If I switch us back you won't have a reason to give me those burgers!" Maya said, pocketing the swapping remote.

"Ms. Fey! Swap us back right now!" Edgeworth said, starting to get angry. Though his usual angry expression looked cute on his new body. He reached toward his own body's coat pocket

"No way!" Maya said and took a few steps back, causing Edgeworth to trip and fall. Edgeworth got back up and began to practically stomp toward Maya, who began to run around the room.

Phoenix laid down on the couch, he was too exhausted for this. As Maya kept running from Edgeworth she stuck her hands into her new coat's pockets. In it she found something REALLY interesting. She pulled it out and showed it to Edgeworth and Phoenix. "Look what I found! Car keys and a wallet!" She gloated, causing Edgeworth to pale up. "Maybe you won't have to reward me Edgeworth! I can pay for them myself now!" Before Edgeworth could do anything Maya had run out the door, keeping the swapping remote with her.
1112122111221.title: It's Maya and Edgeworth acting different

11121221112212.content:
Edgeworth just stood there in shock at the situation he was in. Maya had taken not only his car and money, but his body as well. He turned to Phoenix and started to make demands "Wright, were does Maya usually go to eat burger? I need to get there before she spends all of the money in my wallet!"

Phoenix was still lying on the couch, staring at the ceiling in disbelief over the incident with Larry. "I don't know. She eats burgers from plenty of places, she might go to them all."

Edgeworth nearly turned pale at the thought of Maya going all over town in his body, stopping at every burger joint she came across. "Wright, we need to go find her!" he yelled. "We'll take your car."

"I don't have a car." Phoenix groaned, not wanting anything to do with Maya and Edgeworth's situation.

Edgeworth was ready the bang his head against the wall at this point. There was absolutely nothing he could do to catch up with Maya. He could try chasing her on foot, but that would be a waste of time. Not only did he have no idea where she was going, but she was also in a car while he was on foot. Plus, it was getting late, wandering the streets in a young girls body would probably be dangerous.

"If she damages the car, I'll be forwarding the bill to you, Wright." Edgeworth said, and expression of anger on his face. He went to sit down on a spare chair that Phoenix kept around the office.

After a few minutes of silence, Edgeworth spoke up. "Despite the current circumstance, I intend to keep my end of the wager with Ms. Fey." Edgeworth began, referring to the case that Larry was just proven Not Guilty in. He went over to Wright's desk and picked up some case files that he had brought with him. "This everything I obtained in my investigation with the police. While our only initial suspect was Butz, there was some evidence that just didn't fit with that theory. While Mia Fey, being channeled to your body, in court earlier used this contradictory evidence to win a not guilty verdict, it still raises the questions of WHY we have this evidence and WHO actually committed the crime." Edgeworth said, shuffling through the evidence. "As far as my investigations go, there was no one else at Gourd Lake that night." Edgeworth continued, showing Wright the profiles of who was involved with this case. "Ms. Fey informed me that you didn't conduct your own investigation yet. I shall assist you. We should leave immediately."

Phoenix sat up and looked out the window and saw that the sun had set. He wondered if he and Edgeworth should return to the crime scene now or wait till morning. On one hand, it would be much easier to miss evidence in the dark than during daylight. On the other hand, the real culprit may return to the scene and destroy evidence if they wait till morning. What did Phoenix decide to do?
11121221112212.title: Stay with Phoenix and Edgeworth as Maya

choices: They find something...or someone at Gourd Lake
They run into Larry looking for a second date
111212211122122.content:
Phoenix looked at the clock hanging on the wall and groaned, "It's way too late to go out investing. Besides, we don't have to go to court tomorrow so we'll have all day to investigate with no distractions."

"No distraction?!" Edgeworth said making Maya's face look about as mad as Phoenix had ever seen it.

"I mean no courtroom distractions, besides, you aren't the only one who's had a life altering experience today," Phoenix said gesturing to himself.

"Fine. You're right Wright. Sorry." Edgeworth said gruffly crossing his arms. There was some silence between the two rivals before Edgeworth broke the silence. "Where does Maya usually sleep? I should probably go there since I don't have my keys and don't want to risk be caught breaking into my own home."

"Maya sometimes takes the bus to Kurain village but when it's this late I usually let her stay in the office. Heck I usually sleep here more often than my own bed, it feels more like home." Phoenix smiled to himself, he'd only ever told Maya that and maybe it was because it was Maya's body but he felt comfortable telling Edgeworth this.

"Ah. That's very..." Edgeworth not quite sure what to say gave a quick cough and changed the subject, "Well Wright. Do you have a secret bed you want to tell me about or do I sleep on the burger wrappers."

"There are sleeping bags and pillows in the closet, you can take the couch, I'll take the floor, or my desk, or whatever makes me more comfortable."

Edgeworth went to the closet and pushed aside an oddly placed step ladder, he pulled out two sets of pillows and sleeping bags. Wanting to get the day over with and trying not to think about what Maya was doing to his bank account Miles Edgeworth got in the sleeping bag on the couch. Maya's accolite robes weren't as comfortable as his normal expensive custom made pajamas, but they were comfortable enough for Edgeworth to eventually drift off to sleep.

Phoenix kicked a bunch of trash and strewn about paperwork into a corner and put his sleeping bag on the ground. Thinking back on the day Phoenix had to admit he didn't completely hate the weirdness of it all, and it somehow resulted in a not guilty verdict for Larry and the first real lead on the case. Although Phoenix did wish for a moment he was in his home so he could at least use some mouthwash to wash the last remains of Larry's kiss away. The last thought Phoenix thought before finally drifting off was, I wonder if mind bleach is a real thing?

The next morning the two lawyers got up bright and early. They were a little nervous that they hadn't heard from Maya yet (Well, Phoenix was worried about Maya while Edgeworth seemed worried about his possessions) but they knew they had a job to do. Phoenix changed into another blue suit. It was awkward but he was familiar enough with his suits that he could do it with his eyes closed...and in this case he made sure his eyes stayed shut as he changed out of respect for his mentor.

Once he was done changing he and his assistant for the day opened the door to try to begin the investigation.
111212211122122.title: Sleep now, investigate later

choices: Phoenix is able to convince Larry to not take him on the boat
1112122111221222.content:
Phoenix and Edgeworth arrived at gourd lake. The crime scene was typical for this kind of crime, a murder. Somehow Phoenix and his friends always got involved with cases like this. The general area surrounding the public beach had been sealed off by police tape. However, no police were there at the moment, probably because the initial police investigation had ended. There was an outline of where the body was was outlined in white chalk as usual. There was a bloody cart that sold samurai samurai dogs.

"Shall we begin our investigation?" Edgeworth asked

"Uh, yeah." Phoenix replied, seeing Maya's body talk in such a professional way was very odd to say the least.

"We won't rest until we investigated every nook and cranny." Edgeworth said on habit.

"Uh, right. You go over by the lake itself. I'll look around this area." Phoenix explained and sent Edgeworth off. Phoenix walked over to the samurai dog stand to investigate. Strange, this stand seemed familiar. Phoenix tried to remember where this stand belonged to. "That's right this stand is - oh no." Phoenix said plainly as he remembered

"Hey Phoebe!" Larry shouted from behind Phoenix, causing Phoenix to turn around. Before Phoenix could say anything Larry had brought him into a hug. After Larry stopped hugging him, he handed Phoenix some chocolate.

"What are you doing here?!" Phoenix yelled as chocolate was shoved in his face. Which Phoenix took out of habit from last night.

"I work here! I'm the, uh, most successful seller of Samurai Dogs sold at Gourd lake." Larry bluffed in an attempt to sound cool.

Phoenix rolled his eyes "Why are you at the crime scene?! Didn't the police tape give you the idea to stay away"

"Police tape? You mean the yellow jump rope stuff? I just ignored it. It's one of the lamest toilet paper pranks ever." Larry explained "Plus, I saw you past the tape. I knew it was a sign that it was our destiny to meet here and have the perfect date! " He smiled.

Phoenix was ready to puke, again, as Larry talked about another date. Before he could say anything Larry had taken his hand. "C'mon, Phoebe. This beach is boring. I know a nice boat we could ride in the lake on!" Larry exclaimed and began dragging Phoenix to the boat rental shop. This one NOT going to be a pleasant experience. Phoenix tried his best to think a way out of this situation.
1112122111221222.title: They run into Larry looking, for a second date

choices: Edgeworth ran into Pearl looking for Mystic Maya
Edgeworth runs into Jean Armstrong who wants his waitress back
11121221112212221.content:
Knowing he wanted to ditch Larry for any reason possible, when they got to the boat rental shop Phoenix said put on a tone of fake sorrow and said, "Oh no, it loos like the place is close. Well I've got to go see you later Lar..."

"Wait you don't have to go!" Larry said cutting off Phoenix, "It's not closed, well it is, but I can open it up!"

Phoenix still wanted to get away but his curiosity was taking over. "What do you mean you can open it up?"

"Well...I actually run that boat rental shop." Larry said with a dopey smile.

"But...just...why? How?"

"Well...I don't mean to scare you, but this boat house was run by a murderer! But me, Nick, and Edgeworth made sure he was put in jail. I did most of the work though, don't let Nick tell you any different." Phoenix groaned as Larry said this. Sure Larry's testimony during that case had been vital but Phoenix had to do a lot of digging through Larry's murky testimony. "And when the murderer Yogi guy went to jail the people who own the land needed someone to run the boat house and they saw I worked just over there at the Samurai Dog stand so they hired me on the spot."

So they just didn't bother finding anyone qualified. Phoenix thought to himself. "Well, that's neat and explains a whole lot. But I don't think I want to ride on a boat with you right now."

"No need to be nervous Phoebe! I mean, just because the guy who used to own this place took a dude out on a boat and shot him doesn't mean I'd do that to you! I mean the girl I liked before you used to take some dude out on the lake all the time It's actually how I met her. I thought it looked super cool and romantic so I wanna take you."

What Larry said struck a chord with Phoenix's lawyer mind, "That girl you keep mentioning to me..."

"I hope you're not jealous! It's cool that you want to fight her over me. I've always wanted to see a catfight, but even if she pulls your hair and stuff I'll love you anyways!"

"NO! Larry, focus, that girl you keep mentioning. You said she hung out with a guy out here," Phoenix started looking in the case file until he found what he was looking for, a picture of the victim. "Was this the man she would go out on the boat with?"

Larry looked at the profile picture for a second before saying, "Yeah Phoebe, I think that's the dude...wait! Why do you have a picture of another man!" Larry looked like he was about to start crying. Phoenix put the picture away but before he could focus on this breakthrough in the case he had to deal with the Butz.

"Larry it's nothing, it's all just a part of a case, now could you tell me something more about what they did out here?"

Larry got stars in his eyes as he grabbed Phoenix's hand and said, "I got a better idea, I'll show you!" And before Phoenix could protest again, the two were on a rowboat and were already on Gourd Lake. Phoenix decided to ignore Larry as he rowed and just tried to look around the lake and it's shores to see if he could see something but nothing stood out. "Larry, do you know just what exactly they were doing out here?"

Larry nodded, "They were doing this!" And Larry ripped open his shirt. Phoenix gasped and looked away afraid of where Larry was taking this but a few seconds later a hurt sounding Larry said, "Did I do something wrong?"

Phoenix slowly turned to look at Larry and Phoenix's jaw hit the ground. Apparently under Larry's clothes he was wearing a full scuba outfit, oxygen tank and all. "But...just...why? How?" Phoenix asked for the second time in minutes. Larry was certainly full of surprises lately.

"The people who own the land were looking for a scuba instructor and saw me by the Samurai Dogs and hired me on the spot."

The people who run this place really need to extend their job search beyond the hot dog stand. Phoenix thought before realizing why Larry stripped down. "So...the victim and that woman were diving at the lake? Why?"

"I don't know, but it was always in this area and they'd always bring a box with them. I think they were fishing for lobsters."

"Hmm, I need to find out what's down there. Larry, do you think you could go down there and get the box for me? Please?" Phoenix said not realizing how cute Larry found him asking.

"At once! One lobster dinner for my cutey coming right up!" Larry fell out of the boat and a minute later he emerged with a box. Phoenix quickly opened it seeing that it was full of cash. "What in the world were those two up to?" Phoenix said to himself as Larry rowed them back to shore. With box in hand Phoenix said, "Thanks Larry, you've been a lifesaver."

"Anything for you babe!" Larry said and once again surprised Phoenix with another kiss on the lips. It was said that you could hear Phoenix's internal screaming all the way to the Kurain village.

Meanwhile, Edgeworth in Maya's body had gotten tied up with someone at the other end of the lake.
11121221112212221.title: Phoenix and Larry's Romantic(?) boat ride

choices: Edgeworth ends up going to Kurain village
Edgeworth convinces Pearl that he can't go
111212211122122211.content:
Edgeworth was investigating the crime scene by the lake. He had not run into any evidence that he hadn't during his initial investigation, however, it did no harm to double check. He discovered many footprints, meaning that no citizens were bothering to obey the police tape. As he investigated he looked across the lake and saw a boat. On instinct he looked out toward the boat. Maya's eyes were better than his, he was starting to need glasses but he didn't want to get any. He looked at the boat and saw...Phoenix and Larry!

"What possible reason could he have for going there?" He questioned aloud. He hoped that Wright actually had a reason and didn't just leave all the actual investigating to him. Before Edgeworth could think anymore he was interrupted by a loud voice.

"Mystic Maya!" A young voice yelled to him.

As Edgeworth turned around a young girl ran toward him and embrace him in a hug. He recognized the girl as Maya's young cousin Pearl. "What are you doing here?" He asked

"A person came to the village and said they wanted a spirit channeled. I came all the way to town on the tray-in to get you. I went to Mr. Nick's place, but you weren't there." Pearl said, then began to cry "I've been running all of the city looking for you." She cried.

Edgeworth couldn't help but feel sad for the young girl. He let Pearl continue hugging him until she was done crying. Once he was done he ended the hug and began to lecture her. "It was very irresponsible of you to wander around the city with no destination in mind. You could have gotta hurt or worse in a city like this." In his own body this would have sounded like he was ridiculing her, in Maya's body it was nothing more than a motherly lecture.

After his lecture Pearl had seemed to cheer up. She was probably happy that Maya, or who she thought was Maya, was happy to see her. She then grabbed Edgeworth's arm and began to pull him along. "C'mon, we have to get to the village so you can channel that spirit!" She said.

Edgeworth walked along with Pearl for a little while as he thought of a way to avoid going to Kurain village. He knew nothing of spirit channeling and he didn't want to waste investigation time going to some strange village.
111212211122122211.title: Edgeworth ran into Pearl looking for Mystic Maya

choices: Kitaki's wife Plum arries to get her husband out of there
1112122111221222111.content:
"Young miss I'm afraid I don't have time for...spirit channeling. I have to investigate a very important case." Edgeworth said pulling Maya's channeling robes from Pearl's grasp.

Pearl let out a cute little gasp before covering most of her head with her hands, "Are you doing something for your...special someone." Pearl said turning a shade of red. Edgeworth stumbled back a few steps turning a bit red himself. "Special...someone...no I'm just investigating a very important murder trial at the moment. I'm working with Phoenix Wright and I can not afford any distractions from any channeling or any...special anybody's. So please go to your home and leave me be and try to find someone else to channel whomever it is you need to speak with."

Pearl nodded, "Yes Mystic Maya, I know you need to help out Mr. Nick. I'll just have to try to summon the spirit myself." Pearl rolled up her sleeves and pulled out a picture of a man. Out of curiosity Edgeworth happened to glance at the picture and snatched it from Pearl's hands. "The murder victim!" Edgeworth couldn't believe it, he'd been out searching for clues and one had appeared before him thanks to this little girl. "Young miss...Pearl I believe. Who wants Maya to summon the victim?"

Pearl looked at Edgeworth with a very confused look on her face, but she answered, "Um...I don't know the man, I only saw him for a minute. He had big eyebrows and wanted to meet with you Mystic Maya." "And this man is waiting in Kurain village for...me. Yes?"

Pearl nodded, "Well it looks like I'll be going with you after all. I may be able to get some new clues from this man who seemed to know the victim." Edgeworth looked back out to the lake and saw Phoenix and Larry were still out there and groaned as he continued to speak to himself, "I don't know what you're doing Wright but it better not be as big a waste of time as it seems. Right." Edgeworth turned back to Pearl. "Take me to this village. Lead the way."

___________________________

After a long trip Edgeworth and Pearl set foot in Kurain village where there was a very intimidating presence waiting for them. "You're late." A soft and low voice spoke, but the voice was clear and Edgeworth knew this wasn't a man to be trifled with. It took a moment but after Edgeworth saw him he knew who it was. The tall man before them was Winfred Kitaki. A man who had a hand in a lot of crime but as much as the prosecutions office tried they could never make anything stick. Edgeworth straightened up and gave a polite bow, "I'm sorry for being late, now before we attempt to do the spirit channeling I'm going to have to ask you a number of questions concerning the victim, I mean the spirit."

Kitaki didn't seem to enthused to be answering questions he would never have answered from a cop or prosecutor, but he seemed to really need the help of the spirit channeler so he reluctantly answered. Edgeworth grilled Kitaki for an hour about the victim and found some useful information. It turns out the victim worked for Kitaki and seemed to have made off with a good chunk of money. He was trying to track him down when the victim turned up dead. Kitaki believed the victim's personality changed as soon as he met some mysterious woman.

While Kitaki had given Edgeworth plenty of information that made him suspicious, it seems obvious that Kitaki wasn't the killer. Edgeworth stood up to leave to make it back to the city to compare notes with Phoenix when Kitaki's voice softly said, "Now please Mystic Maya, I've told you what I know. Now summon the no good rat and help me out." Edgeworth froze, he had no idea how to summon a spirit, he barely knew anything about the process. Edgeworth stammered, "Well yes...indeed...if you will just give me a moment's time I believe I can arrange..." When all of the sudden something happened that made Edgeworth's jaw drop.
1112122111221222111.title: Edgeworth ends up going to Kurain village

choices: Edgeworth is interrupted before he leaves the village
11121221112212221112.content:
Edgeworth's jaw dropped as he saw who had just entered the room. The infamous Plum Kitaki, the gangster wife of Winfred Kitaki. Edgeworth had to admit, he felt a bit nervous right now. Two of the most infamous criminals that he knew about were in the same room as him. He stayed calm though, while these two would be wary of any prosecutors in the same room as them, they would have no reason to be wary of a spirit medium.

"Winfred, what are you doing? I told you not to come to ask these spirit mediums for help! This rat stole money from us, so we will be the ones to fix this problem." Plum Said in a serious, almost threatening voice to her husband.

Winfred Kitaki appeared to want to say something, but he gave into his wife's demands. "Alright little Plum. We'll find him ourselves."

Plum seemed to cheer up a bit. "Good. I already have some of our men investigating his murder and looking for the money." Plum said.

"Good." Winfred said and then turned to Edgeworth "My apologies for taking up your time Mystic Maya. Also, forget the conversation that you just heard." Winfred's voice got threatening on that last sentence.

As Winfred and Plum left, Edgeworth let out a relieved sigh. After getting over the nervous situation he was just in, he gathered his thoughts. He needed to get back to Wright and tell him about the information that he had learned from Winfred Kitaki. The two of them would also have to be more careful in their investigation now. The Kitaki's were searching for the money that the victim had stolen before he died. If Wright and Edgeworth ran into that money during investigation, then there was a near guarantee of trouble with the Kitaki's

With all this new information, Edgeworth found there was no need to stay around Kurain village.
11121221112212221112.title: Kitaki's wife Plum arries to get her husban...

choices: Phoenix goes to look for Maya and the remote
111212211122122211123.content:
When Larry asked 'Phoebe' after their kiss why she had been gargling lake water for the last half hour Phoenix told him, "It's tradition." Before getting back to the gargling in an effort to wash all the Larry away. Eventually Larry had to leave 'Phoebe' alone, a bunch of guys in trench coats and sunglasses seemed to want to talk to him about stuff around Gourd Lake because as it turns out he was also the lake's tour guide.

As soon as his mouth went numb from too much lake water Phoenix decided he'd had enough and went to look around for Edgeworth with the money safely put away in the court record. After searching for a while and not having any luck he decided to call him on his cell phone. "Edgeworth? Where are you? I can barely hear you?"

"Got dragged to Kurain village by that girl Pearl, but it worked out, I found valuable information Wright!"

"What are you doing all the way in Kurain Edgeworth!"

"It's a long story, tell you later. I discovered the victim was hiding money from the infamous Kitaki family and..." Edgeworth went on to tell Phoenix everything he'd overheard from Plum and Winfred. As he told the story Phoenix's eyes went wide, "Um Edgeworth I made some progress of my own. I think I may have found the money they are looking for, it was underwater at Gourd lake."

"It's good that you found the evidence, but you need to be careful. The Kitaki's are looking for that money too and if somehow find out you have it...well I don't have to tell you what the Kitaki's are capable of."

Phoenix gulped, he had indeed heard the horror stories. "Don't worry the only people who know I have this are you, me, and...Larry." Phoenix suddenly remembered the suspicious people who Larry was showing around the lake. "Uh oh."

"Listen Phoenix you need to get out of there. You need to go to the police, turn over the money, and put yourself under witness protection!"

"Or I can find Maya, she's got the device and if I can mess with the remote enough I may finally be able to lose Mia's body and turn back into Phoenix. After all they'll be looking for 'Phoebe', not Phoenix."
111212211122122211123.title: Phoenix connects the dots

1112122111221222111232.content:
Not wanting to be put under witness protection. Phoenix decided to find out where Maya went and get his own body back. "I'm going to find Maya, meet me at my office in about 2 hours." Phoenix said to Edgeworth.

"Understood. I'll get on the train immediately, be careful Wright." Edgeworth said before hanging up

Phoenix thought about where Maya would have went and where she would be now. She couldn't have been out going to eat burgers for the past few hours, we she could have but Phoenix doubted that she would spend all of the money in Edgeworth's wallet. She couldn't have gone back to Kurain, Edgeworth would have had to see her over there if she was there.

Thinking it over, Phoenix thought of some locations she could be right now, nothing definitive, but still possible. The first was his office, it had been hours since she left, she could have gotten bored and decided to go back to the office.

Another location he thought of was Edgeworth's own office. She was in his body right now, maybe she would go to his office now that she was allowed to go there without fear of being kicked out.

Both a these places were possible, but it was also possible Maya was at neither of them. It was a long shot weather or not he would even find her at all at this point. With the first two thoughts still in his head, Phoenix began to think of other places Maya could be at.

While he had a few more thoughts in his head, he concluded that standing around Gourd lake thinking about it wasn't getting him anywhere, especially with those suspicious people walking around earlier. With a destination in mind, Phoenix began to make his way to...
1112122111221222111232.title: Phoenix goes to look for Maya and the remote

Edgeworth was just staring at disbelief at what was going on, he could only mutter one word "What?" After he uttered the word he recognized who the man was, he was the owner of that French restaurant that detective Gumshoe had invited him to on occasion, though he couldn't think of the man's name

"Mademoiselle Bride, she, 'ow do you say, quit. I vas 'ondering if per’aps you could fill 'er place as a waitress." Armstrong begged with teary eyes.
