His only hope at this point was to talk Armstrong out of bringing him along.
111212211122122212.title: Edgeworth runs into Jean Armstrong who wants hi...

choices: Phoenix tries to save the day
Franziska learns of Edgeworth's embarrassing day
1112122111221222121.content:
"Sir I must insist you cease and desist!" Edgeworth called out as he was being dragged to a pink convertible. "I must stress that I have not and shall never be a waitress," Armstrong opened the door for and practically lifted Edgeworth's now small frame into the seat and locked the door. Before Edgeworth could manage to undo the blasted lock on the car, Armstrong was already in the drivers seat and was already on the road. He seemed full of determination to bet back to his restaurant now that he had someone to work for him. "Mademoiselle, zat is zee spirit! You are not meerly a waitress. You are zee cream of zee crop and shall bring love and joy from zee kitchens to zee people of the vurld! It brings a tear to my eye."

Edgeworth continued to try and beat it into Jean that he was not interested in working for him but Armstrong did not listen and kept going until they reached Tres Bien. Edgeworth had only seen pictures of the place due to the case there a ways back and it seemed to him to still have the...unique charm it had before. He felt he was going to suffocate on the lack of proper elegance but he could have time for that later. Before he knew it he had been shoved into a locker room and told to hurry up.

Edgeworth had never seen something so...orange in his life. He did not want to touch the thing let alone wear it, but with Armstrong and his oddly unnerving eyes stuck in his head Edgeworth decided it best to get it over with and not let anyone ever find out about this. He reluctantly put on the uniform. He did it quickly and as respectfully as he could for Maya's sake. Finally he emerged from the dressing room ready for the 'lunch rush' that Armstrong insisted was coming.

But to Edgeworth's confusion the rush never came. The only customer Edgeworth had to wait on was an old man with an unusually large nose who insisted on the special. Edgeworth delivered it and couldn't help but notice that the food was not what held the old man's attention. Edgeworth clinched Maya's fist and somehow managed to keep his cool long enough for the old man to leave.

"Now that this ordeal is done, I believe it is time I left this place." Edgeworth said removing his apron. "Oh no madam! You must not, for now zee dinner rush will soon come and vee must be prepared!" Armstrong quickly went back to the kitchen. Edgeworth knew he had to get out of this now. He spotted the phone and knew the only way he'd make a quick and successful escape is if he had someone to pick him up, he doubted he could get far enough away on foot and he didn't know the bus schedule. Making sure Jean was not looking, Edgeworth picked up the phone and thought about who to dial. Wright was the first that came to mind since he already knew his situation and owed him for leaving him alone at Gourd lake while Wright was lollygagging about in a boat. But as much respect as he had for Wright in court, in this situation he wasn't sure he could rely on him. Edgeworth then thought about calling one of the more reliable people he knew, but that person would help him and not Maya so he'd have to tell the whole sorted tail leaving him open for humiliation and criticism. But then again, Franziska von Karma would criticize him anyways no matter the situation.
1112122111221222121.title: Edgeworth ends up as a waitress

choices: Nothing happens while he waits for the bus
11121221112212221211.content:
Edgeworth figured it would be best not to involve Franziska. Not only would he be ridiculed by her, but she would most likely ask to use the swapping remote, which after this situation Edgeworth never wanted to even hear about again. With this though in his mind he began to dial Wright's cell phone.

After he a few rings Wright picked up "Hello Phoen- Phoebe Wright speaking." Phoenix answered, his voice sounding sick.

"Wright. I'm in a situation. You need to Come to the Tres bien restaurant and pick me up." Edgeworth explained, not sure why Wright was using a female name.

"Why are you there?" Phoenix said, then it sounded as if he gargled water.

"It's a long story that I do not wish to go into. Are you drinking something?" Edgeworth asked curious.

"Yeah, Gourd lake's disgusting water." Phoenix said then continued to wash his mouth.

"Wright, why?" Edgeworth asked with a hand on his face.

"I....don't want to think about it." Phoenix answered, then puked. Either from the the lake water or from thinking about what happened earlier. After a few seconds Phoenix changed the subject "I can't pick you up, but I can give you the bus schedule."

Edgeworth sighed. "Yes, do so."

"The next bus should be there in about an hour or so." Phoenix told him, then continued to gargle lake water.

Edgeworth paled at the thought of being here for another hour. "Are you positive that there are no buses to arrive sooner than that?" He asked

"Yeah. I gotta go." Phoenix said before hanging up.

Edgeworth sighed to himself. Perhaps calling Franziska would have been the preferable choice, but he made his choice and would have to wait an hour. He sat down at one of the tables, he doubted any customers would show up before the bus arrived. The Tres Bien uniform was not what he would call comfortable to sit in.
11121221112212221211.title: Phoenix tries to save the day

111212211122122212112.content:
Edgeworth sat at one of Tres Bien's tables while Armstrong was in the kitchen. He stared at a clock and was counting down every minute until the bus would show up. He had absolutely nothing to do. He considered reading something, however the only thing that Tres Bien had to read were fashion magazines, which he had absolutely no interest in.

As he sat there, bored and looking at the clock, the door to the restaurant opened. To his surprise it was Maya in his body that walked in. It took only a brief glance to realize the damage that Maya had done. She had split ketchup all over his cravat! He stood up and walked over to her, she seemed as surprised to see him as he was to see her. "Fey, what have you done?" He asked, tapping his foot.

Maya had a feeling she knew what Edgeworth was talking about, she grabbed the cravat as she talked "Oh, this. I had some stuff on my, your, face. So I used your fancy napkin to wipe it off." She explained with an innocent giggle.

Edgeworth didn't think that it was funny "That cravat was very expensive, not to mention it's a sign of elegant high class life-style. It is not a napkin!" He said enraged, which made Maya sad. As Edgeworth fumed about his cravat he remembered something. "Fey, you have my car, correct?" He asked, hoping to get out of here as soon as possible.

"Oh, well, I kinda, don't know where it is." Maya said sheepishly. "I was having trouble driving, so I parked it in the first parking lot I saw and I forgot where that was,"

Edgeworth was ready to bang his head against the table, he glared at Maya. Maya was on the verge of tears when suddenly Armstrong came out of the kitchen. "Oh là là! Vee 'ave a customer. Zit right down! V'our waitress vill ve right vith you." He said referring to Edgeworth in Maya's body.

Edgeworth looked at the clock, he still had fifty minutes until the bus came. As he looked back to Maya he realized that she had a devious grin on her face, he had a bad feeling about this.
111212211122122212112.title: A customer arrives

choices: Phoenix hears Mia talk back to him
Maya and Edgeworth loudly enter the office
1112122111221222121122.content:
After getting the call from Edgeworth requesting the bus schedule Phoenix was at a bit of a loss for what to do. He couldn't follow up further on his lead without help from the police and he'd need Edgeworth's help with that. So after scraping his tongue with a tree branch, Phoenix took the bus and went back to his home base of Wright and Co. Law office and wait for word from Edgeworth. Plus Phoenix wanted to get a nap in, he felt drained. Larry tended to have that effect on him, more-so lately than usual. So he curled up on the couch and got some shut eye.

About an hour later Phoenix woke up and noticed he'd missed a phone call. He recognized the number as Edgeworth's cell meaning Maya had tried to get in touch with him. "Well, it's good to know she hasn't put Edgeworth's body into a burger coma, he'll be glad to hear that." Phoenix decided that he should fully wake up before calling Maya back, he didn't want to be only half awake when dealing with her when she's excited which she surely still was. So Phoenix made his way to bathroom and splashed his face with cold water. Looking up in the mirror he still had a hard time believing what he was seeing. Staring back at him was still his mentor Mia's face and body with his spiky hair and usual blue suit.

"Mia, I'm glad to see you, but I really wish it wasn't in a mirror." Phoenix said to himself sadly before jumping at the sound of something he wasn't expecting.
1112122111221222121122.title: Phoenix recovery mode

choices: Go to Tres Bien to get Maya's robes back
11121221112212221211222.content:
As Phoenix stared at Mia's face in the mirror the door slammed open. Edgeworth and Maya's bodies stormed in, Maya's body was wearing a Tres Bien waitress uniform. Both of them had an angry expression on their face making hard to tell if they had switched back or not.

Before Phoenix could ask about what happened Maya in Edgeworth's body spoke up "Nick! Edgeworth left my acolyte robes in the locker room of that weird restaurant!" Maya exclaimed.

"For the last time, that was necessary.The locker room was through the kitchen, the owner of that establishment wouldn't have let me change if he thought I was going to leave. Additionally, if you hadn't wasted time making me serve you, then we may have had time to sneak your clothing out." Edgeworth counter argued.

Phoenix couldn't help but laugh at the thought of Edgeworth serving tables at Tres Bien. Edgeworth turned to Phoenix with an annoyed expression "Something humorous, Wright?" He asked while tapping his foot.

Maya went over to Phoenix and began to beg "Nick! We need to go back there and get my robes back! Please!" She begged, putting a teary face on Edgeworth's body, which was very unnerving.

Before Phoenix could give into Maya, Edgeworth interrupted "We've already wasted so much time best spent investigating. It would not be logical to waste anymore. We should head back to the lake at once." Edgeworth explained.

Phoenix thought it over. Maya always had her acolyte robes and he would feel bad if something bad happened to them while they were with Armstrong. At the same time though, Edgeworth was right. No one was paying attention to the police tape and if they waited too long then any evidence that was there may be gone soon.
11121221112212221211222.title: Maya and Edgeworth loudly enter the office

choices: Did an aware swap of Phoenix and Edgeworth
Did an unaware swap of herself and Edgeworth
111212211122122212112222.content:
While Phoenix felt bad for Maya he couldn't deny that Edgeworth had a point. They finally had a lead in this case and they couldn't let it slip by. "I'm sorry Maya, but Edgeworth's right. We can go get your robes back some other time." Phoenix said, as Maya made a sad look.

Phoenix explained to Edgeworth about Larry's date and what her and the victim had put in the bottom of Gourd Lake. After hearing about this Edgeworth paced back in forth trying to putting his logic together, but couldn't draw a definite conclusion. "Wright, do you have a picture of this woman?" Edgeworth asked

"No, I didn't ask Larry for one. It, uh, slipped my mind" Phoenix said, he didn't want to tell Edgeworth or Maya about the kiss he shared with Larry.

"Our investigation won't get anywhere unless we find that woman. Wright, go and get a picture of this woman from Larry. I'll get more info on the victim from the police and see if he had anyone who fits the woman Larry described." Edgeworth ordered Wright, then turned to Maya. "Fey, Switch us back."

Maya got another devious grin on her face. "Sorry, buuuut, I think I'll stay as you a little longer." Maya said playfully in Edgeworth's body.

"Fey, no playing around, this is important. I need to go get the info from the police and they aren't going to give info to a waitress." He said, referring to his current clothes.

"I know, but you don't have to be the one who goes to the police! I'll go and get the info!" Maya said with a jump. She was excited at the idea of doing something to help find the killer.

Edgeworth wasn't so ammused. "Fey, I will not stay in your body any longer. Switch us this instant."

Maya grinned a little "Okay!"
111212211122122212112222.title: Back to investigating

choices: Did an aware swap with Edgeworth
Did an unaware swap with Phoenix and someone coming over
1112122111221222121122222.content:
With a push of a button, Maya and Edgeworth were back in their own bodies, with Maya still in her waitress uniform and Edgeworth with his soiled cravat. However, nothing much else changed.

Edgeworth was still waggling his finger at Maya. "Miss Maya Fey, i request that you switch our bodies back this instant, I will not stand staying in your body a minute longer!" Edgeworth was getting impatient.

And Maya, back in her own body was having trouble holding back her laughter. "Bwahahahaa...."

"Edgeworth thinks that my body is his body? This is so funny!!! Maybe I should do an aware swap with Edgeworth again, so that he would be back in 'his' body. Hahaha... This is hilarious" Maya thought to herself, a devious grin forming on her face.

"Fey! I demand... Wait, what's so funny? I don't want to stay another moment in this waitress uniform." Edgeworth was ready to do something drastic to get back 'his' body, or what he thought was 'his' body.

Phoenix, or Phoebe, tried to salvage the situation. "Maya, return Edgeworth to his body and we can continue investigating this case, we don't have much time left"

"Fine, fine" Maya said bring out the remote.
1112122111221222121122222.title: Did an unaware swap of herself and Edgeworth

11121221112212221211222221.content:
Maya couldn't resist laughing at seeing Edgeworth ask to be in her body, even if he didn't know it was her's. "Okay, but only because you asked for it!" She said as she pressed the button.

In an instant she was back in Edgeworth's body. On the other side of the room Edgeworth patted down Maya's body to straightened out the skirt of the Tres Bien waitress uniform. "Finally, back to normal." He said. Maya burst out laughing again. Edgeworth glared at her "Something funny?" He asked as she shook her head no.

Edgeworth was about to leave when he remembered the swap remote, now in his hands after the swap. He didn't want to bring it with him to the police office and risk leaving it behind as he gathered info. He turned around and was about to give it back to Maya, but he hesitated. If he gave it back to her would she pull another switch between him and her. He considered giving it to Wright, but with how he has been in a boat and drinking lake water, was he really a better choice. After thinking it over he decided to hand the remote over to...
11121221112212221211222221.title: Did an aware swap with Edgeworth

11121222.content:
Everything got weird after Phoenix pressed the swap button. He felt... lighter. Like he didn't exist, almost. He was hovering in place above the office. He could see what seemed to be Maya and...

...is that me?!

Phoenix wasn't in Maya's body anymore, but suddenly his own body seemed to be acting independent of him. It was no long in Mia's shape, but it still moved. After shaking its head, it looked to Maya's body and began to speak. "...ugh, my head. Sorry about blacking out there, Nick. So, did we win?" Phoenix could only assume that was Maya still in his body.

Maya's body looked confused. "Maya, is that you in there?"

"Yeah, who else?"

"Oh no..."

"What's wrong Nick?"

"I'm not Phoenix, I'm Mia! He switched while you were channeling me, and now I don't know what happened to him."

The two began to panic, looking over the device and its instructions, trying to find some kind of solution. Phoenix, for his part, tried to shout to get their attention, but he couldn't make any noise. It seemed he really was a ghost! Slowly though, he found himself moving through the air, almost like he was swimming through water. Eventually, he reached out and 'touched' his own body on the shoulder.

Did anything happen as he made contact?
11121222.title: Phoenix had swapped with Mia and was now a spirit

choices: Let Mia Stay in his Body for now
Fix This Now Before Something Goes Wrong
111212221.content:
In a sudden flash, Phoenix was physical again. Specifically, he was back in his own body! "Woah!" he exclaimed in surprise, his breathing begnning to resume pace.

"What?" Mia asked from Maya's body, obviously concerned.

"Its me! Phoenix! I'm back," he explained. He rubbed a hand on the back of his head, "although I'm suddenly not sure where Maya is."

"How did you get back in your own body?" Mia seemed very confused.

"I just...floated back in?"

"Floated? I could never do that! I always need to be deliberately channeled." Mia didn't seem to consider that answer satisfactory.

"Maybe its because I'm not really dead," Phoenix suggested with a shrug. "But I don't know where Maya is now..."

Mia seemed to consider it for a second. "Well, this doesn't seem like a normal spirit channeling, but maybe she's still in that body with you? Just try to leave, then I'll switch with Maya."

"That seems dangerous," he replied.

"Just do it!"

Phoenix sighed, and closed his eyes to focus. Suddenly he felt a weird snapping sensation, and was floating in the air once again. Maya lifted her head up, confused. "What just happened? Did I black out again??"

"It was... well, yeah, kind of." Mia thought for a second, "let's put you in your body before doing anything." She picked up the remote and swapped the two of them, taking Phoenix's body, to her discomfort, while Maya was back to normal. She breathed a sigh of relief as Mia explained what happened.

"With all this in mind, assuming Phoenix is listening, I think I know a way to fix this," Mia explained. "If Phoenix posses you, and I switch with him, I might become a spirit again, and Phoenix should be able to have his body back uninterrupted."

Maya seemed to consider that for a moment. "Well, okay, but do we have to do it so soon?"

"Uh, probably," Mia replied, a bit surprised that Maya would suggest staving it off. "Why would we wait?"

'Yes, we do it soon!' Phoenix shouted from above, but falling upon deaf ears.

Maya put her hands behind her back for a moment, a sad expression on her face. "Well, I never really get to interact with you much, since I always have to be the Channeler. Even if you do look like Phoenix, its nice to be able to talk to you. Besides, you said you liked the courtroom right? Maybe you can stay? Just for a little while?"

Mia-as-Phoenix gave a sigh, "Phoenix, if you're listening, this is up to you. If you want to fix it now, go into Maya and I'll switch. If you don't want to try right away, then... well, I don't know how you'd signal that."

Phoenix listened on annoyed. 'Dammit Maya... you had to make it sad.' As loathe as he was to admit it, he could feel Maya's pain. It must be awful knowing everyone but you gets to still see your sister. He gave a silent grunt, as he came to a decision.
111212221.title: Yes, he entered his body

1112122211.content:
Phoenix was frustrated, but he decided to let Maya have her wish, and remained a spirit for the moment. After a bit of waiting, Mia spoke, "I guess that means Phoenix is okay with it... hopefully." There was another awkward silence, Mia and Maya kind of looking at the ceiling, unsure of how to communicate with Phoenix at all. "Well... we should head back to the office for now, since the job is technically over for the moment."

"But how will Phoenix follow us?" Maya asked. "He said he was just sorta... floating, right? For some reason I don't think he can get on a bus like that."

Mia seemed to think about it. "Well, I suppose it'd be best if he... borrowed?... someone's body for now. I don't know if I feel comfortable with him just floating around either."

"Well, who should he be?" Maya asked. "It ought to be someone we know or can keep in touch with, I think."

"Well, we're at a courthouse. Maybe a lawyer Phoenix knows is around?"

"Probably. Even Phoenix's regular friends seem to find their way to courtrooms," Maya replied. "Honestly, I don't know if he has any friends who haven't been wrapped up in a murder case,"

Phoenix took umbrage to that, but he couldn't really express it.

"Ah! There's someone!" Maya exclaimed as she point to someone exiting the courthouse. "Phoenix, if you're listening, take that person."

Who was it?
1112122211.title: Let Mia Stay in his Body for now

11121222111.content: Was it Edgeworth exiting the courthouse? Or was it Franziska Von Karma leaving after a different case?
11121222111.title: Another Lawyer

choices: They go back to the office
Von Karma gets called into the courtroom to prosecute a trial
111212221112.content:
Ah! There's someone!" Maya exclaimed as she point to someone exiting the courthouse. "Phoenix, if you're listening, take that person."

Phoenix looked to where Maya pointing and saw Franziska Von Karma leaving the courtroom. It was clear she was working on some kind of case. She seemed to be muttering something about 'Foolish fools' under her breath. Before deciding to actually go into her body Phoenix took a second look around to see if there was anyone else he could fly into, unfortunately for him, he couldn't find anyone else he knew.

Phoenix took a deep breath and floated into her. After he did he was immediately disoriented, he stumbled back and fourth for a while, Franziska's heels were incredibly hard to stand in. Switching with Maya earlier was strange, but Franziska's body was a completely different feeling. Although both of their bodies felt like a completely other world to him.

Phoenix stumbled over to Maya and Mia. Maya giggled a bit seeing the 'perfect' Franziska Von Karma have trouble walking. "Couldn't I have just taken the body of some person. Did it have to be her?" Phoenix asked, extremely uncomfortable in Von Karma's body.

"Sorry Nick, but you can't just take someones body, what if you mess up they're life!" Maya said

"Hold it!" Phoenix shouted "That's a contradiction! I doesn't matter whose body I'm in. I'm not going to act like someone else!" He yelled, getting strange looks from people.

"Quiet Phoenix, you're yelling like a crazy person." Mia told him.

"So, what now?" Phoenix asked

"It's been a long and hectic day. Let's just return to the office." Mia said
111212221112.title: Franziska Von Karma

1112122211122.content:
"Ms. Von Karma!" a voice shouted from the courtroom entrance. Phoenix stopped to process for a moment, a blank expression appearing on Franziska's face, much to Maya's amusement.

"Uh... er, what is it?" He asked as he turned around, Franziska's voice sounding much less sharp when he used it. A man in a uniform seemed to be approaching.

"You're needed in the courtroom! The trial is about to begin," he informed Phoenix, who began to sweat a bit.

"Uh, one second," Phoenix replied, turning back to Mia and Maya, "what do I do?!"

Maya seemed worried as well, "Just, uh, go along with it! You've been in court, you can probably prosecute. And when in doubt, just yell at people and whip them! Seems to work for the real Von Karma."

"Ma'am we're really short on time," the bailiff said. "Hurry up, the judge seems...confused about something, not sure what. Best finish this up so he can go home and lie down."

Giving a worried look to Mia and Maya, Phoenix slowly followed the bailiff off to the courtroom. "Uh, I'll meet you back at the office?" He called out to the two of them, sounding somewhat uncertain as he re-entered the building.

Mia and Maya stood quietly for a moment before Mia interjected. "Couldn't he have just left Von Karma's body?"

Maya blinked for a second, "Oh yeah! I guess he could've done that, huh? Anyways, since its just the two of us for now, want to go get something to eat?"

Mia put her face into her hand and sighed.
1112122211122.title: Von Karma gets called into the courtroom to pro...

choices: To his office like he said he would
11121222111221.content:
Phoenix slowly walked into the courtroom. Extremely nervous about the situation he was in. How was he supposed to prosecute a trial, let alone a trial that he knows nothing about. Out of habit he walked over to the defense stand. Making the entire courtroom look at him oddly. After at least a minute Phoenix realized his mistake and stumbled over to the prosecutions stand, he took note of how the defense attorney in this case was one he didn't know, thankfully, it was strange enough to act like Von Karma in front of an entire courtroom of strangers, but he would never be able to keep up the act in front of someone he actually knew.

"Are you okay Ms. Von Karma?" The Judge asked "It's not like you to make a mistake like this."

Phoenix processed the question for a few seconds 'Act like Von Karma, Act like Von Karma' He thought to himself over and over "Mistake? I don't make Mistake. I am perfect" Phoenix said 'What would she do next?' He thought for a second, then attempted to whip the judge. The whip just fell limp in front of him. "Just start the trial, uh, Foolish fool." Phoenix knew he was doing a horrible job at this.

"Well then, we shall begin the trial at once. Opening statements Ms. Von Karma?"

"Uh, yeah. Just, Give me a second!" Phoenix said. Von Karma thankfully had all the files on the case in her court record. Phoenix got out all of the files, then as he began to read them, he dropped them all. He quickly went down on the floor to pick them all up. "The, Um, The prosecution has a decisive witness, and, some evidence." He explained to the court. "The Prosecution calls the detective in charge of this case to the stand!"

As Phoenix continued to pick up the files, detective Gumshoe went up to the witness stand. He stood there in silence. Phoenix wondered why he wasn't doing anything, but then he remembered he was the prosecution "State you name and occupation." He said, imitating Von Karma's usual tone

"Dick Gumshoe, I'm the Homicide detective in charge of this case!" He said with his usual cheeriness. "Detective. Describe to the court the findings of the police investigation." Phoenix ordered, which he had to admit felt good. Under his breath he also sighed in relief, he shouldn't have to do much while the defense does their Cross-Examination. As Detective Gumshoe kept getting pressed and his statements being objected to, Phoenix stayed silent, he knew absolutely nothing about how to prosecute, he always payed attention to his defense, not the Prosecution's strategy.

After Gumshoe entire testimony was proven to have more holes in it than Swiss cheese by the defense, Gumshoe look over to Phoenix. "Aren't you going to say anything!" He asked Phoenix while giving a sad look. Phoenix knew he had to do something, but he didn't know what. He did the first thing that came to mind "The Prosecution would like to call it's decisive witness!" He told the judge.

"But, the detective has barely said anything, and all of the evidence presented so far has been proven irrelevant by the defense! I'm ready to give a Not Guilty verdict at this time!" The judge said and held up his gavel.

"OBJECTION!" Phoenix yelled. "Just let me call fourth my witness! I swear I'll turn this trial around!" He told the Judge, who gave him with a strange look. Phoenix tried to whip the Judge again in hopes of changing his mind, the whip fell limp again.

"Alright, the prosecution may be allowed to call forth one witness. after a fifteen minute recess" The Judge announced and hit his gavel on the desk

Phoenix looked through the now unorganized files for the witness Von Karma had prepared. After finding out their name and reading through everything that happened in the case Phoenix felt just a little less bad about his horrible performance in the Courtroom. This case was simpler than ones he had worked on, either that or his cases were always extremely difficult.

From what he gathered reading the files a man is being accused of murdering his girlfriend, the witness was a friend of the girlfriend who had been staying with them. Phoenix looked through the case, his defense attorney habits kicking in. The main reason the man was being accused was the time of death and that the witness had seen the murder at that time. Phoenix looked through the evidence and found that the oven was left on and open, he deduced that this would change the time of death, meaning that the testimony prepared for the prosecution's witness had to be fake, just like the time of death. Phoenix was so busy reading the files that he didn't realize that 30 minutes had passed. A Bailiff walked into the room "Ms. Von Karma! The Judge is getting impatient! Please! H-Hurry!" The Bailiff said, clearly afraid of being whipped by Von Karma.

Phoenix ran over to the courtroom in a hurry, Leaving Von Karma's heels behind so he could run. As he entered the courtroom shoe-less he got even more strange looks then he did before. Once he was all settled he called fourth the witness.

The witness, a man with a shaved head and a muscular build, stood at the stand and gave their testimony, The Judge gave the defense permission to cross examination. However, a cry was heard in the courtroom before the defense could say a word.

"OBJECTION!" Phoenix yelled and looked to the witness he called. "You say that you saw the murder at 8:30 correct?"

"Yeah, 8:30 was when he died after all." The witness said

"Ms. Von Karma? What are you doing? This is your own witness." The Judge asked.

"I'm just getting some facts straight, Your Honor" Phoenix said, too caught up in the moment to act like Von Karma. "You say that 8:30 was the time of death, however, that can't be right. He said, holding his files. "TAKE THAT!" He said and presented the open oven evidence. "The oven was left open, meaning that the time of murder could not have been 8:30. So, why did you testify that you saw the murder at 8:30?" Phoenix demanded the question to the witness.

This witness was nowhere near as resilient as the normal witnesses Phoenix dealt with, so after a while he broke him and the witness confessed to being the real murderer. Phoenix felt proud when the Judge gave the Not Guilt verdict and everyone left the Courtroom. However, this feeling didn't last long. During the whole trial he looked like a complete idiot. He also proved the defendant not guilty, making Von Karma look incompetent. He could imagine the news now. This was bad! He may have just ruined Von Karma's reputation. hopefully this trial wouldn't affect her that much.

There was nothing he could do now. He decided to leave the courtroom before something else happened to make this day worse. He headed out the door of the courthouse, leaving behind the heels he took off earlier. Where does Phoenix head?
11121222111221.title: Follow Phoenix as Von Karma

111212221112212.content:
As Wright walked down the courthouse steps, he realized he wasn't wearing any shoes. Franzisca's stockings were the only thing covering his feet. He paused to consider things for a moment, but decided that being barefoot was preferable to walking in those heels. 'She'll get them back somehow,' he reasoned.

As he walked, he did a quick inventory of his new belongings, and found a set of keys in Franziska's pocket. The one that most stood out to him was a car key. Phoenix's eyes seemed to light up. "It's been a while since I got the chance to drive," he muttered in Franziska's voice. He'd been relying on buses and taxis for quite a while now. He clicked the car alarm button and managed to locate Franziska's vehicle - a nice car not unlike Edgeworth's.

"Well, it's unfair that prosecutors get such nice things; I should let myself enjoy her stuff while I'm here!" Phoenix opened the door and got in the car. It seemed well kept, but a bit empty. "Hmm, y'know, Maya might prefer it if I leave her and Mia alone for a bit," he reasoned. "I probably have time to find a pair of shoes."

---

Using the address on her license, Phoenix eventually managed to find Von Karma's residence. It was a bit of an ordeal, but he managed to not crash her car. He would've felt awful if he hurt her reputation and wrecked her car in the same day.

Looking to her key ring, he managed to find one with a number, which he took to be her apartment number. He took the elevator a few floors up, getting some looks for being barefoot, and came to the door of her home.

"Nice place she lives in... was expecting like, a dungeon to be honest." Her home was very clean, like her car. It was decorated a bit sparsely but all the furniture she did have seemed to be rather high quality. It wasn't very spacious, though. There was a bedroom, a bathroom, and a living/eating area. It seemed she lived alone.

Does Wright just grab a better set of shoes and leave, or does he stick around and search her home a bit more? He didn't know too much about Von Karma personally, and there'd be no better way to learn more about her than to look through her things consequence-free.
111212221112212.title: Joyride

choices: Go home in Von Karma's prosecuting outfit
1112122211122121.content:
Pheonix was curious about learning more about Franziska, however after all he had done today he thought it would be outright disrespectful to infiltrate her privacy, well, infiltrate it more than stealing her body, losing a pair of her shoes, and accidentally ruining her reputation in the span of an hour. He looked around her apartment for a closet so he could replace the shoes he lost.

While searching for one a thought came to mind, what would Von Karma think when he depossessed. From her point of view she would have been unconscious for a day while her body went and made her act like a foolish fool, and she wouldn't have any idea why. Miles Edgeworth sat down in his office with a cup of tea, happy to relax after all the stress he had gone through in the past few days. Between being involved in several murder cases, and even temporarily losing his prosecutor's badge, the events he had gone through made him all the more grateful for the peace and quiet he had now been granted. He still had work to do, mainly paperwork for other cases he had dealt with, but for now, he was intent on enjoying the moment of calmness.

A moment that was abruptly brought to an end as he heard a knock on the door to his office. Edgeworth stared at the door for a moment, his cold, icy glare having no effect on the wooden object, before letting out a sigh. He set his teacup down on his desk, before getting up and opening the door. To his surprise, there was no one there. If not for the fact that this was the prosecutor's office, he might have suspected someone was playing a trick on him; a sort of "ding-dong-ditch", as it were. However, considering the level of maturity that most prosecutors possessed, that seemed unlikely, and Edgeworth instead opted to have a better look around to see where the knock on his door had come from.

It didn't take him long to find his first clue; a small parcel left on the ground on front of his office. Considering where it was, and the knock that had preceded its arrival, it hardly seemed like a coincidence. Despite the parcel being unlabelled, the evidence pointed to the fact that someone had left this parcel here for him.

"Hm, I wonder why they left it here instead of handing it to me in person," Edgeworth pondered aloud, closing the door to his office once more and taking the parcel back to his desk with him. Carefully opening it up, he found a small device inside, somewhat like a TV remote, accompanied by an instruction manual. After quickly reading through the manual, Edgeworth began to reevaluate his earlier assumption that this wasn't just a prank. A device that allowed people to swap bodies? Preposterous. Who would even think of something like this, and why choose him of all people to pull this trick on? The more he thought about it, though, the less this seemed like the sort of thing anyone at the office would do as a prank, and the more curious he grew about whether it would actually work or not.

Before he could decide what to actually do with the remote, he heard another knock on his door. Hoping it wasn't another strange parcel, Edgeworth pocketed the remote and opened the door. Waiting patiently for him to open it, was non other than...
133.title: Investigations series

1331.content:
As Edgeworth opened the door he was greeted by none other than Kay Faraday. Kay had investigated with him on many occasions and was a valued partner and assistant. Her and her special device 'Little Thief' had been a great help more than once, having her around during investigations was a delight.

"Hey Mr. Edgeworth!" She shouted as she practically bursted into his office, slamming the door he opened for her as she entered. The vibrations from the door slamming had caused the pieces on his nearby chessboard to fall over and nearly knocked over the cup of tea he had placed on the table.

Having her around during investigations was a delight, during days off was less so. "Kay. I believe I have already explained to you that barging into the prosecutor's office and causing a ruckus could get both you and myself charged for disturbing the peace." He lectured her as he went over to his chessboard to pick up the fallen pieces and put them back in their rightful place.

"He he, Sorry Mr. Edgeworth. It won't happen again." Kay apologized, although this was a stock apology she would give to Edgeworth anytime she would do something that he either disagreed with or lectured her over.

As he picked them up he remembered the device that had been delivered to him. While testing it on Kay would be a breach of her personal space, she had done plenty of breaching of his personal space. Additionally, it wasn't as if they were going to be swapped very long. This was just and experiment of the remote's capabilities. If it worked, he would swap them back immediately. If it didn't, then he would throw out the remote like the piece of prank garbage that it was.

As Kay sat down on Edgeworth's couch, he pointed the remote toward her and pressed the button. What kind of swap did he do?

13311.content:
Edgeworth pressed the Aware Swap button, and almost instantly he found himself across the room, sitting down on the couch. That wasn't the only change, though. He was shorter and slimmer, and he certainly wasn't male anymore. Looking down at himself, his body was now definitely female, several years younger too, and he was dressed in Kay's usual outfit. A bit of black hair fell down in front of his eyes. Without a doubt, the remote had worked, and he was now in Kay's body.

And of course, if he was in her body, she was in his, as was evidenced by the loud scream coming from his body, which he wouldn't be surprised if it could have been heard from inside the adjacent offices. She patted down her body, or more accurately Edgeworth's body, frantically, knocking the chess table over in her panic. She looked up at Edgeworth, in her body, and practically yelled, "Mr. Edgeworth, what's going on!? What did you do!?"

It was strange, to say the least, for Edgeworth to see his own body moving of its own accord from an outside perspective, but stranger still to see it acting in such a manner. He stood up slowly, and said, "Kay, calm down. I can ex-"

"Calm down!?" Kay interrupted. "I'm supposed to be the thief around her, but now you're stealing bodies!?"

"Kay, I didn't steal you body," Edgeworth replied, taking a much harsher tone, although it didn't seem to have as much weight to it with Kay's voice. "Now calm down and stop shouting before you get us both removed from the building." Kay went silent, not entirely sure how to react to seeing her body act that way. Once he was sure she had quietened down, Edgeworth resumed talking, "Good, now allow me to explain. A few minutes before you arrived, I found a package outside my door, that contained a remote." He went to show her the remote, but realised it was was no longer in his hand. He looked around at the floor around him, and over at the couch where he had been sitting, but it didn't seem to be anywhere.

Before he could check anywhere else, Kay held up her and, revealing that she was holding the remote. "You mean this one?"

Edgeworth frowned. The remote must have stayed with his own body after the switch. That seemed like a major design flaw for the remote, allowing the person you'd swapped with to swap right back, or preventing you from making further swaps. "Yes, that's the one. It came with an instruction manual claiming it could swap people's bodies. I thought it was just some practical joke, but I decided to see whether it would work or not."

"Well, it works," Kay said stating the obvious, looking at the remote curiously.

"Yes, it does. Now, could you people give it back to me so that I can swap us back?"

"Huh?"

Edgeworth wasn't sure if Kay didn't understand, or if she had just been distracted by the remote and wasn't listening. He was pretty sure it was the latter, but elected to explain regardless. "I only swapped with you to test the device's capabilities, I have no intention of keeping your body. So, if you could please hand me the remote, I will swap us back into our correct bodies."

Kay couldn't help but find it weird to see her body acting so formal like that. The remote had piqued her interest, though. She could only imagine how much easier her life as the Great Thief Yatagarasu would be with a little gadget like this. It could be like hiding in plain sight.

"Kay!" Kay was snapped out of her daydream by an increasingly-impatient Edgeworth, who was standing with his hand outstretched, waiting for Kay to give the remote back to him. He was growing rather uncomfortable in Kay's body as he noticed more and more differences, and he wanted to swap back into his own body, and then figure out what to do with the remote from there.

Edgeworth was not ammused. "Kay, this is not a time to play around. This was merely an experiment of the device's capabilities, we do not yet know it's full potential. So, if you would kindly just swap us now." Edgeworth demanded while tapping Kay's foot.

He luckily managed to make it back to his office without encountering anyone along the way. Having to be in Kay's body was bad enough, Edgeworth didn't want to have to try acting like her as well. He shut the door behind him, hoping nobody else would disturb him, and frowned at the state of his office. Kay hadn't been too destructive, but his chess table had been knocked over, the pieces scattered across the floor, and his teacup had been knocked over, spilling tea all over his desk. Luckily he hadn't had any important files still sitting on the desk, or they would have been ruined. The remote's manual was now soaked with tea though, and practically unusable. It occurred to him that Kay didn't actually know about the other button on the remote, the unaware swap. He really hoped she wouldn't try it out while the two of them were swapped. Of course, he'd have no way of telling if she'd used it or not, he'd just see whichever body Kay swapped into as being his real body. He shuddered at the thought.

Edgeworth set about cleaning up his office, starting with standing the chess table back up. He couldn't help but notice it seemed a bit heavier than normal. Kay wasn't weak by any stretch of the imagination, in fact he had felt faster and more agile while trying to run down the stairs to catch up with Kay, but considering he was now several years younger, a bit of a loss of strength was understandable. He gathered up the chess pieces off the floor and set they back up where they were meant to be positioned. Now it was on to his desk. He tossed the manual and the box that had come with the remote into the trash, and placed the teacup back with the rest of his tea set, but found himself lacking any sort of cloth to clean his desk with. If he'd been able to dry it off, he could continue with his work until Kay eventually came back, assuming she would, but he couldn't very well do that while his desk was still wet. It should be too difficult to find some paper towels or something somewhere around the building, but that would unfortunately mean leaving his office again, something he didn't want to do while still in Kay's body. However, it was either that, or sit around doing nothing, so Edgeworth slowly opened the door to his office once more, looking around to make sure the hallway was empty.
1331121.title: Follow Edgeworth in Kay's body

13311212.content:
Edgeworth began to make his way down the hallway. There should be some paper towels downstairs. He made a mental note to stock up on some later, just in case a situation like this happens again. As he made his way to the elevator, his heart stopped. The Elevator opened before he got to it and out came detective Gumeshoe, his subordinate. Although, he supposed Gumshoe wasn't his subordinate now that he was in Kay's body.

"Kay, what're you doing here pal?" Gumshoe asked confused.

Edgeworth dreaded that this would happen. Although he could tell Gumshoe about the remote and the swap with Kay, he doubted Gumshoe would believe him. Who would believe someone claiming to be in someone else's body? Unfortunately, that meant Edgeworth would have to do his best Kay impression. "I need to go and get some napkins so I can clean up...Mr. Edgeworth's desk." Edgeworth said, he imitated words that Kay would use, but he still spoke in his own usual tone of voice. Thankfully Gumshoe didn't seem to notice. Referring to himself as 'Mr. Edgeworth' was surreal to say the least.

"But I just saw Mr. Edgeworth drive off in his car. Why were you in his office after he left?" Gumshoe asked confused.

"He, uh, he told me to clean up his office while he was gone." Edgeworth came up with an excuse.

"He left you to clean up?" Gumshoe asked, but then smiled "Don't worry about that, I'll clean it for you pal! I've made plenty of messes in Edgeworth's office over the past few years. You go out and enjoy yourself, I can handle this!" Gumshoe exclaimed, excited at the opportunity to do something to help others.

"No." Edgeworth said bluntly. He didn't want to go anywhere in Kay's body.

"Oh, no, pal. A young person like you should be out enjoying themselves, not stuck in a stuffy office like this." Gumshoe insisted

Edgeworth couldn't believe it, Gumshoe had never disobeyed him before. While he was in Kay's body he had no authority whatsoever. Edgeworth was going to say something else, but he heard the elevator open again. He looked behind Gumshoe and saw a security guard approaching.

The guard walked around Gumshoe and stood in front of Edgeworth "You. Many of the personnel in the building complained about a teenage girl running around and causing a disturbance. I'm gonna have to ask you to leave." The guard explained.

Edgeworth was worried something like this would happen. With how he and Kay were running down the building it be ludicrous if none of the people in the building called security. Although this wasn't good for him. He couldn't just disobey the guard, that would get Kay in trouble with the law and he would like to avoid her having a criminal record. He decided to just obey and leave the building. As he headed to the elevator he heard Gumshoe yell behind him "Don't worry, Pal! I'll clean up Mr. Edgeworth's office for you!."

As Edgeworth exited the building the fact that he was now wearing a skirt became more apparent as he felt a breeze blow between his legs. What was he going to do now. He supposed the only logical thing to do was go after Kay, but where could she have possibly gone? Not knowing where to go, he decided to head for one of the more widely visited areas in the city. Where did he go?
13311212.title: Edgeworth runs into someone who thinks he's Kay

Swapped with someone from the Wright Agency.

141.content: Who does Apollo swap bodies with?
141.title: Apollo Justice

choices: He switches someone else with Vera
14131.content:
It had been a few weeks since the death of Drew Misham and the ensuing trial, and thankfully the jury had acquitted his daughter, Vera, who had since made a full recovery. Less thankfully, Vera was still hesitant to leave her home. Apollo and Trucy had gone to visit her several times, and she would go on brief outings with them, but she still seemed afraid to travel for long periods, and she was even more afraid to leave her home alone. Apollo knew it wouldn't do any good for her to be cooped up in that house after all that had happened though, especially since she no longer had her father with her.

It was the afternoon and things were going slow at the office. Trucy and Mr. Wright were out, and it seemed Apollo had no cases to work on, as he lounged about at the work desk Mr. Wright had finally allotted him. "Guess since nothing's going on, I'll check on Vera," he decided as he got up from his chair and exited into the lobby. Once there, he came across a strange package on the table. "Hmm? Who ordered this?" Figuring he only stood to anger Mr. Wright or Trucy, Apollo took the liberty of opening the box on his own.

In it, he found the remote and its instructions. It all sounded like something out of a science fiction movie to him, and not a particularly good one. "Maybe Trucy just bought it as a prop," he mused. As he thought more about it though, he realized it would be very convenient if the device did what it said. 'If Vera could just, like, spend a day as someone else, maybe it'd give her a chance to broaden her perspective.' There wasn't much harm in trying, its not as though Vera would judge him when it failed. The device SOUNDED crazy, but then, Mr. Wright once got a testimony from a ghost! Weirder things had happened.

---

A half hour later, Apollo reached the Misham house, which he had visited several times before during his investigation of Drew's murder. "It can't be good for her to still be here..." he muttered as he parked his bike.

Walking up to the door, it occurred to him that he never put much thought into who he would try to switch her with. All things considered, he was the only candidate right now. However, the instructions didn't say the remote had a timer at all; he could use it on her here and then find someone like Trucy to switch her with later.

Did Apollo just switch her with himself, or does he try to switch Vera with another person?
14131.title: Vera Misham

141311.content:
"Probably shouldn't involve a third party before I know it works," Apollo decided as he walked up to Vera's door and knocked. There was a moment of silence as Apollo waited, but eventually the doorknob turned and the door cracked open just a bit. "Come in..." he heard Vera say, her voice quiet and nervous.

Apollo made his way inside and followed Vera into the kitchen. Her home smelled of wet paint. "So, how's your week been?" he asked. The fact that she was working on new portraits was a good sign.

"Its been fine," she replied while preparing tea, her voice monotone. "I just finished a few more paintings. People have been interested in my work since the trial, I've had offers to put paintings up on auctions."

"That's great! You must be excited, right?"

"Yeah, I guess so," Vera replied. "I don't know though. They'll probably expect me to show up personally, all the people will ask me questions. The reporters from the trial have just started to leave me alone, I don't know if I really want to go."

Apollo reached down to the remote in his pocket. 'Awfully convenient circumstance,' he realized. "Well Vera, when would this auction be?" he asked.

"It was a sudden invitation," she replied, "next week, if I accept."

'A week?' Apollo grimaced a bit. 'The things I do for friends...'

"I think I can help you Vera," Apollo announced. "I know how you can attend the auction without getting all that attention."

"You do?" she asked. "How?"

"With this, just hold still and it'll make sense in a second," Apollo explained as he raised the remote and clicked the button.

Was it aware or unaware?
141311.title: He switches with Vera

choices: To leave the remote with Apollo
1413111.content:
In a blink, Apollo found himself standing. He shook his head for a moment, feeling long hair brush against his neck. Looking down, he saw his own body, whose eyes were wide and focused upon himself.

"Who are... why..." Vera in Apollo began to speak, but soon stopped at the now deeper and louder sound of her voice. She seemed rather uncomfortable. "Are you me?"

"No! It's me Vera, Apollo," he replied, shocked to hear Vera's voice sound anything but monotonous or nervous. Vera just seemed confused. "Er, this will take a while to explain."

---

"And that's how it happened," Apollo finished, as Vera looked at the remote, still in his body.

"Why did you use it on me then?" She asked, having calmed down but still seeming confused.

"I want to help you," Apollo explained. This was all really weird now that he vocalized it. Part of him wondered if he should like, hand this device over to scientists now that he knew it worked, but he decided to just keep on going. "You still seem so anxious after the trial, so I thought it might help you to get a new perspective."

"But, what about the auction?"

"I'll handle it for you," Apollo promised. "But I do want you to show up for it. You can stay in my body for it, if you want, so long as you're there. I think, if you do that, you'll see its no so bad."

Slowly, Apollo saw a smile form on Vera's - well, his - face. "Thank you," she said, "I think it might help."

Apollo was surprised at how well she took to his suggestion. He lifted the remote again, "so, do you want to keep the remote, or should I hold onto it? I think it might be safer here, since your home is more quiet. Trucy or Mr. Wright might find it if you take it back to the office. I understand if you don't want to feel trapped though."

Vera chose...
1413111.title: Aware

14131112.content:
"I'm sorry, but, I want to keep the remote with me." Vera said sheepily.

"Alright, here you go." Apollo said He handed Vera the remote, she was shocked by his sudden movement. Apollo thought it was strange to see his own body act so scared.

"Are you sure? If I take it you'll be stuck as me until I come back." Vera asked, really nervous about the swap.

"Of course! It's fine! I'm fine!" Apollo responded, Vera's voice was not very good at his cords of steel routine. He coughed a bit before continuing "Don't worry about it, I'm sure nothing bad will happen."

"O-Okay." Vera said, a little less nervous now that she was sure that Apollo was okay with this swap. After some short silence she said "What should we do now?" She asked.

Apollo thought about it for a minute before deciding what the best thing to do would be. "Why don't you try going outside now that you're me? Or you can head to Mr. Wright's office, or anywhere you want." Apollo suggested "Nothing will happen to you as long as you're in my body, uh, not that anything would happen to you in your own body." He reassured

Vera was still afraid of going outside, but Apollo's reassuring words gave her the courage to go outside. She headed toward the door of her home and turned the handle.
14131112.title: To take it with her

choices: Apollo Finds Something Else to Do
141311122.content:
Apollo watched from the window as Vera climbed his bike and rode off. 'Surprised she knows how to ride,' he thought. Not missing a beat, he could see Vera fall in the distance, and he winced. She seemed fine though, and got up, deciding to just walk the bike away.

Turning from the window, Apollo realized what he had just promised. 'A week?!' He let Vera have the remote too, so he couldn't just take another body in the meantime. "Probably should've waited... well, too late now."

Apollo had been too busy explaining everything to Vera that he forgot to really notice his body, but now that he was alone the differences began to dawn on him. It was a bit embarrassing to admit, but he realized that he was actually a bit taller now that he was Vera. The fact that he had Vera's tight clothes were making him a bit uncomfortable.

He looked around the house for a bit, realizing he'd never seen anything but the kitchen and Vera's studio. Eventually he found what he believed to be Vera's bedroom, which was... rather empty. There was a bed, a stand with a clock, a mirror, and drawers of clothes. It was a very bland room for an artist. "Guess she and her dad saved decor for the rest of the house."

Looking in the mirror, he was surprised as to how different Vera's face looked with himself in control. Her eyes were widened, her eyebrows raised, and she just overall seemed more expressive. Her clothes were still bothering him, however. Feeling a bit restricted, Apollo untied Vera's hair, letting it fall loose over the back of his head. He also removed the smock, now just wearing her sweater.

"There we go," he said, "now she looks a bit more relaxed." He idly wondered if dressing more informally would help Vera calm down a bit. Her clothes were right there in the room, but he wasn't sure if he wanted to go as far as dressing her yet. 'She's okay with the swap, but I feel it'd be in bad taste to immediately undress...' He had a week to kill; thinking about it, this was almost a break for himself as much as Vera. He continued to stare in the mirror, starting to fiddle a bit with his new, longer hair. Did he opt to look over Vera's wardrobe, or did he look for something else to do?
141311122.title: Follow Apollo in Vera's body

1413111221.content:
Apollo continued to stare in the mirror, still trying to imagine that the face staring back at him was his. After staring for a while he decided to change Vera's clothes, the tightness of his current clothes made the changes of is new body all to apparent. He opened the drawer and began to look through the clothes Vera had.

After searching through it he found an outfit that he felt would be easy to change into. It was a simple outfit. A red and white striped tank top, the colors reminded him the clothes he usually wore during trials and such. He had debated to himself whether or not he would wear a skirt or pants. He had decided to wear a skirt because he wanted Vera to see her body relaxing like other people and every other girl he knew wore skirts, with Ema being the exception. He also wanted to try and get a feel for being a girl since he would be one for the next week, and what better way to feel like one then wear a skirt. He got a red circle skirt, the same color as the red parts of the tank top he grabbed.

Picking out the outfit was pretty easy, the next part not so much. He placed the clothes he grabbed on Vera's bed and began to change. He began by taking off Vera's sweater, closing his eyes as he did so. Once it was off he wrapped it around his head as a blindfold. Once that was done he attempted to put on the tank top, it took him a few attempt, but he soon managed to do it. Next up was the skirt, he slipped off the pants that Vera was wearing before, his new legs felt very cold as he did so. He picked up the skirt and began to put it on. Why did women's clothing have to be so complicated! Once he was done he looked in the mirror. He couldn't help but smile, the reflection in the mirror seemed a lot happier then Vera usually was. The clothes also made her look like a female version of himself with long dark blue hair.

Now that he had changed clothes, what should he do? Should he just hang around Vera's house like she usually did, or should he go around town as Vera?
1413111221.title: Apollo Tries a New Look

14131112211.content:
Apollo supposed it'd be hypocritical of him to just hang around Vera's house after encouraging her to get out more. With his new outfit prepared, Apollo put on some shoes and ventured outside of Vera's home. Thankfully it was warm out, so he didn't have to worry about being under-dressed as he moved down the sidewalk in only a tank-top and skirt. He noticed a few of Vera's neighbors looking surprised as he left; he bet they hadn't seen her leave the home alone in a long time. Some of them might not have known she existed to be honest.

Apollo decided to ignore them and kept walking, being sure to keep his posture straight. 'Look confident, feel confident.' He figure that if he was going to attend that auction in Vera's place then he ought to get used to social interactions in her body.

He figured it would be too easy to just visit Trucy or Mr. Wright; he spoke to them every day and they both knew Vera too. It'd be best to be around people who didn't know Vera at all. "Always people over at the park... I guess that's why they call it People Park," Apollo spoke to no one in particular. it was a nice day, so even if he didn't meet anyone, he could go for a walk.

"Otherwise, if I wanted to be a bit more risky, I could go to see Clay," he muttered, a smirk on his face. It HAD been a while since he last visited the Cosmos Space Center. It had been open to tourists since the famous trip that Solomon Starbuck took years ago, and Apollo had plenty of friends and acquaintances at the center. Most notably, Starbuck himself and Clay Terran, a friend of his who was training to be an astronaut. Apollo snickered a bit at the thought of meeting them like this. It could make for nice practice, seeing how they might treat him in a new body.

Where does Apollo decide to head over to?
14131112211.title: Apollo leaves the house

141311122112.content:
Apollo smirked at his plan and decided to head out to the Cosmos space center. He was pretty sure the space center held tours at this time of day and if he was lucky he would run into Clay or Starbuck. He wondered if he could act like a completely different person in front of either of them. Although, if Mr. Wright taught him anything, it's how to bluff in front of people.

Soon he arrived at the space center and signed up for a tour of the place. There weren't many people on the tour, only around ten or so. Although, he felt that the real Vera would have felt crowded even with this few people, that's the whole reason Apollo did the swap in the first place, to help Vera with her fear of going outside and around other people. As the tour went on Apollo got bored, he heard all of this before from Clay and Starbuck. He just hoped he ran into one of them before the tour ended.

Just as Apollo complained to himself about the tour, he saw one of his two friends, who was it?
141311122112.title: Cosmos Space Center

1413111221121.content:
'There he is!' Apollo shouted mentally as his friend walked into the room amidst the tour, wearing the blue jacket that was standard among the staff at the space station. He smiled and waved to the tourist as the guide introduced him as one of the astronauts working at the station. Soon enough, people were firing off questions at him.

"Have you ever been to space before?"

"Were you there for the Hat 1 miracle?"

"Do you know Solomon Starbuck?"

Clay managed to keep his cool and answer them all with confidence. Apollo recalled the Hat 1 incident; he and clay were just kids at the time but they had visited Starbuck and the rest of the Space Center's crew frequently. It was a pretty frightening experience. Apollo thought hard about what he should say to Clay. 'What would make him want to talk to me?'

Suddenly it came to him, and right on time, as Clay seemed ready to leave. "Anymore questions before I get back to work?" he asked with a friendly smile.

"Are you feeling fine?" Apollo asked from the back of the group in Vera's voice, a smirk forming on his face. A few other tourists gave him funny looks and he saw Clay lift an eyebrow as he processed the question.

"Uh, yeah! I'm Clay Terran and I'm fine!" he exclaimed with a bit of a laugh as he walked off, giving Apollo-as-Vera a curious glance as he walked away.

'That got to him,' Apollo smiled, crossing his arms.

---

The rest of the tour went by pretty easily. Apollo remained quiet, as he was quite familiar with the ins-and-outs of the place. Eventually, it came to an end, but Apollo decided to hover around the station for just a few more minutes, feigning interest in a photograph of the staff that was posted up in one of the exhibits.

"Hey there," he heard a voice from behind him, and he turned around, accidentally twirling his skirt, to see Clay standing in front of him.

"Oh, Mr. Terran, right?" Apollo asked, trying to hold back a chuckle.

"You can call me Clay," he said. "I just wanted to know, what made you ask that question back there?"

"I just wanted to know how you were doing," Apollo replied with a shrug. He realized he wasn't acting much like Vera, but he was having fun at the moment.

"Mhm," Clay responded, sounding a bit skeptical. "Well, I appreciate the concern. What's your name?" He extended a hand as he asked.

Apollo took his hand, realizing that Clay didn't seem quite as tall from Vera's body. "I'm... Vera," he said, feeling a bit odd using the name despite having been in her body for a while now. He wondered where Clay was going to take this.

"Well Vera, I'm about to get off work in a moment. How about I..."
1413111221121.title: Clay

14131112211212.content:
"How about I take you out for lunch somewhere?" Clay said with a chuckle while rubbing the back of his head. "You're the only tourist who ever asked me if I was feeling okay while I was hounded with questions. Plus you're pretty cute"

Apollo blushed wildly as Clay asked this. He didn't know why, when in his regular body he and Clay would go out and eat lunch together all the time, so why did it feel so different know that he was in Vera's body? Also, Clay just called him cute, he was being hit on by his best friend, he couldn't believe this was happening.

Clay noticed this "Hey, are you okay? You look like you're getting sick." He asked concerned.

"Y-Yeah, I'm okay. I'm fine!" Apollo said as he usually did when he got nervous.

Clay laughed "Okay, okay, I know that shouting 'I'm fine!' earlier was weird, but you don't have to copy me." He smiled. "So, do you want to go out for lunch?"

Apollo calmed down from the question. He looked at Clay, who had a big smile on his face as usual. He hadn't planned for this to happen, but he probably should have expected it. He thought about it and said...
14131112211212.title: Take you somewhere for lunch

141311122112121.content:
'Just play it cool,' Apollo told himself, 'you came here to get practice after all.'

"Y-yes! That'd be great," Apollo responded to Clay, who seemed relieved at the positive reply.

"Awesome! Let's go then, I know a nice place where we can go and talk."

---

About 20 minutes later, the two of them ended up at Eldoon's noodles. Apollo sat down at the stand, smoothing out his skirt as he did, and both ordered a bowl. He was glad that Clay chose somewhere simple like this; it made the whole thing feel a lot more relaxed.

"I feel like I've seen your face somewhere," Clay said. "Are you an actress, maybe?"

Apollo realized that Clay must've heard about the trial a while back; it'd be ridiculous if he hadn't. After all, it was the debut of the jury system and Apollo himself had taken part in the proceedings. Technically, Apollo was now the defendant from that case. If he claimed to be the defendant from that proceeding, it would ruin a lot of the anonymity he had, as Clay would immediately connect Vera to Apollo.

"I'm an artist, actually!" Apollo replied, deciding to just omit the truth rather than tell a lie.

"Really? Like a painter?"

"Yeah. I'm going to be selling at an auction next week. You might've heard about me from that," Apollo said, trying to build a coherent story. Clay seemed to ponder this as he ate his food.

"Hmmm," he quickly slurped down what he was eating, "that's probably it then." Apollo sighed some relief. He continued to eat his noodles when Clay asked another question, "could I see some of your paintings then, Vera?"

This caught Apollo off-guard a bit. 'Geeze Clay, awful friendly with the ladies aren't you?' "Oh? Are you interested in art?"

"Yeah! I love artwork," he gave a thumbs up and a smile. Apollo raised a skeptical eyebrow. 'First I've heard of it.'

Apollo could see through Clay pretty clearly. He was sort of having fun though; not to mention that Clay paid for the meal. He supposed it wouldn't hurt to invite him back to Vera's house. However, Clay DID seem somewhat aware of who Vera was. Apollo imagined that his change of appearance had thrown Clay off, but if he spends to much time with him, Clay might recognize him as Vera Misham, which would complicate things a bit. What did he settle on?
141311122112121.title: Yes

choices: "Aren't you the girl from that big trial awhile ago"
1413111221121211.content:
Apollo thought it over and decided to invite Clay over to Vera's house. Although Clay did recognize Vera's face a bit, he doubted Clay would recognize her house, after all, most media attention was on the forgeries and Vera had put those away after the trial. He could probably show Clay some of the paintings Vera made after that trial.

"Sure, I have some at home." Apollo said as he finished up his noodles.

Clay seemed to be happy at this. "Okay! I'm ready to go when you are." Clay said, putting his remaining noodles aside.

---

As they arrived Apollo showed Clay a painting Vera recently made. It was some sort of landscape, Apollo wasn't really sure, but he tried to explain it as best as he could. Clay seemed to be listening to him, although Apollo doubted that his explanation of the painting was anywhere near understandable.

Once he was done showing Clay around Vera's studio, he noticed a strange look on Clay's face.

"Is something wrong?" Apollo asked, worried

"Uh, Yeah, there's been something I was wondering since we got here...." Clay began
1413111221121211.title: Apollo invites Clay Over

choices: Tell the story about the remote
14131112211212111.content:
'Well shit,' Apollo thought, crossing his arms 'he recognized me. I don't think I can lie my way out of this...'

With a hesitant sigh, Apollo admitted, "yes, that was me." 'Well, sort of...'

Clay looked triumphant. "I knew I recognized you from somewhere! There's no way it was a coincidence you asked me if I was 'fine' at the tour. Apollo was your lawyer after all, he put you up to this, didn't he?" There was a wide grin on his face, feeling as though he had unraveled the whole secret. "Ahahaha, I bet he'll be impressed how fast I puzzled that out."

'Oh if only you knew, Clay,' Apollo thought as he considered his response. The ruse was sort of over, but not quite. Clay knew the identity of the body Apollo was using, but he still didn't know it was Apollo. Pretending to be Vera could still be fun even if Clay knew the connection. Letting Clay in on the device might be a safer route though, especially since Clay might try to go visit Vera-as-Apollo after this. She'd probably be rather confused if that happened.

Did Apollo continue to claim he was Vera, or did he decide to explain what was going on to Clay?

Apollo sighed and decided to come clean and explain the remote to Clay "Well, you're right about Apollo being surprised about you figuring it out so fast." He began to say

Clay laughed. "Hey, you wanna go and tell Apollo I figured it out?" He said, rubbing the back of his head.

"He already know." Apollo said, preparing to tell Clay about everything

"Oh, is he hiding in the back room or something?" Clay asked.

"No, he's standing right here." Apollo responded, waiting to see if Clay could take the hints.

Apollo chuckled a bit. "No, I'm standing right here."

Apollo tried his best to explain to Clay what had happened. He explained about the remote, Why he had switched with Vera, changing clothes, and why he went to the space center. It was clear that Clay didn't believe him.

"Nice prank, but I'm not buying it. Okay Apollo, you can come out from the other room or wherever you are!" Clay called out

Apollo sighed, it was clear there was only one way he could proove it to Clay
