1413111221121211121.content: When Apollo took Clay to speak with Vera in his body how does Vera act?
1413111221121211121.title: Take Clay to see Vera in his body

14131112212.content:
"I should probably take a day to adjust," Apollo said to no one in particular. "No need to rush things."

He decided to stay in for now and look around Vera's home. He had only ever seen the studio room until today, but a quick search revealed a small kitchen area, a bathroom, and a small living room with a TV. "Didn't think they'd be the kind to watch TV, but I guess it'd get boring otherwise," Apollo figured. There was one other door, and Apollo figured, by process of elimination, that it was her father's room. It must have really stung for Vera to suddenly be in this house all alone; as far as he knew, Vera hadn't removed any of her father's belongings. Apollo decided to not mess with Drew's room for now.

Pushing that sad thought out of his mind, he decided he'd try to do what Vera would. "Vera likes... to paint I suppose." Apollo wasn't much of an artist, but it couldn't hurt to get into character. It seemed that some of the paintings in the studio were unfinished, or left to dry, so Apollo was careful to not mess with them as he searched for a blank canvas.

Eventually he was set up with a painting easel and a canvas picking a stool to sit down on, Apollo set to work. He tried to think of a subject and eventually decided he'd paint something from a case, as Drew Misham did.

---

A messy hour or so later, Apollo decided he was as done as he ever would be. The canvase was messy and splotched, as were his arms, but Vera's clothes were thankfully unharmed. 'Probably should've worn a smock,' he realized as he put the brushes away.

The painting was messy and the colors were all a bit off, but Apollo figured it was as good as he would ever get. It was a painting of the 'Devil' face that he saw on Kristoph's hand at the end of the case. It was a surprising moment; he had never seen that 'tell' when he had worked for Gavin, and it was hard to get the image out of his mind.

"Guess I'll let that dry," Apollo decided. He honestly wasn't sure what he'd do with that painting, but it was a fun diversion. He went over to the bathroom and began washing the paint off Vera's arms when there was a noise; the doorbell rang.

"...who would come visit Vera?" Apollo muttered as he walked over to the door. He looked through the peep hole and on the other side he saw...
14131112212.title: Apollo just hangs around

141332.content:
It was a quiet day at the Wright Anything Office, and it was welcome as Apollo lazily spun around in his chair. Just a week ago, he had scraped through what had been the most stressful case of his life. Not only did his defendant almost die, but he only managed to scrape through due to the newly introduced Jury system. Apollo had the feeling that it'd be a while before Juries were truly implemented in the courts, so he doubted that he'd get off so lucky again. He appreciated the break while he had it. He realized he would likely need a new edge soon if he wanted to keep up in future cases.

He was stirred by a buzz at the door. He got up from his cramped office and stumbled his way to the front door, maneuvering around Trucy's scattered things. "She's going to need to learn how to share office space," Apollo said a bit bitterly as he reached the door. Upon opening it, he found no one was there, but instead a small package, addressed to him.

"Don't recall ordering anything," he muttered as he took it to the coffee table and opened it up. Inside he found a curious remote with only two buttons, and an instruction manual. "Switching bodies? That's just ridiculous." It was something out of a bad movie, but it'd be awfully convenient if he could switch bodies. A lot of problems would be solved if he could investigate a crime scene under the guise of a new identity, after all.

*knock knock* Apollo suddenly found his thoughts interrupted by a knock at the door. Grumbling, he got back up and kicked his way through Trucy's things again, opening it up to find the large frame of Plum Kitaki, the mother of a past client. She seemed rather upset.

"Mrs. Kitaki? What's wrong?"

"Mr. Justice, I'm very glad you're here! Its my son, you see." Apollo had feared this, and let out an exhausted sigh. "Please, just hear me out. They arrested him for a robbery, but I know he didn't do it. He's a good boy; the family is getting out of such business."

"I believe you Mrs. Kitaki," Apollo said a bit nervously, "but your son is just... a hard client to work with. He's not very keen on talking to attorneys."

"There must be something you can do, you helped him once. Please, just talk to him; neither me nor my husband have any legal experience. We can't investigate on our own."

Apollo took a deep breath and thought about it. His eyes flickered over the remote. 'Wocky would probably be more forthcoming with his mother than me.' Being Plum would be rather... unpleasant, but Apollo doubted it would work anyways. If it did... well it wouldn't be for long, right? "I might have something that would make investigating easier," Apollo admitted.

Plum brightened up, "I knew you'd have something! What is it then?"

Apollo went over and picked up the remote. "We'll find out in a second," he said as he closed his eyes and pressed one of the buttons. Did he click aware swap as meant too, or unaware?
141332.title: Plum Kitaki

1413321.content:
In a few moments Apollo was standing on the other side of the room. He immediately felt the changes to his body. He felt a lot fatter, for lack of a better word. Although if he said that aloud he was sure Plum would kill him. The back of his head also heavy as he now had Plum's large headpiece connected to his hair. In his hand was Plum's signature broomsword, which he dropped on the floor immediately. The swap definitely worked.

He looked over to his body, which was in the middle of touching itself in shock, it was clear that Plum was in his body as well. Sh dropped the remote after the swap, which Apollo quickly went to picked up. He put it in th sleeve of Plum's kimono, thinking that there was enough room in the sleeve to conceal it.

Apollo decided to calm here down and explain what happened and about the swapping remote "Wocky wouldn't want to talk to me about what happened, but if he thought he was talking to you, then maybe he'll tell me." He explained, still getting used to a different voice coming out of his mouth.

Plum was shocked by the situation, but she seemed to understand. "Alright, Mr. Justice. Go talk to my son. Then come right back. Immediately" Plum said as she picked up her broom off the floor. "If you don't..." She said as she unsheathed the sword from the broom. That looked terrifying even in Apollo's body.

"Y-Yes ma'am" Apollo said, which sounded odd coming from Plum's body. He left the office and began to make his way to the detention center
1413321.title: Aware Swap

14133211.content:
Apollo left the office in a a daze. Moving with Plum's body was sort of like driving a big truck. He was heavy, and clumsy walking on her ridiculously raised sandals. Plum's kimono only made the feeling exacerbated; everything felt so... loose. Not to mention that Plum was about twice Apollo's age; he never realized how much energy his body had until now. All his chords of steel rehearsals and bike riding sessions really paid off; Plum's body felt a bit winded just getting into the cab!

"How'd it go, Mrs. Kitaki?" the driver asked him. Being called "Mrs." jut drove it all home how bizarre his situation was. As he sat down, the sensations of his new body became even more obtrusive. 'She's so... ugh, blubbery.'

"It, uh, went fine. I'm fine," he replied. Mrs. Kitaki's voice still felt alien to him. "I need you to drive me to the detention center right away though. It's important." He tried to sound commanding but flubbed a bit. Mrs. Kitaki always seemed self-assured, but Apollo just appeared uncomfortable as her.

"You got it ma'am," the cabby replied, thankfully ambivalent to Apollo's behavior. Soon he was off to the detention center.

---

"Keep the meter running," Apollo told the driver as they reached the station. He supposed that was one benefit of using Kitaki's body to investigate - cab fare went on her tab.

He waddled into the station with his arms crossed, one hand keeping the device secure in his sleeve. He didn't dare risk losing that thing. The officer working at the desk looked at him strangely as he approached, "can I help you ma'am?"

"Yes, I'm here to talk to... my son," Apollo explained. He hadn't envisioned himself saying anything like that for a long time, but here he was. "Wokky Kitaki. He's currently being held on suspicion of a burglary."

The officer looked through the some files. "He should be done with questioning now; I'll show you to him." With that, they walked to the room Apollo had visited many times before. Only now, he had to be a concerned mother rather than an attorney. He doubted his presentation won a lot of points; it was a bit hard to be concerned about Wocky.

"Mom?" Wocky shouted, a bit surprised as Apollo sat down across from the window to meet him. "You came already? I told you I'd be fine - I ain't afraid of jail."

Apollo looked Wocky over a bit. He seemed.... skinnier. A bit pallid. If Apollo had to guess, Wocky was recovering from surgery. 'Glad to know they got the bullet out of him atleast.' Wocky just looked at him in confusion at his silence. 'Oh yeah! Concerned mom.'

"Wocky, just look at you! You're as skinny as a twig. You wouldn't last a minute in jail," Apollo said, affecting his voice as much as possible. Wocky seemed to cringe a bit at this, and Apollo admitted that seeing Wocky actually listen to his words gave a bit of satisfaction. "I want you to tell me everything you did... son. Mr. Justice is going to need it all if he wants to help you."

---

About a half hour later, Apollo had the full story. Wocky claimed that when the convenience store was robbed, he was walking back home and was merely caught up in the action as the robbers left the premise.

"But where were you at before? If anyone saw you, they can give an alibi." Wocky's face went a bit red. "Wocky, tell me where you were or else! You weren't committing a DIFFERENT crime, were you?" Now that he'd been conversing, he realized Plum had some mean vocal chords. Not too mention a wide mouth; it was no wonder even Wocky would listen to her. Apollo was almost having fun now that a usually troublesome client was so easily spilling forth. The remote was definitely giving him an advantage, he knew that.

"Please mom? Do I have to?" He seemed embarassed by whatever the truth was.

"Yes, now come clean!"

"Fine... I was at a book club..."

Apollo stared at Wocky with a blank expression on Plum's face. "That's it?"

"You don't understand! Even if I'm out of the thug-life, I gotta keep up appearances! Tough guys don't go to book clubs, but, well, I'm still recovering and all so I was bored..." he shamefully looked away from Apollo, who couldn't believe what he was hearing.

'I needed to literally become the guy's MOM to get him to confide that?!"

"Well give me a name! Who's in this book club? We can go find them and with their testimony you'll be cleared!"

Wocky grunted before finally giving Apollo a name from the club. Who was it?
14133211.title: Follow Apollo as Plum

141332111.content:
Apollo frowned. He remembered Stickler from the first case he defended Wocky in. 'Can't stand that weirdo.' Hopefully he wouldn't be a problem too. "Alright, I'll let Mr. Justice know," Apollo said to Wocky.

Wocky stared at him for a moment as he got up, he then mumbled uncomfortably, "sorry mom..."

Apollo thought about it for a second before replying. "I'll forgive if you promise to cooperate with Apollo completely in the future. And stop trying to go to jail! "

"Fiiiiiiine," Wocky responded, "I'll be nice to the stupid lawyer guy."

Apollo figured that was as good a promise as he was going to get, and departed the station, taking the cab back to the office. Stickler was annoying, but he wasn't a criminal or anything, so there was time to go get his body back. Apollo figured he would be easy to get a hold of, even if getting a real testimony would be difficult. 'I suppose the switcher might come in handy.'

He was glad to be back at the office when the cab stopped. He walked to the door and opened it without knocking, hoping to switch back as soon as possible.

Was Plum waiting alone, or had someone else entered the office while Apollo was gone?
141332111.title: Wesley Stickler

choices: Someone entered the office before they swapped back
He accidentally did an unaware swap
1413321111.content:
Apollo entered the office and let out a sigh of relief, Plum was alone. He was worried that either Mr. Wright or Trucy would come by the office while he was gone. He shuddered at the thought of Plum in his body acting like herself in front of them, he doubted Plum would bother keeping the swap a secret.

Plum in his body was sweeping the floor, which looked rather odd from Apollo's body. She looked up when he arrived "Mr. Justice! You're back! How is Wocky doing? Can you prove him innocent yet? " She said, it was clear she was worried about Wocky. Any mother in her situation would be.

Apollo explained to her about what happened at the detention center and how Wocky was allegedly at a book club on the night of the robbery. He kept quiet about who he was with, he didn't want Plum to find out her son was hanging out with the man who stole her panties during that case a while back.

"Good work, Mr. Justice." Plum said with a laugh.

"Okay, now that that's done, I'm going to switch us back now. Okay?" Apollo said as he got the remote from his sleeve. The sooner he could get out of Plum's large body and back into his own younger body, the better

"Ha Ha! Yes, I don't know how long I could stand being in your scrawny body! It will be so great to be at home in my beautiful body!" Plum said, clearly not enjoying the swap as much as Apollo was. Apollo rolled his eyes as Plum went on to talk about how much better her body was then his. Then again, he was thinking the same thing about his body the whole time he was in hers. "Well, hurry up already." She said as she once again pulled the sword out of her broom.

Apollo pointed the remote at Plum in his body and got ready to swap them back...
1413321111.title: Plum was Alone

14133211111.content:
Suddenly Apollo's perspective changed once again, and he was back to his normal shape and size, letting out a sigh of relief until he realized he was holding Plum's sword. He slowly put the broom sword down on the coffee table, a bit nervous at the weapon. He looked to Plum, who seemed similarly happy switching back, patting down her body to make sure everything was in tact.

She realized he was staring at her and laughed, "Ahaha! What, miss it already? I don't blame you. Next time though, be sure to ask permission first."

"Yeah, sure," Apollo replied sarcastically. "I think this is yours," he said, pointing to the sword.

"Ah! Right, and this is yours," she said as she handed him the remote , taking the broomsword from off the table. "Now, I'll keep that little device of yours a secret so long as you get my son declared innocent, alright?"

Apollo nodded, "You got it Mrs. Kitaki. I doubt it'll be a hard trial to win; his alibi should be solid."

"Good! I'll see you tomorrow then," she said as she walked out of the office and back to her cab.

Apollo sat down again and began to reread the manual, still shocked about everything that just happened. He could scarcely believe that worked! Usually he'd have to pester a client with evidence or something to get them to cooperate, but with Plum's body he just had to nag. This would prove an amazing investigation tool if he used it carefully.

He looked at the clock and decided he was best served going to interview Stickler. Stickler was a troublesome person; rather full of himself and emotional. It SHOULD be a simple interview, but then, Wocky should've been a simple interview as well. "I did sort of humiliate him at that trial," Apollo mumbled, recalling how he outed Stickler as a panty thief. "It might help to approach him as a different person."

Wanting to test the remote a bit more, Apollo figured he would find a person to switch with. He knew Stickler was a big fan of Trucy's stage performance - so he might listen to her. Otherwise, a figure of authority would be his best bet; someone like prosecutor Gavin or the Detective Skye. He was hesitant to use it on one of them though; revealing the remote to the 'enemy' so to speak seemed a bit unwise.
14133211111.title: Successfully swapped back

141332111111.content:
Apollo thought over his options and soon decided that switching with Trucy would be the best thing to do. Wesley was a huge fan of her magic show, especially here magic panties act. He even committed panty thievery to find the secrets of her magic act. If he became Trucy he could probably get Wesley to talk about what happened that night in exchange for the "secret of the magic panties"

Apollo looked at the clock, it was around three. "Trucy should be home from school soon." He thought aloud. As soon as Apollo thought that, Trucy came in the door. She had a habit of doing things like that. Apollo jumped from surprise as she suddenly came in, getting a laugh from Trucy.

"Hey, Polly. You won't believe who I saw on my way in!" She said in her usual happy mood.

"Let me guess, was it Ms. Kitaki?" Apollo said with confidence.

"Whoa! how did you know?" Trucy said shocked.

"She was just here. Wocky was arrested for robbery, we're going to be defending him in court tomorrow." He explained. "I already talked to him. He should have a solid alibi, but we have a bit of a problem..."

"What is it?" Trucy asked.

"The person he was with last night was Wesley Stickler." Apollo began

"The panty thief?!" Trucy interrupted him. She was completely devastated when her magic panties were stolen and she hadn't forgiven Wesley for what he did.

"Yeah, I'm going to go talk to him, but, I don't think he'll want to talk to me after what happened." He explained. "So, I'm gonna need a little bit of help from you." Apollo said and pointed the remote toward Trucy.

"What do you need me to-" She began, but she was interrupted by Apollo pressing the button on the remote "-Do" She finished, but was shocked by the voice that came out of her mouth.

Apollo had successfully done an aware swap with Trucy. He hadn't been in her body for more than a minute, but it already felt a lot more comfortable than Ms. Kitaki's body. Trucy's body a slimmer than his own, and the fact he was now seven years younger made him felt a lot more energetic. Although, Trucy's magician outfit covered a lot less of the body than Ms. Kitaki's kimono, making him notice the changes to his body a lot more.

Trucy in his body was having a reaction similar to Ms. Kitaki when she was put into his body. She was feeling around, not believing what happened. "Polly! What did you do?!" She shouted shocked. Apollo's cords of steel made her much louder. Unlike Ms. Kitaki, she didn't drop the remote on the ground when she was swapped, probably because she was used to holding things, such as her panties and her hat, in her hand.

Apollo calmed her down and explained everything to Trucy, he explained how he had swapped with Ms. Kitaki to get Wocky's alibi. Once she knew what was going on, Trucy seemed a lot more excited about the swap.

"Wow! That's amazing Polly! Think of all the cool things we can do with this remote! It could be the greatest magic act ever!" She shouted excitedly.

Worried about what she would do, Apollo took the remote from his old body.

"Hey! Give it back!" Trucy said and tried to take the remote back. Apollo held it out of reach from her, which was hard to do with her now being taller than him.

"Trucy, this remote is a very special thing. If you use it in one of your shows someone might steal it from you!." He tried to reason with her.

"Okay, I won't use it in one of my shows, but can I at least play with it a little?" She said and tried to put on a cute face to get her way, but it didn't exactly look cute from Apollo's body.

Apollo sighed, it was clear she wasn't going to give up. "Fine, I'll let you play with it." He said. Trucy reached for the remote again after he said that, but he pulled it a little further away. "AFTER I talk to Wesley." He finished.

"Okay! Hurry up and go! I wanna play with it as soon as I can!" Trucy said and practically pushed Apollo out the door.
141332111111.title: Apollo Switches with Trucy

choices: He pushes the Aware Swap button in a hurry.
He presses the Unaware Swap button. What is going to happen?
14133211113.content:
Apollo found himself back in his usual red suit with his spiky hair and his chords of steel. Looking straight ahead, he saw Plum back in her usual body, but something seemed off. Plum was staring daggers at him and seemed prepared to draw her sword an second.

"Hurry and swap us back!! I want to be back in my beautiful body now!!" Plum shouted.

"Wait... Uhhh... WHATT???" Apollo yelled out. "I must have pressed the unaware swap button accidentally, this is bad, Mrs Kitaki thinks that my Body is hers, and that her body *shudders* is mine." Apollo thought to himself.

"Now!!!" Plum shouted, obviously not being able to comprehend why Apollo was taking such a long time. "I know my body is great, but it is my body!!!"

"It's now or never" Apollo thought to himself as he quickly pushed a button. "If I do an aware swap now, I might just be stuck in her body, but if I do an unaware swap again? I might not have a body to go back to...."
14133211113.title: He accidentally did an unaware swap

1413321112.content:
As Apollo opened the door, he almost immediately bumped into Trucy on her way out, dragging Plum as Apollo by the wrist.

"Oh!" she exlaimed. "Ms. Kitaki?!"

"Er, yes," Apollo was internally panicking a bit, unsure how to proceed. He didn't want to reveal the remote just yet to anyone else - he especially didn't want to reveal it to Trucy while he was Mrs. Kitaki of all people.

"Well, I'm really sorry ma'am, but you'll have to come by later," Trucy said as she began to maneuver around Apollo's large frame. "Apollo here needs a break, so I'm taking him somewhere to relax for an afternoon."

"Wait, hold on!" Apollo shouted back, "err, its about my son! He needs a lawyer!"

Trucy stopped at this, much to Plum's relief in Apollo's body. "We'll be back in like, 2 hours!" she exclaimed cheerfully, "just come on by then. Apollo needs a moment of rest!" Trucy moved in and spoke quietly, "I think he's having a bit of a breakdown." Apollo could only assume that Trucy was referring to Plum's behavior as him.

"We'll be back, don't worry!" she said cheerily, once again dragging away the reluctant Plum Kitaki towards the bus stop, the vehicle parked with its doors open. Plum turned her head to Apollo, and mouthed something at him. Apollo could only assume she was asking him to use the remote, but he hesitated. If he did use it, Trucy would still drag him off, leaving the remote with Plum, and he probably wouldn't be able to continue the investigation right away. Furthermore, as they got more distant, precision became harder to maintain; it was possible he'd switch with Trucy by mistake, or even someone on the bus! Did Apollo risk a swap from the distance?
1413321112.title: Someone else was there too

14133211121.content:
Apollo decided to risk swapping. He couldn't stand being in Plum's body for even this moment. He was not going to stay as her for two more hours, perhaps longer knowing Trucy's sense of time. He had to risk swapping, even if he messed up and became someone else, it would still better then being Plum. It was pretty clear from her facial expressions and the words she mouthed to him that she felt the same way about being in his body.

He took aim as Plum and Trucy began to get into the bus. He couldn't keep his arm straight while in Plum's body. He tried to aim as best as he could, time was running out. He didn't even pay attention to which button he pressed as he fired the remote. It didn't really matter at this point, if he did an Unaware swap he would at least be in a more comfortable body while Plum and Trucy were out.

Who did Apollo swap with?
14133211121.title: Yes

choices: Being dragged around by Trucy (Aware Swap)
141332111211.content:
Aiming the remote as best he could, and hoping beyond hope that it hit its intended target, Apollo pressed one of the buttons on the remote with one of Plum's pudgy fingers. Almost instantly, Apollo felt much lighter, no longer being weighed down by Plum's body. He could also tell that he was male again. Looking down, he was ecstatic to see his familiar red suit back where it belonged. He had managed to hit his mark, and swapped back with Plum.

Taking note of his surroundings, Apollo noticed that he was...
141332111211.title: Plum

1413321112112.content:
Apollo's joy at getting his body back dulled a bit when he realised he was still standing around at the entrance to the office, exactly where he had been standing before the swap. If he had done it right, he should have ended up being dragged around by Trucy as she tried to get him to relax a bit. Apollo realised that in his rush to try and swap back with Plum, he must have accidentally pressed the Unaware Swap button, rather than the Aware Swap one. Unfortunately, this meant that while he did have his own body back, everyone still thought he was Plum Kitaki. This would also make things a little awkward once Plum and Trucy returned in two hours, since Plum would now believe that Apollo's body was her real body. He'd have to do both an aware swap and an unaware swap on her in order to set things straight. Apollo just hoped Plum wouldn't be in too much of a rush to get "her body" back. If he did the aware swap first, there was a chance Plum might run off before he could do the unaware swap, but if he did the unaware swap first, Plum might get suspicious about what he was doing or something. Either way, this wasn't exactly a good situation to be in. It would probably be easier to explain what had happened, but Apollo had a feeling that might complicate things, and if Trucy stuck around, it would mean exposing his little secret.

Apollo let out a sigh. As much as he would have liked to get started on the case, there wasn't much he could do with the world believing he was Plum. At the very least, he'd feel more comfortable waiting in his own body for the next few hours than he would have been in Plum's. He felt a little guilty, knowing that while he got to wait around in his own body, Plum would be spending the next two hours or so feeling very uncomfortable in a body she didn't know was really her's. But regardless of how he may feel, there was nothing he could really do about it now. Apollo took a seat inside the office, not daring to go anywhere else with everyone thinking he was Plum, and planned to wait out the two hours until Trucy came back with his client's mother.
1413321112112.title: Still at the office (Unaware Swap)

14133211121122.content:
Not being able to properly investigate Wocky's case until he got back to his own life, Apollo had decided to use the time wisely and catch up on some of the paperwork that had been building up on his desk. Thankfully Mr. Wright never showed up to question why who he thought was Plum Kitaki was doing Apollo's work. The time hadn't been too stressful, it was almost like a regular day at work even, but knowing that the world currently saw him as another person, something he needed to fix as soon as possible, was enough to put him on edge. As it reached the two hour mark, Apollo put everything back in its place, before sitting down on the couch and waiting for Trucy to return with the real Ms. Kitaki.

It ended up being an extra half-hour after that when Plum and Trucy finally returned to the office, the latter surprised to see Apollo there. "Oh, Mrs. Kitaki. You're still here?"

"Well, you said to come back in two hours, and you didn't lock the door to the office when you left," Apollo stated. He left out the part about him actually staying at the office during those two hours, rather than leaving and coming back.

"Oh, okay," Trucy replied, seemingly buying Apollo's story. "Well, I guess I'll let you two get on with your legal stuff, then." Cheerful as ever, Trucy practically skipped out of the room. It seemed she had enjoyed her afternoon together with 'Apollo'.

Mrs. Kitaki, however, was nowhere near as pleased. The moment Trucy was out of earshot, Plum looked menacingly at Apollo and asked, "Why didn't you swap us back before she dragged me off?"

"I tried, trust me. You just got too far away before I could target you properly." Apollo decided not to tell Plum that it was actually his fault for pressing the wrong button. What she didn't know, couldn't hurt her, and trying to explain to her that she was actually already in her own body, she just didn't know it, would probably only make things even more confusing.

"Well, swap us back now. I can't stand being in your body for a second longer." Apollo nodded, trying not to think too hard about the fact that Plum was referring to her usual plump form as "your body". He pulled the remote out of his pocket, and pointed it at Plum. Now he just had to figure out what the best course of action was. Should he reverse the aware swap first, or the unaware swap?
14133211121122.title: Two hours later, Trucy returns

choices: Apollo spots her and swaps back
Plum is gone and Apollo is stuck with her body
141332111211221.content:
Reversing the aware swap first, Apollo found himself once again uncomfortable in Plum's body, but this time Plum seemed pleased by the swap.

"Ah, it's so good to be myself again," she said, not realising she actually had Apollo's body now.

It wasn't until after performing the swap that Apollo realised what a terrible idea it was to reverse the aware swap first. Doing it this way, the remote would stay with his own body, now inhabited by Plum, who had dropped it when the swap occurred. Unlike the first time, though, the remote fell right into a big pile of stuff Trucy used for her magic tricks. Which meant that if he wanted his body back, he'd need to act fast and find the remote in the pile.

But before he could do so, Plum spoke again. "After all you've put me through, you'd better get Wocky declared innocent," she said, stepping around Trucy's stuff to get her broom. "Oh, and don't you even think about using that thing on me again, understand?" She revealed part of the sword hidden within her broom to emphasize how serious she was about this. If she knew what was really going on, though, Apollo had a feeling she'd be begging him to use it on her again. But instead of saying anything, Apollo just nodded. "Good."

And with that, Plum turned and walked towards the door. That was the chance Apollo needed, as he waddled over to the pile of Trucy's stuff as quickly as he possibly could considering the body he was in, and began rummaging through the pile to try and find the remote. It didn't take too long, seeing as how the remote was still fairly close to the top of the pile, but Apollo was afraid he may have already wasted too much time. He headed to the office door and looked around, hoping to spot Mrs. Kitaki before she left with his body.
141332111211221.title: Aware Swap

1413321112112212.content:
Apollo picked up the remote and went out the door and into th hallway. Plum was there. He began to get scared that Plum would get away before he could do another swap. Hopefully she hadn't got a cab and left the building yet, he began to head downstairs hoping to catch her before she left. He went as fast as Plum's body could, but as he kept going he got more winded and soon he was barely at walking speed. By the time he got outside Plum was already long gone.

His body was gone. He could try going to the Kitaki family home to get his body back, but with how serious Plum was about not swapping with her again, she would probably do something horrible to him if she saw him around her home with the remote. With his spirit broken, he headed back up to the office to contemplate his situation.

As he got back to the office, he sat down and looked at the remote. Although it was useful in getting Wocky's alibi, it also lost him his body and possibly ruined his life. At the same time though, the remote was the only thing that could fix him at this point. While getting his body back from Plum wasn't an option at this point, he could swap with someone else. While sticking someone else with Plum's body was a pretty horrible thing to do, staying in Plum's body was WAY to uncomfortable for him.

He thought about what kind of swap he should do. He settled on doing another unaware swap. He wanted to keep his life the same, but with a body more comfortable than Plum's. Plus, the person he would switch with wouldn't know they had been swapped at all. The only question at this point was WHO to switch with. The nearest person was Trucy, but did he really want to give her Plum's body? Trucy was a great person and he didn't want her to deal with having a body like this. Another option was to swap with Mr. Wright. If he did that he would be male again. There was also plenty of other people in town he could switch with.

Thinking over his options he decided to switch with...

"Actually," Apollo interjected, "this isn't that far off from my original plan." He explained to Plum the information he gained from Wocky at the Detention Center while using her body.

"He's reading?" She asked, sounding almost pleased. However, Apollo saw his face soon turn sour, "wait! THAT sicko? Why would Wocky ever associate with him?!" "I'd guess they met after the trial. Stickler was a witness after all," Apollo offered. "Anyways, while its a bit cruel to leave Trucy stranded back there, I had planned to take her body for this interview anyways. Stickler is a fan of her magic shows; he won't listen to me after what I did to him in court, but he might be willing to talk to her, especially if he thinks I can give him some of her secrets."

"I'm not so sure of this," Plum replied, still concerned. "She still has that... contraption, right?"

"Yes, but Trucy can probably put things together, and I don't think she'd lose it. And this way, you can help the investigation to get your son free, right?"

"I suppose..." Plum replied. The thought of being able to participate in her son's defense certainly appealed to her.

The two of them were suddenly jolted again as the bus came to an abrupt stop, Apollo pulling his arms up to hold onto Trucy's hat. "Oh! This is where we get off I think," Apollo states, getting up from the bench. Acting like Trucy would, he gripped Plum in his body by the arm and pulled her out of the bus and onto the street corner. "Come on! The fast we do this the faster we get back to Trucy!"

---

A short walk later, and the two managed to find Stickler silently reading in the back of the University Library. Apollo got some odd looks due to Trucy's getup, but brushed it off as the two approached the desk.

Apollo-as-Trucy gave a cough, but Stickler gave no notice. He cleared his throat again, louder, but still nothing.

"Hey, weirdo! We're talking to you!" Plum suddenly shouted, smacking her hand down on the table, prompting Stickler to drop his book and bolt his attention upwards. Plenty of heads turned at this; the library was quiet and Apollo was suddenly realizing just how loud his body was. Apollo was thankful that she didn't have the sword; he feared what Plum would do to him if she was armed.

"Oh dear! Y-you! You wish to destroy me again?!" He cried out, seeing what looked to him an angry Apollo Justice, who months before had ruined his reputation in a public court trial.

"No! No! Its nothing like that!" Apollo asserted, stepping between Plum in his body and Stickler. "We're uh, here on an investigation," he said, trying to sound cheerful as possible with Trucy's voice. 'Be friendly, keep the peace.'

"Why, what could you want from me? I'm perfectly innocent of any crime."

"Pffft, yeah right," Plum said, dismissing him. "You sure you haven't been stealing anymore underwear since June?"

Stickler looked all around, terrified that people might be hearing this. "Please, not so loud! What do you want from me?"

Trying to sound upbeat, Apollo interjected again. Imitating Trucy, he playfully knocked her hat to the side and gave an uncertain smile, "don't worry! It's nothing serious. We're representing Wocky, you know him, right?"

"You mean the rude brute from the reading circle?" he asked, calming down a bit.

"What was that about my -" Apollo put a hand over Plum's mouth, silencing her before she got them kicked out.

"He's being charged for a crime he didn't commit," Apollo explained trying to maintain his cool while Plum was furiously trying to break away, "but he said you can give him an alibi. You saw him last night, right?"

Closing his book shut, Wesley looked Apollo in the eyes. "Maybe. I can give you my testimony... if you do something for me."

---

A short period later, the two were back on the bus, returning to the office. Plum's hair was askew, her face still red with anger. "He just wanted to know a magic trick?"

Apollo shrugged. "Some people are really weird like that," he said complacently. By this point, nothing surprised him much. "Anyways, explaining the 'magic panties' routine to him is Trucy's problem. The important thing is, he'll testify for us, so the prosecution won't have much to throw on Wocky aside from circumstantial evidence."

The two of them jumped out of the bus at the stop right outside the office. "I don't think Trucy would go anywhere," Apollo said, "lets get in there quick and explain what happened to her."

Was Trucy (and by extension, Plum's body and the remote) inside the agency?

Eventually though, she finds it underneath a stray sheet. "Where did it go?" she muttered through clenched teeth, struggling to throw aside tarps, hoops, and other props.

142.content:
It was early morning on a weekday, and Apollo was embroiled in the most boring part of being an attorney: paperwork. There was a lot of filing to do between cases, and the law office had just finished a hell of a case at the space center. It was an emotional roller coaster, but it was finally over, and the people involved managed to find some closure.

...and then they dumped all the paperwork off on Apollo. The moment the exciting stuff ended,Trucy and Athena made themselves scarce. Furthermore, Mr. Wright suddenly had business over at Kurain. Apollo suspected it wasn't as important as Wright led on though. Thus, Apollo was left all alone to see the case out to its boring conclusion.

Several hours later, in the mid afternoon, Apollo finally finished the paper work with an exhausted sigh. He got up and stretched his arms and legs, but was interrupted by a ringing at the door.

"Oh? A client maybe?" Apollo had wanted to relax after all that, but it would be irresponsible to turn away a potential defendant from the office just because he was tired. He walked into the cluttered lobby - filled with Trucy's props and knick-knacks, and opened the door only to find no one there but a package on the ground.

"That's odd," he muttered as he picked it up. It was a bit late for mail, and usually they wanted someone to sign for these things, but he decided to ignore it and check the package out. Laying it out on the coffee table, he tore it open and pulled out a small remote and a set of instructions. After reading it over, he was incredulous. Body Swapping was impossible... but then, one would think that spirit channeling or robot uprisings were also impossible. He thought about it, and the idea of swapping bodies was appealing. He could be like Trucy and live without a care in the world, or become someone like Mr. Wright and be his own boss. It'd be great! No one could shove paperwork on him.

He figured there was no harm in humoring whoever gave him the device. It wasn't that heavy and didn't seem very dangerous. Worst case scenario was he just asked Athena to do the paperwork next time.

Who does he try to switch with?

1421.title: Apollo swaps with Trucy

14211.content:
As soon as the button was pressed, Apollo felt the changes take effect almost immediately. He felt much shorter, and slimmer. He could feel Trucy's hair tickling the back of his neck, her hat resting atop his head, and her dress clinging tightly to his body. The biggest change though was the void between his legs, and the weight on his chest. Trucy's magician outfit, although not exactly what he'd call 'revealing', showed off a bit more than his usual suit, and only made the changes even more obvious. He also noticed that he no longer had the remote, and instead held a magic wand and a large pair of panties in his small, gloved hands.

Before Apollo could do anything else, he heard a loud scream behind him, along with a clattering sound. He quickly turned around, feeling Trucy's cape swish around him as he did so, to see his own body, now occupied by Trucy, staring at him, fear evident on her face. The remote had dropped to the ground, which was probably what the clattering sound was.

"Polly, what did you do!?" Trucy screamed, terrified of what was going on.

"Well, I swapped bodies with you," Apollo answered, remaining calm since he was the one who'd caused the swap. It was still strange for him to hear Trucy's voice coming out of his mouth though.

"B-But how? This isn't... you shouldn't..."

Apollo placed Trucy's magic stuff down on a chair before walking up to where Trucy had dropped the remote, Trucy following him with her eyes the whole time. He picked up the remote off the floor and showed it to her, realising how much taller Trucy was than him now. "I used this remote."

Before Apollo could even get anything else out, Trucy interrupted. "But, how does it work? And why'd you switch with me?"

Apollo sighed, before explaining everything, from the remote arriving at the office, to his reasons for swapping with Trucy. Once he had finished explaining, Trucy seemed to understand, but she still seemed to be very uncomfortable in Apollo's body.

"Well," she said, finally starting to calm down, "If you wanted time to relax, you probably shouldn't have swapped with me."

"Why not?"

"Well, I have a show to do tonight."

Apollo frowned. Had this been anyone else, he would have asked what they meant by "a show to do", but since this was Trucy he was talking to, he knew she was talking about a magic show. That wasn't what he was frowning about, though. "I thought Mr. Wright said no shows while he's in Kurain."

"I know, but I just couldn't say no to a chance to perform. So, you can't be me right now. I need time to practice."

This was not exactly how Apollo had intended this to go. If Trucy had a show tonight, he'd have to find someone else to swap with to get his day off... or would he? Sure, it wasn't a "day off" exactly, but the life of a magician might still be more relaxing than that of a defense attorney. Trucy was still in her teens, and she made it all look so easy, so how hard could it really be?
