Athena holds onto the remote herself
14232122111111111.content:
With just the press of a button, Apollo found himself once again in a female body, although this time he now possessed the body of his colleague, Athena Cykes. If suddenly finding herself in his body didn't prove to her that this was real, and that he and Juniper weren't crazy, he didn't know what would. He had decided to swap himself with Athena, rather than swapping Juniper with her, since he had already swapped Juniper once without her permission today, and it didn't really seem right to do it again. Of course, he could have just asked for Juniper's permission to swap her with Athena, but that didn't cross his mind until he was already standing in Athena's place.

Apollo's plan didn't seem as smart, however, when he was forced to cover his ears from Athena's screams of shock. Athena with his chords of steel and him with Athena's sensitive hearing made for a killer combo. Of course, even without Athena's hearing, Athena's scream had been loud enough to make Juniper wince a little as well.

"This is... how? I... what?" Athena rambled, not entirely believing what was in front of her eyes. Her eyes darted back and forth between the male body she now possessed, and her own body standing in front of her, hands clamped over its ears.

"Athena, indoor voice, please," Apollo said, slowly lowering his hands as Athena started to calm down. "So, you believe us, right?"

Athena nodded, a grin starting to spread across her face. "Yeah, of course I do. This is so cool!" Not used to Apollo's voice, Athena found herself shouting a little too loud again, and apologised as she noticed Apollo wince again.

Apollo was about to suggest that they swap back and go see Mr. Powers, but before he could do se, the lawyer duo were distracted by the sound of someone trying to suppress their laughter. It didn't take long to figure out who it was coming from; the only other person in the room, Juniper. "Sorry," she said, realising she had inadvertently interrupted the conversation, "I kind of see what you were talking about with us acting weird, 'Thena." Apollo smiled, realising how weird it must be for her to see him and Athena acting like each other. He had swapped with two other people now, but he had yet to see how two other people who had been swapped acted.

This momentary distraction that Juniper had provided gave Athena the opportunity to steer the conversation in the direction she wanted. "So, why'd you swap with Junie, Apollo?"

"Well, Mr. Wright's basically loaded me with all the paperwork while he's away in Kurain, and since you're not helping out at all, I decided to use the remote to take the rest of the day off by swapping with Juniper."

"That's it?"

"Yeah."

Athena sighed at how mundane Apollo's reason for swapping had been. She had almost expected this to have something to do with Junie's completely obvious crush on Apollo that he was somehow oblivious to. "Have you used it at all before that?"

"Nope, it just came in the mail today. I don't even know where it came from."

"Wait, you don't even know where this thing came from? What if it was dangerous? Did you even think about that before using it on Junie?"

"Well, sorry. Maybe if you helped out a little more at the office, the idea of taking a vacation wouldn't have been so appealing to me."

Feeling more than a little awkward about being present for the argument that was unfolding, Juniper decided to intervene. "Well, the remote isn't dangerous, so that doesn't really matter, right? I mean, Apollo and I switched and nothing bad happened."

Athena sighed, realising she had gotten mad over nothing. "Yeah, I guess you're right. Sorry about that, Apollo."

"It's fine. Just, try not to dump all your work on me all the time, okay?"

"Alright." Apollo had a feeling she was still going to do it anyway, but at least she apologised.

Finally taking control of the conversation back from the over-emotional Athena, Apollo said, "Well, we should probably swap back and head down to the detention center to see Mr. Powers."

"You don't want your vacation anymore?" Athena asked in a joking tone.

"We have a client now. My day off can wait."

"I should probably get going too," Juniper interjected. "Good luck on the case, you two."

"See you later, Junie," Athena called out.

"See you, Juniper. Thanks for letting me use your body for a little while," Apollo said, taking on a much more calm tone of voice than his bodyswapped companion.

Once Juniper had left, Athena headed towards the door too, stating, "Well, we should get going, we've got investigating to do."

Apollo, however, blocked her path to the exit. "Before we leave, give me the remote so I can swap us back."

Athena frowned. She had silently hoped that Apollo would forget about that, as she was starting to enjoy this whole bodyswapping thing. The remote had been in her hand after the swap, and she had slipped it into Apollo's pocket so that she'd be the one holding onto it for now, but Apollo had gone through this before and knew where the remote would end up. "Why do you have to be the one that keeps it?" Athena asked, hoping to have more time to play around with this gizmo that caused all sorts of scientific impossibilities.

"Because finders keepers," Apollo replied, not having a real reason besides that. "Now give it here."
14232122111111111.title: Apollo swaps Athena with himself

choices: Apollo and Athena head to the detention center in each other's bodies
Someone comes into the office as Apollo and Athena are leaving
142321221111111112.content:
Athena left the remote in her pocket, deciding she didn't want to give it up just yet. "What if I don't want to swap back yet?" she asked. "I mean, you got to be Junie for... who knows how long before I found you, why don't I get to hang on to your body for a while?"

Apollo could have explained that he hadn't actually been in Juniper's body for that long before Athena came and dragged him off to Global Studios, but instead he opted to actually answer her question. "Because we've got a job to do right now."

"We're both defense attorneys, and we're both working on the same case, what difference is it going to make if we're in each other's bodies while we investigate?"

"Why are you so insistent on keeping my body?"

"Why are you so insistent on getting out of my body? Was Junie's body really that much better than mine?"

"Those were different circumstances. Please, you can mess around with the remote after the trial if you want."

"Ooo, tempting, but how do I know you're not just saying that to get me to give you the remote back?"

Apollo let out a sigh, realising this argument was going nowhere. "You're really not going to give in, are you?"

"Nope. Now come on, we've got to go see our client."

Apollo knew he wasn't going to win this argument, so for the time being, he had not choice but to put up with Athena borrowing his body. He just hoped that them being each other would really make as little difference to the investigation as Athena had said it would.
142321221111111112.title: Athena holds onto the remote herself

14232122111111112.content:
Not feeling like switching again, Apollo opted to swap Athena and Juniper instead. Suddenly, Athena's eyed widened as Juniper in her body realized what happened. She didn't seem that shocked, having done it before, but she and Apollo both ended up clamping their hands over their ears as Athena gave a short but loud shriek from Juniper's body.

"What the - how the!" She was flailing her arms about confused, losing Juniper's hat somewhere in the commotion. "It really worked! This is amazing! And weird!"

"One way to put," Apollo said as he pulled his hands away from his head, "now can you quiet down?"

"Oh, uh, yeah, sorry," Athena muttered, pulling Juniper's hair in front her eyes in amazement. "Why would you keep this a secret from me Apollo!? And why did you switch with Juniper?"

Apollo crossed his arms and rolled his eyes, "I kinda just wanted a day off. Today was the first time I ever used it."

"You mean you just found it? Do you know where it's from?"

"Nope. Just showed up in the mail," Apollo admitted.

"That sounds simultaneously irresponsible and boring use for something like that," Athena said, looking at Apollo judgmentally. "Honestly you're the only person I can imagine who would use something so cool for something so mundane!"

"Uh, can I go back to my body now?" Juniper asked.

Apollo sighed, "yeah. There's no point in switching now that we have to go help Mr. Powers." He lifted the remote once again, clicking aware swap to put Athena and Juniper back to normal. Juniper was relieved and picked her hat back off the ground, but Athena seemed a bit disappointed that the change was so brief.

"Well, now that we have that device, we ought to put it to good use! Keep it with you, it might help us with our investigation," she clasped a fist in her palm, "and afterwards we can get back to having fun with it!"

"I'm... going to head back home. I don't know if I want to keep messing with something like that," Juniper interjected nervously. "You two can keep doing as you like, but it just makes me a bit nervous."

"That's fine Juniper," Apollo said, "we'll see you around. Anyways, we ought to head on out Athena."

---

Having gone seperate ways from Juniper, Apollo and Athena eventually arrived at the detention center. Apollo couldn't help but notice that Athena kept glancing to the device in his pocket. He could only assume she was going through all the ridiculous possibilities it posed, and was a bit worried at what she would want them to do with it.

Eventually they managed to have a moment with Mr. Powers, who was held behind bars. "Oh! You two must be Athena and Apollo, right? Mr. Wright has told me about you two." He was a big, imposing man, but his tone was genial. He kept cool under the pressure pretty well; probably because this wasn't the first time he had been arrested.

"Yes, we're sorry Mr. Wright isn't here - he's out of town at the moment," Apollo explained, Athena still seeming lost in her fantasy. "We've handled plenty of cases ourselves though, don't worry. We'll get you through the trial no problem. Now, can you tell us about what happened?"

Mr. Powers explained that, right before shooting had happened, one intern went to go find the director, only to find that she had been stabbed. The director survived, but she was in critical condition. The knife was later found inside Powers' trailer, although it had no fingerprints. Regardless, Powers was immediately labeled the primary suspect and was taken into police custody. It wasn't long after that that "Juniper" and Athena apparently stumbled upon the crime scene.

"Alright then!" Athena declared, suddenly speaking, "lets go investigate Mr. Powers trailer! If the culprit planted the knife there, they had to leave something else behind, right?"

"I guess so," Apollo agreed. It sounded as good a place as any to go. He turned to Will, "thanks Mr. Powers. I'm really sorry you have to go through this again. We'll get to the bottom of this, don't worry."

Mr. Powers thanked them again, telling them not to worry about him as they got up and left the precinct.

---

Back at the filming location, Apollo and Athena stood outside the police line. The crime was so recent that no one on the scene was letting them in. Even Ema told Apollo that letting attorneys in was a no-go, as the police weren't done yet. Apollo frowned at this but as he looked to Athena she seemed all smiles.

"What are you so giddy about Athena," he asked, a bit worried.

"This is the perfect opportunity!" She exclaimed! "We can get an edge over the prosecution if one of us uses the device to go investigate undercover as law enforcement. The other can stay behind and make sure whoever we switch with stays put and doesn't make problems with our body."

"That sounds rather illegal," Apollo replied.

"There's no laws against body swapping," Athena asserted. "They might MAKE some after this, but they can't prosecute us for something that's never happened before."

Apollo grimaced. "Ugh, alright, but I feel this will get us in trouble. Which one of us should switch?"
14232122111111112.title: Apollo swaps Athena with Juniper

142321221111111121.content:
"Oh oh me, me!" Athena said, raising her hand up high like a child in school. She had only been swapped with Juniper for around a minute and really wanted to get the feel of being in someone else's body. She had so many ideas for what to use the remote for and couldn't wait to try it out on her own for the first time.

"Alright. first we need to find someone to switch you with." Apollo told her. He wasn't complaining about staying in his body. He had already been someone else for most of the day and being in his own body felt like he was back from a long vacation. At the same time though, he had to admit that going into someone else's body was interesting and trying it again would have been nice.

He looked at the people entering and leaving the crime scene, looking for someone to swap Athena with. Then, as luck would have it, he spotted someone that would be perfect to swap her with. It was the prosecutor in charge of this case. If he swapped Athena with them then she would be able to go into the crime scene and investigate alongside the police. Investigating right alongside the police would probably get them a more coherent understanding and evidence of the case then their normal investigations.

Apollo turned to Athena to ask for her permission before he swapped her. "How about them?" He asked her. Not that she really had much choice, there wasn't exactly many people at the crime scene that she could switch with. The only people around other than dectective Skye and the prosecutor were random police officers, and he doubted that Athena wanted to swap with some random low rank police officer.

Athena looked at the prosecutor and eyed them up for a second. "Oooh, that should be fun. Switch us up!" She was WAY too excited to swap with someone, Apollo thought to himself. Especially swapping with someone who was the opposite gender. Then again, the first person he had swapped with was a girl, so he really didn't have a right to judge her.

Apollo pressed the aware swap button while pointing at Athena, then aimed the remote at the prosecutor and pressed the button once again. Who did he swap Athena with?
142321221111111121.title: Athena will switch with someone

1423212211111111212.content:
Athena had stars in her eyes as she pointed towards Prosecutor Gavin, who was speaking with Detective Skye off in the distance. "Him! Switch me with Gavin!" This seemed like a dream come true to her. She was hopping up and down, giddy like a school girl.

"What do I do when he's in your body?" Apollo asked, not sure if she was thinking this through.

Athena just shrugged, "the moment we switch, use those 'chords of steel' you got and scream in my ear! He'll probably pass out."

Apollo gave her an incredulous look. "Are you sure that'll work?"

"Yeah! My ears are very sensitive, remember?" She said as she wagged a finger at him. "I'm used to it now, so it wouldn't work on me, but when I was little I had sensory overloads a lot - its why I had the big headphones! If you did it right away, before he could adapt, I bet he wouldn't be able to take it."

"...but would your BODY be okay?" Apollo asked, still seeming skeptical.

"It'll be fiiiiiiine," she said, waving her hand. "Now, get him in the remote before he gets away."

Apollo rolled his eyes at the plan and complied, selecting Klavier as the first target for the swap. Klavier briefly noticed them in the distance and waved, but continued to go about his work on the crime scene. Apollo and Athena then went about finding a place to do the swap from. Eventually, they decided the office would be the best place, since it wasn't horribly far and no one would be able to interfere at all. Athena sat down on the couch, brimming with excitement, "alright, now do it!"

Apollo grimaced, clicking the aware swap button. For a brief moment, Athena's arms went limp and she seemed dazed. She looked like she was about to say something before Apollo interrupted.

"OBJECTION," he shouted, as close to Athena's ear as possible. Her eyeballs shook for a second, before she collapsed in a heap on the couch.

"There's no way that can be safe for her body," Apollo mumbled, as he shook a hand in front of her eyes. It seemed like it worked - Klavier was passed out and wouldn't cause any trouble. "There's no way I'm doing that a second time." He took a moment just to make sure his breathing was normal before he was satisfied enough to leave the office and head back to the crime scene.

Upon reaching the police line, he found what seemed to be Klavier Gavin with a ridiculous grin on his face and an offput Detective Skye waiting for him. "There he is!" Klavier shouted, "Apollo, come on in!"

"I really don't think we're ready to let defense attorneys in," Ema said dryly, as she opened a bag of Snackoos.

"Who's the prosecutor here?" 'Klavier' asked rhetorically. "I say he's in!"

"Uggh, your funeral," Ema said as she turned and walked off.

"So! Did it work? It worked right?" Athena turned to ask Apollo. Seeing Klavier act so excitable was unnerving to say the least. His voice sounded a bit higher with Athena using it as well.

"Yes, and it was disturbing," Apollo informed her, still weirded out. "I don't know how long he'll stay conked out for though, so we should be quick."

"Right," Athena replied, snapping Klavier's finger and putting a hand in pocket, trying to imitate his posture. "Let's go search!... Achtung!"

The investigation generally went on like that, with Athena pretending to be Klavier and doing a bad job at it. Not to mention she seemed to get lost in her own eyes anytime they passed a reflective surface; Apollo was sort of glad she wasn't left alone with his body for very long. The police all seemed a bit bewildered by it, and Apollo couldn't help but worry about how Klavier would react to all this when he woke up. 'Guess its not our problem.'

Apollo made a point of looking over all Klavier's files. It seemed the victim - Director Nichols - had been stabbed in the right side of her ribs. Drops of blood could then be tracked out of the trailer, but ended a few yards out. The knife itself was found in a trashcan in Power's trailer.

"Mr. Powers is right handed, right?" Apollo asked Athena, who gave a confirming nod, Klavier's weird hair curls bobbing as she did. "If that's so, then the knife wound should have gone through the left ribs if she was stabbed from the front. That means our real culprit is likely left handed." Apollo made note of this - it'd be important to recall for later.

As they continued their investigation, both of them interviewing witnesses around the studio, Apollo made note of another vital piece of information: the knife matched up perfectly with the type of knife found at the Craft Service station, and one knife was reported to have gone missing earlier. If they could get a witness to confirm that Powers hadn't been there that day, it'd give an important alibi alongside the hand used to do the stabbing.

Apollo pulled out his phone and looked at the time - they'd nearly been investigating for an hour. He began to worry about Athena's body back at the office. What would Klavier do if he woke up? "Athena, I think its time you switch back."

"Awww, really?" she seemed disappointed. "I kinda wanted to keep it up for a bit longer."

"We can't risk Klavier waking up," he said as he pulled out the device. "I'm going to make you a target now and switch you with him back at the office; ideally he'll never even realize we were involved. Keep looking around while I go back for you."

"Alright! I'll see if there's anything important left to sweep up! ...Herr Forehead," she giggled a bit at the catchphrase. Apollo scowled - he was glad to get her out of there, she was having too much fun. Normal Klavier was annoying enough.

Departing the crime scene, Apollo went back to the office, hoping everything was as he left it. Was Klavier still there when he got back?
1423212211111111212.title: Klavier Gavin

choices: He walks down to the crime scene with Klavier
14232122111111112121.content:
Apollo walked into the office and was glad to see that Klavier in Athena's body was still there. He wasn't so glad to see that Klavier was awake now. Klavier was looking at Athena's face in the mirror, playing with Athena's large crescent moon earing and making various faces.. Once Apollo closed the door Klavier looked over to him.

"Ah, Herr forehead! How was your day at the crime scene?" He asked in his usual accent, taking the fact he was in another body surprisingly well.

Apollo couldn't believe it, even in a situation like this Klavier stayed in his usual mood. He was even able to guess that he and Athena went to the crime scene "Aren't you surprised to be in a girl's body?" He asked confused.

Klavier gave a laugh and sat down on the couch. "Of course I was, at first, but I like to make the best of situations. It doesn't take a prodigy to figure out that you caused this, why else would you knock me out? When I woke up I chose to wait around until you and the Fraulein came back. Now let me ask you something Herr Forehead, how did you do this?" He asked.

Apollo was actually impressed with how Klavier figured everything out, but he didn't know if he should explain everything to him. He would probably have tell him about how he could swap peoples bodies, considering how Klavier already figured that out. but maybe he should omit what does the swaps.

As Apollo thought about how to explain everything to Kalvier, Klavier looked at the remote in Apollo's hand. "What's the fancy toy?" He asked. Apollo paled a bit as he Klavier noticed the remote. Klavier looked at Apollo pale and gave a light hearted laugh. "So that's how you did it. Pretty sweet toy there, where did you get it?" He asked

Apollo explained the whole thing to Klavier. Everything from getting the remote in the mail, to swapping with Juniper, to swapping Athena with Klavier. After hearing everything, Klavier did his signature air guitar. "Achtung Herr forehead! Quit the journey you've had."

Apollo let out a sigh of relief, he honestly expected Klavier to make a few jokes at his expense about how he swapped with Juniper earlier. After getting his thoughts together, he pointed the remote at Klavier. "I'm gonna swap you back with Athena now, okay?" He asked.

"So soon? C'mon, I've been in this office the whole time, most of it passed out. I barely know how it feels to be in this body. At least let me go and walk around outside in this body for a bit. I'm sure the Fraulein wouldn't mind being in my body for a while longer." Klavier tried to convince Apollo.

Apollo thought about it, but decided against it. "Sorry, but I told Athena I was swapping you two back right now." He explained.

"How 'bout I meet you halfway. Let's take a walk down to the crime scene and when we get there you can switch me and her back?" Klavier tried to negotiate with Apollo.

Apollo thought about it, Athena and Klavier did seem to both be enjoying the swap, maybe it would be better to walk down with Klavier and swap them then.
14232122111111112121.title: Yes

142321221111111121212.content:
"Well, okay," Apollo decided, putting the device in his pocket, "if you're sure." He supposed the two of them seemed to be having a good time, so he wouldn't ruin their fun. "We'll ask Athena how she feels when we reach the scene.

As the two of them walked, Apollo noticed that Klavier seemed to be rather enthralled by the whole situation. He wasn't really sure what amazed him so much. Klavier had a smile and was turning his head all over the place to catch any sound they passed by, be it a casual conversation or chirps of birds. "You're getting a kick out of this; what's up?"

"It's her ears, Herr Forehead," Klavier replied, excitement in his (or Athena's) voice. "She hears everything with so much clarity - and even things normal people wouldn't hear at all. I'm noticing every little fluctuation. It's pretty exciting for a musician; I'd kill for these ears."

It kinda made sense to Apollo when put that way. He hadn't been in Athena's body yet, but she had told him before that she could hear the most minute of emotions in people's voices. Klavier acted nonchalantly about everything, but Apollo knew he took the things he loved pretty seriously. And Klavier loved two things: music and justice. Athena's ears were probably more intensive than any pair of headphones.

Eventually they arrived at the crime scene and came across a very confused Athena as Klavier. "He woke up?!" she asked, startled to see herself walking around.

"Yes I did Fraulein Attorney, but don't worry, I'm not mad," Klavier replied with a smile. "In fact, I'm interested."

Athena turned to Apollo, "so why didn't you switch the two of us back?"

Apollo gave a shrug, "you seemed to like being him and he didn't want to switch, so I agreed to walk back here with him."

Once again, Athena's eyes lit up like stars. "You say you don't want to switch back yet?" She asked Klavier giddily.

"If Mr. Justice allows it," Klavier replied, snapping a finger and pointing to Apollo. "See? She digs it and so do I, so why switch yet?"

Apollo frowned, "because the two of you are lawyers on opposite sides of a case. It's kind of a conflict of interest."

"We're all on the side of the truth Apollo, you know that, and I trust the two of you; so what do you say Cykes, want to prosecute a case?"

Athena seemed overjoyed at Klavier's offer, "heck yeah! I get to be a rockstar! You're gonna lose anyways, but yeah!"

Apollo brought a hand to his face and sighed. "Fine, if you two are really having that much fun, then you can stay. Just know that you're both taking a risk here." Suddenly, he felt himself wrapped up in an abrupt hug by Athena-as-Klavier.

"Whoo! You're the best, Apollo!" He heard Klavier laugh from Athena's body as she let him go. The whole thing left him deeply uncomfortable.

"Anyways, I gotta prepare for the case! Slept on the job it seems, let's go back to 'our' office, Herr Forehead," Klavier-as-Athena said.
142321221111111121212.title: He walks down to the crime scene with Klavier

choices: Apollo and Klavier decide what to do next
Trucy is at the office, and wants to know where they've been
1423212211111111212121.content:
"Alright, but first," Apollo said, pulling out the remote again, "I need to swap you two back, just for a second."

"What? Why?" Athena asked. "I thought we were staying swapped for now."

"I know, but I already selected you with the remote before I headed back to the office. If I use it on you two again, then it won't have anyone selected anymore."

"Planning on using the remote yourself, Herr Forehead?" Klavier asked. Apollo still found it pretty strange to hear Klavier's accent coming out of Athena's body. Speaking of accents, he hadn't noticed until he spoke to Klavier, but Athena in Klavier's body seemed to have been speaking without an accent. It wasn't as obvious, though, which was probably why Ema hadn't mentioned it before.

"No, but this way, if we need to use it, it'll be ready. Okay?" Klavier and Athena both agreed, and with the press of a button the pair were back in their own bodies. Apollo knew he could just leave everything back to normal like this, but he had agreed to let them keep each other's bodies for a while, and so, he almost immediately swapped them back.

"Well, good luck, you two," Athena said, a grin on her (or technically, Klavier's) face, before heading back to towards the crime scene to assist the police investigation, now that she was a prosecutor.

"You too," Klavier called out, while Apollo just waved goodbye to what used to be his colleague. He had a feeling this was probably going to be the strangest case he'd ever worked on in his life.

"Come on, let's go," Apollo said, turning away from the crime scene, and heading back towards the office. Klavier followed close behind, still somewhat marveling at how everything sounded with Athena's ears. Even though his colleague and the prosecutor on the case had switched places, Apollo was still going to take this case seriously, and was currently running over the facts in his head. He'd probably need to go back and investigate more later, but he and Athena had managed to get some good leads that he and Klavier could investigate; the knife, and the culprit's left-handedness. Although, without having Athena let them back into the crime scene, Apollo wasn't sure they'd actually be able to follow up on those leads just yet. Maybe they should go talk to Mr. Powers instead.

As they neared the Wright Anything Agency, Klavier finally broke the silence. "So, did you and Miss Cykes find any new leads while I was out, Herr Forehead?"

Apollo frowned. He was not putting up with this for however long the case would take. "Do you have to keep calling me that? It's weird hearing Athena say that."

Klavier grinned at Apollo's discomfort. "All the more reason to keep calling you that."

"Also, your accent makes it kind of obvious that you're not really Athena, you might want to work on that if you're going to be pretending to be her in court."

"Hm, maybe I could pull some strings to get a judge on the case who's never met us before. That might sort out a few problems."

Apollo couldn't deny that, provided he could actually arrange it, what Klavier said might actually work. He remember that Mr. Wright once told him that a prosecutor did a similar thing before to pose as a defense attorney while Mr. Wright was in hospital. "What about Trucy?"

"Hm?"

"Mr. Wright's out of the country right now, but Trucy's not. How are you going to fool her into thinking you're really Athena?"

"That... is a very good question. I'll cross that bridge when we get to it. Now come on, we have a case to prepare for."

"Yeah yeah, we're here." It hadn't even been that long, but Apollo was already starting to regret his decision to let Athena and Klavier stay switched. The two of them entered the office to go over the facts Apollo and Athena had learned while investigating.
1423212211111111212121.title: Follow Klavier and Apollo

142321221111111122.content:
"You need to lighten up!" Athena said. "We got the thing, why not use it? I say you switch! Maybe it'll help you get over your anxiety."

Apollo handed her the device, "fine, but you better be prepared to deal with whoever I switch with." Athena waved his complaints away and clicked at him. She looked over to the investigation, finding a new target.

"Hmm, well, since you apparently like switching with the ladies, I have a few choices, Apollo!" Apollo was about to protest but she cut him off.

"There's the lovely detective Skye, whom you already seem to know. With her body, we could easily cross the police line! Then there's also the policewoman at the perimeter," Athena gestured towards the woman securing the crime scene. She looked to be about 30 or so, wearing glasses, a light blue police shirt, and navy skirt. Her outfit was adorned with what looked like feathers as she stood at attention. "She doesn't look like she has much authority, but I bet she wouldn't cause as many problems for us down the line."

Apollo looked around, trying to find some sort of prosecutor or a male officer. "Gavin has to be somewhere - you sure I can't just switch with him?"

"If I saw him, I'd volunteer!" Athena exclaimed, giving Apollo a light thwack to the head, "anyways, I already clicked you in, and I'm naming those two as your only options! So, Detective Skye or Officer Birdlady! Make a choice."

Reluctantly, Apollo decided to go with her plan, and he chose...
142321221111111122.title: Apollo will switch with someone

1423212211111111221.content:
To be honest, Apollo didn't want to swap with either Ema or the female police officer, but Athena was making him choose. He eyed the two of them thinking about which one would be better to investigate as. Ema's clothes were mostly gender neutral, so he wouldn't have to deal with wearing women's clothing, but he would have to deal with hearing the voice of someone he knew come out of his mouth the whole time. On the other hand, the police officer was of lesser authority, so there was less of a chance of her being pulled away to go somewhere else.

As he thought about who to swap with Athena got impatient "Hurry up Apollo!." She yelled at him

"Hold it! I'm thinking." He said and went back to thinking it over

Athena got bored "Five seconds."

"Eh?" Apollo gasped as sh caught him of guard

"Four, Three, two.." Athena counted down with a grin on her face and her finger getting closer to the button.

"Hey, wait a second!" Apollo shouted at her.

"One!" Athena said as she pointed randomly at one of the girls and swapped Apollo with one of them.

-------

In an instant Apollo found himself beyond the police lines and in a new body. He looked down at himself. Ignoring than two unfamiliar bumps on his chest, he saw he was wearing a lab coat, a green button up shirt, and a pair of brown pants. It was obvious he was now in Ema's body.

He began to head outside the crime scene to get Athena. He got a few strange looks as it looked like the lead detective in charge of the case was leaving early. He made his way out to where Athena and his body were. To his surprise Athena was standing next to his unconscious body. He quickly ran over to check on his body. "What happened? Did she faint?" He asked Athena

"Oh, no, she didn't faint. I flipped her and knocked her out!" Athena said cheerfully. Which got a glare from Apollo "I had to, what if she screamed or something? People would have thought that you were crazy, I know I would."

Apollo put his face in his hands. He really should have expected that. "Please tell me that you didn't accidentally break my arm."

"I make no promises." Athena told him. "C'mon, we better get investigating."
1423212211111111221.title: Detective Skye

14232122111111112212.content:
The two of them propped up the unconscious Ema on a nearby bench. Apollo examined his body. It didn't seem like there were any major injuries, but he dreaded the inevitable switch back.

"Stop worrying 'Detective Skye'," Athena said as she slapped an uncomfortable Apollo on the back, "Apollo will be fiiiiine. We have an investigation to do! Forensics and all that right?"

"Yeah, right," Apollo replied unhappily. 'This better be worth it...'

---

An hour's worth of investigation later, Apollo and Athena managed to fill their court record with blood samples, fingerprints, shoeprints, and whatever other evidence they could find using Ema's tools. Apollo had to admit, the purse was embarrassing at first, but it's contents were useful. It was especially nice having Ema's trinkets at hand without having to convince her to help ahead of time. Being a woman was bit... strange, but unlimited freedom at the crime scene was amazing. Just a shame he had to suffer a judo flip to make it workable.

Speaking of, Apollo was beginning to worry about his body they had just left behind outside the scene. He hoped there wouldn't be anything serious when he switched back; the fact that his body was unconscious especially worried him.

"Alright Athena," he said in Ema's voice, "I think we need to switch me back now. I don't want to risk losing track of my body."

"Are you sure. That labcoat looks so good on you!"

"Seriously - if I'm going to need a crutch I ought to do it now rather than later," Apollo said, no longer joking.

Athena turned her eyes down, looking guilty. "Alright, here's the remote. I'm sure we'll get to look at the scene the normal way soon anyways," she said as she handed him the device. She then immediately cheered back up and said, "next time though, I switch with Detective Skye! I really like her hair."

"Well you'll need to get someone else to judo flip you," Apollo said idly as he walked out of the police barricade again to the bench where they left his body. He was thrust into this by Athena, and it really felt like he was violating Ema's privacy, even if he was just her for an hour, he was worried that he was 'experiencing' too much for comfort.

When he got to the bench though, was his body still there?
14232122111111112212.title: Skip to after the investigation

choices: "He seems to be suffering from amnesia."
142321221111111122122.content:
Apollo's - or rather, Ema's - heart stopped as he came across the bench to find it empty. He clapped a hand over Ema's face as his expression contorted in shock. 'Oh God no!'

He looked left to right, "where could she have gone!?" Surely she wouldn't have gone far of her own accord, right? If she went looking for her own body, then she'd most likely stay around the crime scene. He looked around, left to right, in a panic.

"Ms. Skye, what are you searching for?" the female officer from earlier asked.

"A man was here on this bench! Red suit, red hair, did you see him?!"

The cop seemed a bit frightened about how frazzled 'Ema' was over this. "Uh, well, the man was sleeping on the bench, and no matter what I did, he wouldn't wake up. So, I called the ambulance - they're taking him over to the Hickfield clinic."

'Dammit!' Someone must have noticed his unconscious body and called for help. Athena really overdid the throw. He wasn't going to let her hear the end of this, but first he had to get his body back. Not bothering to get Athena, he rushed over to the nearest police car. "Detective, what are you doing?" the officer asked, confused at the detective's actions.

"I need to go to the hospital," Apollo said. Fishing for an excuse, he quickly thought one up, "I found some important evidence, and I'm going to interview the victim once she wakes up. It's urgent." Hesitant to argue with a superior, the cop just nodded as Apollo turned the keys and drove to the ER, turning on sirens as he did.

---

Apollo didn't actually own a car, so his driving skills were rather rusty. Thankfully, the siren pulled through. Traffic moved aside for him as he used Ema's body to rush after the ambulance. Parking outside, he hurried into the clinic, clearly not used to running with his new center of balance.

"Detective Skye, with the police," Apollo said as he awkwardly fished Ema's police badge out of her coat pocket, flashing it to the lady at the desk. "I need to see a man who got brought here recently - he was found on a park bench?"

The woman was a bit taken aback by the sudden entrance of a cop, but she complied and looked through the files. "Ah yes! His ID said he was a Mr. Apollo Justice?"

Apollo smiled, grateful, "yes! Is he okay? I need to see him immediately."

The lady signaled for a doctor and inquired about the condition of Apollo' body. The doctor turned to Apollo-as-Ema and informed him that his body had just woken up as they entered the building, and that...
142321221111111122122.title: No

1423212211111111221222.content:
"Can I go see him now, please!?"

Oh, boy. Things were starting to get out of control. She's in his body right now! If she doesn't remember who she is, she might start thinking she's him!

Apollo got the go-ahead, and saw Ema-as-Apollo, flicking his hair horns with curiosity. She turned to him.

"Oh. Hello." Said Ema, still groggy. "Do I know you?"

Does Apollo tell the truth, and face the consequences whether Ema believes it or not? Or does he pretend to be Ema, and try to convince Ema that she's him?
1423212211111111221222.title: "He seems to be suffering from amnesia."

14232122111111112212222.content:
Apollo realized that all of this would be far too much to drop on an amnesiac Ema. She probably had at least a concussion - he'd just look crazy if he started babbling about body swaps to her! 'I just... have to play it off until her memories come back,' he realized. It was only once she was in her right mind that he could delineate what happened. She would certainly not be very happy with him after all of that, but it was the best he could do.

"Uh, yes!" Apollo replied, stepping forward with a hand outstretched. "I'm, uh, Ema," he explained, "I'm a detective. I was nearby when you were hurt, but..." Apollo paused. He needed to spin this, "...we're actually best friends!" The case hadn't even started and he was already caught in a bluff.

"Oh," Ema replied, rubbing the back of her head. "You do look familiar..." she mumbled. "Er, if its not too much trouble, what's my name again?"

"Uh, well, you're Apollo Justice, a lawyer," Apollo told her as he nervously put his hands in the pockets of Ema's lab coat. "You're partner got a bit reckless and accidentally knocked you over. Don't worry though, you'll be fine!"

Ema shook her head a bit, "I'm just not recalling anything, but something feels off. Are you sure I'm an attorney?"

"Yeah! Positive! Just say it with me - 'I'm Apollo Justice and I'm fine!'" Apollo shouted with Ema's voice. "It always makes you feel better! Just let it rip!"

Ema cleared her throat. "I'm Apollo Justice and I'm fine!" There was a brief moment of silence before Ema shook her head, "I don't know Ema, I didn't get much out of that."

"Well, I'm going to walk you out of here, okay?" Apollo suggested. "I'll take you back to my- I mean your, office, and we'll have Athena watch after you. Just, follow me, please?"

---

"And so, Athena, its very important that you keep a close eye on Apollo until he gets back all of his memories. Okay?" Apollo concluded, after explaining the situation to Athena back at the Wright Anything Agency. He was glaring daggers at her from Ema's body, while Ema herself was taking inventory of the messy lobby.

Athena nodded nervously, "uh, of course Detective Skye. Trucy and I will take very good care of him." She ran her hands through her ponytail nervously, clearly hearing the anger in Apollo's voice. It was her brutal methods that caused this whole scenario, after all.

Thankfully for her, Ema's phone began to ring, playing the theme song to Pink Princess. Apollo fished it out of Ema's bag and looked at it with a grimace, "great, its Gavin." Without hesitating, he clicked a button and hung up the phone.

"Well, you're already getting into character pretty well, right?" Athena said jokingly, trying to ease the tension.

Apollo turned his attention back to Athena. "I have to run back to the crime scene, but I'll have more words for you later. You're going to have to handle this case in court tomorrow, and I won't be able to help you as the detective, so be prepared."

Athena winced at the thought, but nodded nervously. "Er, don't worry! I'll be fine, probably."

Apollo just shook his head, and turned his attention back to Ema in his body. "Uh, Apollo, I have to go now, but Trucy will watch after you! If Athena gives you trouble, just call me, okay?" he said, trying to sound assuring as he thwacked Athena in the head before waving goodbye.

"Uh, yeah, bye Detective Skye! I'll be fine... I think?"
14232122111111112212222.title: Apollo pretends to be Ema.

142321221111112.content:
Apollo saw Juniper push the button on the remote, expecting to be thrust back into his own body. However, nothing seemed to happen. Looking down, he still saw Juniper's body and the dress she had been wearing when they swapped. Did Juniper miss? Maybe she pressed the wrong button? Was this actually his body, but he just couldn't tell because Juniper had performed an unaware swap or something?

His fears were unfounded, however. There was a reason why he was still in Juniper's body, but it wasn't because Juniper had pressed the wrong button, as Apollo was about to find out. He suddenly heard his own body scream, and with his chords of steel, the scream was loud enough that Apollo found himself actually having to cover his ears. His body seemed to be staring at Athena, a terrified look in its eyes. It was then that he noticed Athena was also covering her ears, a somewhat guilty look on her face.

Athena turned to look at him, slowly lowering her hands from her ears, and said just one word; "Oops."

Apollo's jaw dropped as he realised what had happened. In her haste to swap back, Juniper had accidentally targeted Athena instead of him. Which meant that now he was still in Juniper's body, she was in Athena's body, and Athena was in his body. That would explain the screaming.

Before either he or Juniper could say anything, Athena, in Apollo's body, yelled again. "What's going on!? Why am I standing over there!? Why am I Apollo!?" She didn't seem to be taking the swap as well as Juniper had when she and Apollo had first swapped.

"Athena, calm down, it's going to be okay," Apollo said, trying to do his best to calm her down.

It didn't seem to work. "Junie!? You're in on this too!?"

"Um, actually, I'm Apollo." Apollo tried to break the news to her as lightly as possible, and failed miserably.

Athena went silent, her jaw dropping as she looked back and forth between Apollo and Juniper in her body. "Then, you," she mumbled, pointing at Juniper.

Juniper nodded, "I'm really Juniper."

Athena looked almost ready to faint. "I think I need to sit down." She sat in silence for a moment, breathing deeply in an attempt to calm herself down. In the meantime, Apollo and Juniper looked at each other awkwardly, not really sure what to say. Juniper still had a bit of a guilty look on her face, knowing she had caused this, even if it was by accident. Athena, having finally calmed down a bit, said, "Alright, you guys had better start explaining."

Apollo explained the situation to Athena, just like he had to Juniper before. This time, though, he had to add on the part about swapping with Juniper and everything. Juniper also added her own comments to the explanation. Athena sat silent through the entire story, listening to every word, occasionally looking down at the remote she had found in her hand when was suddenly swapping into Apollo's body. How does Athena react once they're done explaining?
142321221111112.title: Athena

14232122111112.content:
"Junie, I'm worried about you. You're not acting like yourself. Just, go home and relax, please. I'll call Apollo on the way over to the detention center if you're that worried about letting him know."

Apollo could see the genuine concern on Athena's face. Then again, he supposed he'd be concerned too if one of his best friends suddenly started acting differently for seemingly no reason. It would probably be best to just pretend to go home to put Athena's worries to rest, and then actually go back to the Wright Anything Agency and swap back with Juniper so he could handle this case.

"Okay 'Thena," he said, remembering to use the nickname that Juniper referred to Athena as this time. "I guess I haven't really been feeling like myself today." He held in a smirk after saying that. Athena had no idea how true that really was.

"Alright, just get some rest, and I'll talk to you later, okay?" Apollo was glad to see Athena seemed to have calmed down a bit.

"Okay. Bye."

"See you later."

Apollo saw Athena start walking off in the direction of the detention center, pulling out her phone as she went. Hopefully Juniper would be able to imitate him well enough over the phone, and Athena wouldn't end up concerned about his well-being as well. With Athena on her way, Apollo also left Global Studios, heading towards the Wright Anything Agency. With any luck, he should be back into his own body soon, working on a new case, and Juniper could go home, back in her own body as well. He hadn't gotten to spend that much time in Juniper's body, thanks to Athena dragging him off to Global Studios, but it didn't really matter right now.

Finally making it back to the office, Apollo knocked on the door, before seeing if it was unlocked. With a quick turn of the handle, Apollo was inside the office, hoping to see Juniper and swap back.
14232122111112.title: She insists that Juniper head home and rest

142321221111122.content:
Apollo entered the Wright Anything Agency office, expecting to see Juniper in his body sitting at his desk or something. To his surprise, the office was actually completely devoid of human life. Apollo started to get worried.

"Juniper?" he called out, hoping she was just in the bathroom or something. He received silence in response. "Juniper?" he asked again, his voice sounding a little more panicked this time, and he started searching around the office. He checked every room, multiple times, but it was no use; Juniper was nowhere to be found.

Apollo sat down on the office couch, taking deep breaths in an attempt to calm down, feeling the steady rise and fall of Juniper's chest as he did so. He tried to think about why Juniper would have left the office. Athena had called who she thought was Apollo to tell him about the case, but Juniper wouldn't have actually gone down to the detention center, would she? Thinking back to what he had told Juniper when the two of them first swapped, he remembered his reasons for the swap in the first place; to take the day off. Sure, he had only meant to get away from all the paperwork Mr. Wright had loaded him up with, and once he found out about Mr. Powers getting arrested he wanted to get back into his own body and investigate, but Juniper didn't know that. Had she left to go meet Athena at the detention center just to make sure Apollo still got his day off?

Now Apollo was worried not only about himself being stuck as Juniper, but also about Juniper trying to handle the investigation. Sure, Juniper was studying at Themis Academy, but she hadn't actually graduated yet, and she was studying to become a judge, not a lawyer. She would be way out of her element here, and Apollo was sure Athena would be able to pick up on that fairly quickly, just like she had picked up on his odd behavior earlier. Apollo had wanted to use the remote to finally find some time to relax, and yet all it had brought was more stress. If he wasn't so worried about what was going on, he might have laughed at the irony of it all.

He stood up once more, pacing around the room as he considered his options. He and Juniper needed to swap back as soon as possible. Sure, he had told Athena that he'd be heading home and relaxing, and Athena might not appreciate that he had lied to her, but this seemed a lot more important right now. He'd just have to head down to the detention center, and hopefully Athena and Juniper would still be there, and then he and Juniper could swap back. There was only one problem with that plan; he had left the remote here at the office when he left in Juniper's body. Without that, he'd be unable to do anything about this situation. He may as well just continuing with his day off, an idea which seemed very appealing right now. He shook his head, dismissing those thoughts, not wanting to leave Juniper stuck doing the investigation in his place. He started searching amongst all paperwork on his desk, hoping that Juniper had left the remote here when she left.
142321221111122.title: Juniper wasn't there

choices: Juniper heads back to the office
Juniper insists that Apollo takes the day off
1423212211111222.content:
Apollo's search for the remote ended up being just as fruitless as his search for Juniper; there wasn't a trace of either of them. He collapsed back down onto the couch, letting out a big sigh. Juniper must have taken it with her when she left. It made sense, he had told her not to lose it, after all. That made things even more complicated. If he had the remote, he could have swapped back with Juniper while still staying out of sight of Athena. After how worried she'd been about him back at Global Studios, he really didn't want her worrying even more, nor did he want her to know he had lied about going home and relaxing. Juniper would be the one dealing with the consequences after they swapped back, so Apollo didn't want to mess up her friendship with Athena.

If only there was a way to get to Juniper, and the remote, without getting Athena involved. But how? After a few minutes of coming up with nothing, the office phone caught Apollo's eye. Of course, his phone! Athena had called Juniper on the way over the the detention center, so it seemed likely that Juniper still had his mobile phone with her. If he could call her and get her to come back to the office while Athena kept investigating, they'd be able to sort this whole thing out.

Quickly running over the the phone, kicking around some of Trucy's magic stuff that had been left around the office as he did so, Apollo dialed the number of his mobile phone and held the receiver up to his ear.

After a bit of ringing, he eventually head his own voice from the other side of the call. "Hello?" he heard.

"Juniper, it's me," he said.

There was a pause, before Juniper spoke again, sounding somewhat muffled, as if she wasn't talking directly into the phone. "I've got to take this call, I'll be back in a second." She seemed to be doing a pretty good job of imitating him. After some sounds that indicated she was leaving whatever room she was in, she said, "Hi Apollo." Her voice seemed quiet, almost like she was whispering. She was probably at the detention center, and didn't want other people hearing this conversation.

"Juniper, I'm sorry about this. I didn't think a case would come up while we were swapped."

"Huh? You know about the case?"

'I, uh, ran into Athena while I was wating at the bus stop. She took me to Global Studios, and that's where we found out about Mr. Powers' arrest."

"Oh. So you haven't really gotten to relax on your day off, then?"

"That doesn't really matter right now. Do you have the remote with you?"

"Yes. You told me not to lose it, so I took it with me."

Apollo let out a sigh of relief, knowing that Juniper still had the remote and it wasn't actually lost. "Okay, good. If you come back to the office, we can swap back, and then I'll take over the investigation."

"Huh?" Juniper seemed surprised to hear Apollo asking to swap back. "I thought we swapped so you could have the day off, though."

"Well, yeah, but that was when it was just paperwork that I had to do. Now that Athena and I have an actual case, I really should get back to work."

"Are you sure? I can handle this, if you want, and you can just relax today. We can swap back tonight and I'll fill you in on how the investigation went."

Apollo frowned. Was Juniper trying to convince him to not swap back? It certainly seemed that way, but Apollo wasn't really sure why. Maybe she was actually enjoying being in his body and didn't want to swap back yet. Apollo almost wished he felt the same way about her body, but he hadn't really had much time to get used to it with the case springing up so suddenly. He still wasn't sure whether Juniper could handle doing the investigation in his place, and do a good enough job of it to fool Athena.

"I still think it would be better if we swapped back and I did the investigation myself. That way, there's less of a chance of Athena finding out about the swap."
1423212211111222.title: The remote is also missing

choices: He runs into Trucy on his way out
14232122111112222.content:
"Really Apollo, just take the day off and relax. I can handle the investigation." Juniper assured him over the phone.

"But what if Athena finds out about the swap? No offense, but I don't think you could act like me." Apollo tried to reason with her.

"Um, actually, I think I've been doing a good job so far. The only time Athena thought something was wrong was when I called her 'Thena by mistake." Juniper explained to him.

Apollo felt a bit bad. He had done a horrible job a pretending to be Juniper when he was out and Juniper had apparently done a pretty good job at being him. Maybe he should let her handle the investigation for today? "Are you sure you're okay doing this?" He asked again.

"Yeah. I took some extra classes on investigating crime scenes. Robin and Hugh also talks to me about what they learn. I'll be fine. 'I'm fine'" She said, imitating Apollo at the end.

Hearing Juniper imitate his usual phrase was, unnerving to say the least. Apollo thought about what to do. It really seemed like Juniper wanted to stay as him for the day, but he couldn't just leave the investigation to someone else. After thinking it over for a minute or so, he decided to let her stay as him.

"Okay, but call me as soon as you are done so we can swap back." He told her.

"Thank you Apollo. I'll investigate as good as I can. Enjoy your day off." Juniper said then hung up the phone.

Apollo sat down on the couch and wondered what to do, he figured he should just go to Juniper's house and relax like he planned to do in the first place. He stood up and began to head out of the office, hoping that nothing would go wrong with Juniper and Athena
14232122111112222.title: Juniper insists that Apollo takes the day off

choices: Skip to the end of the day
142321221111122221.content:
Apollo readied himself to leave the office in Juniper's body for the second time today. This time though, he knew there was a case he should be working on that Juniper was taking care of for him. It was hard to get his mind off of it.

"Come on, Apollo, you can do this," he told himself. "Just relax and enjoy the day like Juniper wanted you to." He let out a small laugh, realised what he had said. He was still calling himself Apollo, but he wasn't really Apollo anymore. As far as the rest of the world was concerned, he was Juniper Woods. It was an odd thought to say the least, but Apollo thought that perhaps if he focused on who he was right now, rather than who he really was inside, perhaps it'd help him take his mind off the case. Taking a page out of his usual Chords of Steel routine, Apollo shouted, "I'm Juniper Woods, and I'm fi-" He was cut off as he broke into a coughing fit. It seemed Juniper's voice wasn't ready for something like that. "Bad idea," he said to himself as he recovered, before stepping outside and heading back to the bus stop he'd been waiting at before Athena dragged him away.

Even though he'd been running around in Juniper's body practically all day, Apollo still felt strange to be walking around in public like this. He could feel the wind blowing around the light fabric of Juniper's dress, and her long braid pulling down on the back of his head. It was all rather strange, but none of it particularly unpleasant. He'd just need to get used to it. Thankfully, this time the bus arrived before anyone came and dragged him away, and he was able to get on without anyone recognising him. After how he'd struggled to pretend to be Juniper while talking to Athena, he didn't really want to go through that again. Apollo mostly occupied himself during the bus ride by playing around with Juniper's dress and hair. It still fascinated him that he was actually in someone else's body, and those were the parts he could mess around with without attracting unwanted attention or violating Juniper's privacy.

It didn't take long for him to reach his destination. The bus dropped him off at a stop near Juniper's house, the forest she lived near not too far in the distance. He headed off towards the forest, after first making sure he had Juniper's phone with him so she could contact him after the investigation.
142321221111122221.title: He goes to Juniper's house

choices: Athena had come back to get something from the office
1423212211111222212.content:
Apollo stood at the bus stop, waiting for the bus that would take him back into town, the sun starting to set over the horizon. Today had been a pretty good day. He had finally been able to get away from the stress of his job, and the worries that had been brought on by the shenanigans earlier with Athena. He had also gotten a lot more used to being in Juniper's body during the day, although he still assumed he'd probably fail if he needed to imitate her in front of people she knew. He actually wouldn't mind doing this again some time, if his job got a little too stressful, provided Juniper was okay with it, of course.

But right now, it was time to get back to his own body. Juniper had called him a couple minutes ago to tell him that she and Athena had finished investigating for the day. Athena had apparently left to walk Trucy home, since Mr. Wright was currently off in Kurain, before heading home herself, while "Apollo" had been left to close up the office. He almost laughed at how typical it was that he had been the one left to finish up work, but right now he was glad about it, because it meant he and Juniper could swap back and go over the details from the case without any interruptions.

Eventually, the bus came, practically empty at this time of day, and Apollo rode back into town. From there, it was just a small walk to the office. He knocked on the door, before opening it up and stepping inside.
1423212211111222212.title: Skip to the end of the day

choices: Apollo and Juniper meet up at his apartment.
14232122111112222122.content:
Apollo practically felt his (or rather, Juniper's) heart stop when he saw who was inside the office. Along with Juniper, who was still in his body, Athena was also there. Apollo could only guess that she had returned to the office after walking Trucy home. He didn't know for what reason she had returned, but that didn't matter. What mattered was that she was here, and that created complications for him and Juniper.

"Oh, Junie? What are you doing here?" she asked, noticing Apollo standing at the doorway.

"I, um..." Apollo stumbled over his words, struggling to think of an excuse that wouldn't arouse suspicion.

Thankfully, Juniper managed to come to his rescue before Athena could notice anything. "Oh, Juniper," she said, walking towards the door, holding a bag in her hand. "You left this here this morning, I thought you might want it back." On closer inspection, Apollo recognised it as the bag Juniper had used to bring him the food this morning. He also noticed that Juniper seemed much more confident than she had been when he left this morning. Either she was just a very good actress, or being in his body was having that sort of effect on her.

Having been given a way out, Apollo decided to simply play along for the time being. "Oh, thank you. I was actually here to get that."

"You know you could have just stopped by in the morning. We normally close the office around this time of night," Athena said.

"Yeah, I guess you're right. I probably should have thought of that." The smile on Athena's face didn't go unnoticed by Apollo. He guessed he was probably doing a better job at imitating Juniper this time. Although he was ready to swap back now, he was at least glad he wasn't making Athena worry anymore.

Juniper handed him the bag, but as he did so, he saw her mouth the word "Sorry." Since he was facing towards the office, he wouldn't really be able to mouth anything back without Athena seeing, so Apollo merely responded with a small nod. She seemed to get the message.

"Well, I guess I should get going," Apollo said, turning to leave the office again, unfortunately still in Juniper's body.

"Bye," Juniper said, still playing the role of "Apollo", and playing it well.

"See ya!" Athena shout, waving goodbye as she was none the wiser.

Once outside, Apollo pulled out Juniper's phone again, and began typing up a text message as he walked. It read, "Meet up at my place, we can talk and swap back there. My address is in my wallet." Sending the message to his own phone number, Apollo continued walking back to his apartment, hoping Athena wouldn't keep Juniper back too long.
14232122111112222122.title: Athena's there too.

14233.content: Apollo thought some more about who to swap himself with, there were some other people who seemed to have life easier than he does.
14233.title: Someone Else

142333.content: More people Apollo could swap with
142333.title: Someone else

1423332.content:
As Apollo pondered the device, he scanned the junk in the room an noticed something out of place.

"I don't recall ordering a television..." he muttered as a cardboard box rumbled in the corner of the room. His face contorted into a frown - he was pretty sure he knew who this was.

"Well! It's probably nothing," he said loudly as he sauntered over to that side of the room and sat down on the box. The box began to shake more, but Apollo didn't budge. Eventually, he could hear grunting as the figure underneath the box began to cry out.

"Get off!" A distinctly female voice shouted.

"Oh!" Apollo shouted sarcastically as he got up. "I'm sorry about that Myriam - didn't notice you there at all."

"Well of course you didn't," Myriam declared as she got up, box still covering her torso. "Not with my new box! TVs are always in demand, no one would consider such a box out of place."

Apollo just gave an exasperated sigh. "What are you doing here Myriam? You don't need a lawyer, do you?"

"No! I'm here investigating," she announced. "I want to know all about the new Wright Law office! Mr. Wright is a bit of a legend among attorneys; his return to the field with the UR-1 case is big news. I'd be a fool to ignore the chance to get a scoop on the new Wright Law Office!"

Apollo just stared at her blankly. "You already had the connection via Juniper, you could have just asked for an interview."

Myriam was quiet for a moment. That thought hadn't occurred to her apparently. "...can I get an interview with Mr. Wright?"

"No," Apollo responded, "he's not in right now."

"Well what about Ms. Cykes!" she asked again.

"Still no," Apollo answered, "she's also out at the moment."

"Well what about you, Mr. Justice!" she asked. "You're Mr. Wright's protege, that's like, pretty close to getting an interview with him. Pleeeeeease?"

Apollo stopped and thought about it. Well... she's sort of an arbitrary choice, Apollo realized as he fiddled the device around in his hand. I suppose that means there's no consequence if it doesn't work atleast. Apollo turned his attention back to Myriam and asked "how about something more than an interview. What would you say if I could give you a true, in-depth, undercover look at the office?"

Myriam became so excited she threw her box into the air, briefly revealing her face. "Really?!" she shouted, her voice clear for a moment before the box fell back over her body. "You would do that for me?!" She didn't even seem to notice the box's little adventure.

"Yup, just hold still," he said as he lifted the remote and clicked one of the buttons.
1423332.title: Myriam Scutlebutt

14233321.content:
Suddenly things were dark. Apollo could only see through a small ray of light - two holes cut out in front of him. As his vision adjusted to the light, he realized all of a sudden that he was looking at himself, and he seemed to be panicking.

"What the - how the - why!" Myriam began to scramble about in Apollo's body, not sure what just happened. Apollo heard the remote hit the floor and - with some difficulty due to the box - bent over to lift it up. Myriam didn't seem to notice it, as she was still in shock.

"What did you do!" she shouted, pointing at Apollo.

"I'm giving you your scoop!" Apollo responded, surprised at his newly pitched voice (that was muffled by cardboard). "You said you wanted to investigate the office, right?" He was a bit put-off by the whole thing himself, but after the trouble Myriam gave them during the trial with Juniper, he sort of enjoyed seeing her squirm a bit.

"Like - like this though? How did you even do this?"

"It doesn't matter how," Apollo responded, putting his hands on his hips, "the point is it worked," He was rather glad she seemed to forget about the device for the moment."Anyways, you enjoy your journalism. I'm going to take the day off," Apollo told her as he walked towards the door in her body. "I'll be back by 6! Don't worry, most of the paperwork is done. Just try to relax."

Myriam looked like a deer in headlights as Apollo left the office. He couldn't believe he just did that, but he had to admit, it was fun getting back at a troublesome witness like that. Once he was outside, he realized he was still wearing her ridiculous box, which he threw off quickly... a number of pens, notebooks, and the like tumbling out immediately. "Atleast she didn't put her laptop in it," he noted. The remote was still in his hands, and he realized she didn't have pockets with her uniform. "Why can't she just carry a purse like a normal girl? Ugh. Well, I'm going to need to stash the remote SOMEWHERE."

Looking at his watch, Apollo reasoned that Themis would still be open for a bit, since extracurriculars were always underway there. Myriam probably had a locker or a safe spot to put the device in the journalism clubroom. She was the only member, so it wasn't like anyone would steal it. Alternatively, Apollo figured he could trust it to someone he knew. Having Trucy or Athena aware of the situation, while a bit embarrassing, would at least give him someone to keep an eye on Myriam in his body. He sure as hell wasn't going to wear that box all around town was all he knew.
14233321.title: Aware Swap

142333212.content:
Apollo thought over his options. While the remote would be safe at Themis academy, he didn't know his way around the academy, that included where the journalism clubroom was. He didn't want to waste most of the day walking around a school looking for one room. Plus there was the slim chance that he would run into someone who knew Scuttlebutt and he didn't want to deal with pretending to be her.

Although he was sure he'd be laughed and be the center of jokes, the safest place to keep the remote was with someone he knew. He thought over who to give it to while walking along the sidewalk. Trucy or Athena seemed to be the obvious choices, but would it be best to trust them with the remote? Either of them would probably use the remote to pull pranks against him, then again, he used the remote to get a day off, was he any better than they would be. He didn't have to give it to one of them though, there were plenty of other people he could give it to for safe keeping, maybe someone who wouldn't laugh at the fact that he was now in a girl's body

After thinking it over he decided to give it to...

Klavier woke up in the morning and did his usual morning routine of styling his hair, practicing his guitar, and coming up with new lyrics for song. 1511.title: Rockin' body switchin'

Once he got home he went to his recording studio, grabbed his guitar and began to practice for the concert in three days. Klavier went to a full body mirror he kept around his home at all times and began to talk to himself in it "We rocked Fraulein! If I just practice this a few hours a day for the next few days I should have it down." He said to himself. While standing at the mirror he had a chance to take his body and clothes into account.
